GdPxOeyC9jVJnt-_-ZDaGQ.text: First time in Vegas and was out for dinner and met our group here.. Beer was good. Don't get the calamari it wasn't the best.. everyone else's food looked decent but the calamari was sub par. The service wasn't good either.. wasn't packed but our server forgot simple things like beer orders and silverware..

_Y512k-jVZsZXzaR17ou9g.text: We were visiting Vegas and decided to visit this restaurant based in Yelp reviews. We were very impressed with the food quality, prices and excellent service. My husband and I both had the prime rib- it was cooked perfectly and brought to us right away. The service we received was very prompt and friendly.  Prices were very reasonable. Our meal plus a couple drinks each was under $50!  We'll be back to visit the next time we are in town!

ebPytJUZioalhNsg7DkBNQ.text: Completely surprised by this place.   Probably the best loco moco I've ever had outside of O'ahu. They even have Yama Moto Yama green tea, which fyi is *the* tea of choice. Though there is an underlying Hawaiian flavor to many small details throughout Main Street Casino... not sure why that is.  Anyway, Ronnie was excellent. She knows what's up. And for a 3 am dining experience, Triple 7 was everything.

dVKPLcjL-EsFfkscu5TM5g.text: My God what happened? This used to be our go to place. This night it was terrible. We sit at the oyster bar as usual. I ordered a dozen raw oysters. The lady working sent me oysters stuck to the shell, full of grit and shell chunks. Then I ordered a dragon roll. This thing had the consistency of peanut butter. Inedible! Rice way over cooked. If this happens again, we are done.

Bq4RbeH1e-_qSisWKvm5vQ.text: Roach on the table. Service is great. Food is excellent. This leaves me turned off at the moment, but I can't help hoping it was an accident, for lack of a better word.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Chicken Sandwich
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Potato
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LnIHBdtMYZZbIJIrXNPwTQ.text: Not happy!  Staying at hotel went down for late night happy hour at 10:55 and they were closing!!!!!  Asked the hostess earlier in the day and she said happy hour was from 3-6 and 11pm to 2 or 3 am. Website says they are open til 7am!!  not acceptable.  Advice to Yelpers, find a new late night happy hour place. Totally unhappy!  This has been our favorite downtown spot for years!  Not anymore

yDgUK1WGZP1STyS1HwHb-A.text: Been here a few times, this time was way better than the past. I'm not big on beer so I go for the food. Met a few friends here. There is always a line to be seated. So be prepared to wait a few minutes.   This place looks like someone built a brewery around a sports bar that happens to have a sushi station in it. Really need looking. Large televisions with sports or ESPN playing and giant beer tanks. Tons of tables and tons of noise.   I ordered the chicken strip meal $10.99 and a water. Omg the water and soda cups are huge!!! I felt like I had just ordered a big gulp. Amazingly enough i ordered another water. The heat makes you thirsty. The chicken strips are huge you get three big strips that are about the size of half a chicken breast each. They are so juicy. I ordered ranch and honey mustard to dip. Stay away from the honey mustard it has a reddish-orange color and doesn't taste right. The ranch is good though! Also comes with fries, carrot and celery, and cole slaw. I thought the cole slaw was bland not enough dressing. The fries were perfect. All and all I would ask for extra ranch. So much food between the 8 of us!!!   Good to order: chicken strip meal, fried calamari, bucket of shrimp, cheese bread.   Steer clear of: Asian chicken salad! Salad lacks flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tenders

f4lFPjxznGDTCuoRJKpkKw.text: I wish I could give 0 stars. Waited an hour for the worst steak I have ever eaten. And the potato tasted like powder.

VIMFMfSZ2HRiRBwtz-Jp5w.text: The wait for table was long, found two seats at the bar quick.  Ordered the wings with home mustard sauce, yum.   Got a pizza order, it was ok. I don't think the cheese fully melted or the crust didn't crust up.

Kva8WuNKOfBstV7p7W3jAw.text: Going to keep this short.  Triple 7 is a cool local place that serves cheap (VERY DECENT) craft beers (23 oz $3.95) and typical bar foods (CHEAP) with sushi randomly thrown in there.   From my experience... skip the prime rib, it was pretty ugly, overcooked and well ugly.  They run food specials all the time depending on the nearby holiday, but your mileage will vary on the taste. Stick to the classics (burgers, sandwiches, salads, etc) to be safe.   They brews come in a good classic variety: kolsch, pale lager, red ale, stout, and porter. They carry special releases like their cherry stout that I heard is a must.   I don't know the quality of the sushi or fish freshness at Triple 7, but there is a Japanese chef if that helps lol.   Overall place to visit as a tourist and a local for some low key bonding time with the homies.

c5-pPQq92rwQZDJk8tB2Kw.text: I'm a big fan of beer, no no, HUGE fan. I used to live in Oregon where beer is king and this place and their microbrews definitely contend with some great beers! My favorite, the Royal Red! It's the only beer of theirs that I drink because it's so damned good, like goes down smooth with a great flavor, just can't get enough! Not to mention the beer prices are phenomenal and during happy hour are even better!  The food here is great, I don't think i've ever had anything bad, EVER. Their regular menu food is awesome and their "standard bar faire" is more than that. it's "kick ass bar faire" Garlic fries are a must have!   Service has always been fantastic! This is one of my favorite local spots for sure and I take everyone I know there!

Jv2TXkGiJCS0yITxrTTXsg.text: One of Vegas' best restaurant. If you can get there for happy hour M-F even better price! Medium prices, not expensive by any stretch. Crab dip is excellent! Oysters Rockefeller is excellent! Peal and eat shrimp is a nice little side to snack on. Middle of the night craving? Try their soup only offered during the late night hours. Their beer is delicious, make sure to try it. My favorite is their raspberry beer however it's seasonal and there's always something new to try.   Recommended Foods: Crab & Artichoke Dip, Ribs - the meat is so so tender it falls off the bone. Literally! Pizza is just okay, a take it or leave it dish, peel and eat shrimp, hamburgers, sandwiches, prime rib is good... portions are generous, more than enough!   (Went back today, had the dip and ribs again... yummy! Parmigiana sandwich was not that good though the cream of corn soup was very good)

Kb_9cD_QlLhngsiTb45yBw.text: It's definitely not swanky, but it will satisfy with a little bit of everything on this menu.  Think Applebee's, but with good microbrews.  If you drink, then you must get the beer sampler.  You're not really coming for the food.  Remember that.  I hit this spot pretty regularly whenever I am in Vegas (because Downtown gambling and people-watching FAR outranks the Strip).  It has all the bad food you crave during the rat race of salads and Diet Cokes.  Even if there is a line out front, waiting to get in, just hang tight because it moves fast, no matter how large the group.  Very similar to a buffet cattle call.  Just eat, drink and be merry here!

s-BD2j1L7lfrbx2vFuvCTA.text: Recently went on a trip to Vegas and went to Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery, where we'd regularly go to when we lived out in Las Vegas. We can't help but go here with the affordable prices for food and its yummy! Service is just as good there too. Every time we've had such friendly waiters or waitresses and they are always there filling up your glass with your beverage! Never an empty soda/water glass!  We ordered their cheese bread (the size of a pizza), oozing with melty, gooey cheese. Every piece you pick up, the cheese just stretches along until you have to break it apart with your hand. With its greasy, cheesy goodness, each bite is delish!  Hubby ordered the pepperoni pizza, which was just as tasty as the cheese bread but with pepperoni on top. I ordered their 1/2 lb prime rib, which was cooked to perfection. The 1/2 lb prime rib is a steal! For only about $8.99, you get the 1/2 lb prime rib, vegetables and a choice of a baked potato, rice or fries. I opted for the baked potato. Just thinking of how it was makes my mouth water. If you're downtown and looking for affordable food and great service, I recommend Triple 7.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The 1/2 lb prime rib w/ veggies and baked potato

yZ-Xpyqs-OfVj7o74wui5A.text: We came here for lunch because we were kind of over the buffets already and the portions were just right for one person, I had the Portobello mushroom sandwich and it was very tasty, I am not very good at describing taste but I really liked it and recommend it. our waitress was really nice and she always made sure that our drinks were full, there are a lot of screens so you can watch whatever sports you are into so it looks like a good place to sit at the bar and watch sports all day.

wG2ZK1rPEvq_mf4x7CebRA.text: This restaurant is 24 hours and has their own brewery. The food is decently priced and the portions are average. I've heard that the late night menu is really cheap and good but I've never tried it, it starts really late or I should say early in the morning like 2am I think.   The waitresses are friendly and everything is done in a timely manner.   I had the prime rib a couple of times which was really fatty and tough.   I've also had the salmon which is good with the salsa on the side.   Overall a decent place to eat with a bar and TVs as well. ^_^*~

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. prime rib 2010
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2010
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2010

vfIyLYq6i2HyyFKRHYFMpg.text: This restaurant was a disappointment in almost every category. When we arrived around 4:30 PM there were empty tables and open spots at the bar, yet the hostess was moving so slowly seating people that a line had built up at the entrance. The people in line waiting weren't even told that the bar was open seating so they could bypass the line if they chose to. Empty tables = lost sales; no excuse for that situation. One of the reasons I chose this restaurant was the on site brewery, but when I opened the menu to the beer to see what local micro brews were available, I was told that they were out of three of their six options. The one I ordered tasted more like the ubiquitous coors lite than a craft brew. The food came fast, and was about on par with the price; I will not be returning.

e_BZCbMGwdChMc-MQEKsmg.text: Over at Main Street Station Downtown. Great place to go for Monday Night Football.  Excellent food and atmosphere!  Lots of big screen TVs located up high so the people sitting in front if you don't feel like you are staring at them all the time. Good prices and menu plentiful. Microbrewery Beers are excellent!  A+

tarrBTKxYBg9nPimkdeVhw.text: I had the Korean tacos, it was delicious! We all shared the Hamachi , pot stickers,and edamame! The service was excellent, Jody, Mike, Ana were awesome!

cZhDqrr0plooMbRJOf1F5g.text: The food was what I expected, nothing spectacular. The service was less than par and the bathroom was outside the restaurant and around the corner. But I did see Kanye here, so five stars.

GMNqhwtHLcgXTbMh2PwcrA.text: I ate here three times while I stayed at the Main Street Station. The service was bad and the food was fair. The beer and the beer specials are great. The sushi was poor and the sandwich I had was bad. I heard the oxtail soup was good but I didn't try it. The cheeseburger was burnt and unseasoned. The fries were cold. My friend John Tip. liked his Philly Cheesesteak Sandwich. The service was the worst when the place was empty. I tried the steak special and I was very disappointed. The steak tasted like it was cooked frozen. The eggs were cooked well. The drinks were good except for the water. Beer and Ale are the Key.

AVNrHOnBSu8_tbacjDpEbA.text: Whenever I'm in Las Vegas I look forward to eating at 777.  On this latest trip I ate here twice.  Not a lot, but we venture out a lot and aren't usually in the Casino's until later in the evenings.  One of the must haves for me is their oyster shooters.  Nothing really special about them but they're a great price.  Plus they usually have 2 oysters per glass, better deal.  Oh, yah, don't forget the beer too.  If you have a meal book from the hotel they even cover some of the items they sell.  We went for happy hour one day when we were unloading all our shopping back at the room.  We decided to have some drinks and pupu.  We ordered their new flat bread pizza, deep fried calamari, spicy tuna maki roll, and their oyster shooters.  I had a Blackchip porter and my wife had a mojito.  The flat bread pizza was supposedly a new menu item.  It had good flavor but being a pizza lover I wished it had a more crispy crust.  Still, a good pizza.  Their deep fried calamari is really good.  Their batter is very light and very crispy.  Goes perfectly with their dipping sauce.  The spicy tuna roll was better than you'd expect from a bar in Vegas.  I've had better, but I'va also had worse.  The oyster were just as I remembered.  If you want to kick it up a notch you can also get it with a shot in each glass.  I passed.  I spiced it with a little of the calamari "cocktail" sauce, lemon, and tabasco.  I wished I had some Hawaiian chili pepper water from back home.  The wait staff is very friendly and attentive.  The second visit was later at night--about 2 am.  They were still bustling.  I got their Red Ale this time.  I ordered the 24oz and the waitress told me she'd get me a 16oz as it was on special for $2.  That's good customer service.  We also got the calamari again and  their artichoke dip.  The artichoke dip was good.  Had a layer of cheese on it.  It was thinner than I was used to having but it came with chips and garlic bread.  It was really good spread on the bread.  The calamari wasn't as good this time.  The peices were bigger and their was a puddle of oil on the bottom of the basket.  A turn off for my wife.  Other than that, it was overall a really good experience still.  I kind of wish I got more oysters but it was only our late night snack before bed.  Next time I'm back in Vegas, soon hopefully, you can be sure I'll be back here again.  Happy Eats!

7IWbiJUa6mgRz8J3qZ50Lg.text: This place is inexpensive, they have a great happy hour Monday through Friday from 3-6, and the food is great! The Sicilian pizza was amazing, and the western bacon cheeseburger was just as good as the pizza! The only thing I didn't like were their beers, for. Microbrewery I was disappointed, the beer was rather warm and the type of beer they carried wasn't the kind I go for. Overall, good experience, would go back for the food and happy hour.

ihXkk1yiVgvgn-yr3nNGzQ.text: Food was horrible, service was worse! I ordered French onion soup, one of my favorite soups, tasted like I was sucking on a salt cube, the service was lacking and when we asked to split checks (party of 6) she huffed and puffed and took a lengthy time to get it back to us, at any rate I don't recommend go some place else!

59Wcy6YtMd7tEzoJfSiFQQ.text: I tried the sampler of beers.  5 pours for $5.50, good deal.  The beers were all good.  I would not go out of your way to get the beers, but if you're in the area it is worth checking out.  Way better beer than Ellis Island.  They supposedly have okay food too, but we just had the beer.

bQzwRr829rm4bzHCDV8naQ.text: There's certainly excellent beer in this restaurant if it's the same beer that's served at the bar.   There's probably good food in this place, based on what's on the menu.   I wouldn't know about either because THE SERVICE SUCKS! With plenty of tables available, the hostess was absent for more than 5 minutes and no one offered to seat us, although servers DID pass us by. When finally seated, it took nearly 10 more minutes for a server to acknowledge our presence, then no water for another 5 minutes.   It was at that point, we left, went upstairs to Aloha Specialties, located on the California Hotel & Casino's mezzanine, to have a delicious meal.   My advice...sleep at the Main Street Station Hotel, gamble here, enjoy the bar, but pass on all food choices at this hotel. YOU HAVE CHOICES!

rmQyToG0mfC5G24yW7K-Og.text: Triple 7 is my favorite casual restaurant in downtown Vegas. Nothing gourmet or innovative here, folks - just good bar food in a comfortable, airy atmosphere. I'm not a beer drinker, so I can't speak for the microbrews. The pizza, to me, is just so-so but I really enjoy the chicken sandwiches and the fried mushroom appetizer. Give me a few glasses of house Chardonnay while you're at it, and I'm a happy girl. While I'm getting my buzz on, Hubs enjoys watching sports on the myriad of televisions above the bar.  I love the high ceilings in here - it feels so spacious and bright, which are rarities in dingy old downtown. (Don't get me wrong - I love downtown, but Encore and City Center it isn't.)  If you've never ventured downtown, you've never really seen Vegas. Leave the douches behind on the strip for a few hours and check out Triple 7 in Main Street Station. It's a nice change of pace.

zTFxHbTNIHOddIubejp4WA.text: Do not order the hot crab dip and artichoke stuff !!! So greasy no crab mostly artichoke and greasy wine taste gross ! The calamari was hard, old, cold and rubbery, so crusty and no flavor in the breading at all. Don't expect much but huge portions that you won't want to eat, what a waste of 22$ and empty calories. Maybe the beer is good but I would pass on the food :/

u-qsjagJ1BE0xfU5RIXD4w.text: $2 beers for happy hour! You can't beat that in Vegas or anywhere else. They also have great appetizers on the happy hour menu. If you're staying at Main Street Station this is a great place to grab food and drinks before heading to Fremont Street. Service was good and plenty of space for large groups or just a few people. We ordered the mushrooms fries (battered portobello mushroom strips), nachos, BBQ chicken flatbread, and wings and it was $28. Four of us ate the food and there were still leftovers. If you're looking for a quick bite and cheap beer this is the place to go!

qmToLm9O-DG_UytINfD0uA.text: Went to this restaurant around 11pm. We got seated and waited for about 15 minutes to be even greeted by our server. Waited another 10-15 minutes before getting our drinks and waited 40 more minutes for the food. They brew their own beer here, I ordered their Highroller beer and it was good and refreshing. Although their service was really slow.

U0t2bIilfBaWkffmE4aHhA.text: Never been here before. Glad I stopped. First the beer, the flight is 5 (all microbrews made here) very good. I personally liked the Cherry Stout (the seasonal choice).  The food is very tasty, pretty large portions for the price. Great tasting food and service was quick (never had an empty glass).

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flight and Chili Cheese Hot dog

-JdG8kq0ShJa8rZzp7GLTA.text: Had the chicken Caesar salad which is about the lamest entree one can order at a brewery. It was just OK. But the selection of beer is why you go to a place like this and they exceeded expectations with a spicy Hefeweizen. Service was fantastic especially when we told our server we had a play to attend. Will return and order a big ass burger and IPA.

Z5o8ihMDOoriS3LBvJnvGA.text: Terrible, 2-24-19 5pm. Service was the worst all waitresses were talking among them selves, it took 2 hours to finally get our bill. Food was terrible my med rare steak was well-done. And brown and white rice not cooked.

k6p_GTgylVgGe8bLCOSsqw.text: Maybe ordered the wrong thing but my friend and I ordered teriyaki chicken bowls and it was the worst food we have ever had. It tasted like it was made in the dishwasher.  Mushy rice, dry chicken, frozen vegetables. Just awful. No one came around to ask us how our meal was. I'm not one to complain but this was the worst food experience I've ever had.

WJW_e-tIMDH6WjIAAQLaeg.text: One of my best place for oysters. Its not an ayce oyster bar but it was convenient because it was in our hotel. The restaurant is in Main Street Hotel. Twice that we had ate here, there was no line and got served right away. Besides the oysters, I had eaten the sizzling steak and the rib eye steak. The steak was cooked.the way I wanted it. Everything was so good. Why I rated a 4 star? Because when we got our bill, they had messed it up. We had the meal coupons and had used it. The manager had to step in and redo our bill. So we had to wait for them to fix it. We waited for I would say 15-20 mins. But overall, definitely come back when I stay in downtown and craving for them oysters.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters that come in either half dozen or dozen

FAE45_37mD93tLc5qXjkkQ.text: stayed at this hotel so we had to stop in.  it was pretty empty so i was a little concerned but my sister ate here and said it was ok.  the server was friendly but not such a good server.  she messed up on my drink and didn't bring the side i wanted but the fish and chips were good.  it was a large portion so i shared with my mom and sister.  lots of tvs.

T0mXtuUVEMkkdOVub5i4bg.text: My family and I came in at around 10:45p. We were being seated but the table she intended was dirty when we arrived. She had a busser clean it right away. We ordered 2 salads, they were both very good, with good portions. My husband ordered a beer just after happy hour started at 11p. Rosa was our server. She was friendly and quick with our order. We then decided to order some happy hour items. The cheese quesadilla were nice and hot. The poppers wrapped in bacon was good. We did not care for the pretzel bites, they were too salty and the dip was okay. Overall, the prices were great. We got seated right away. We were away from the drunks ands crazies from Fremont Street. The service was excellent and the food pretty good. Definitely would come back again.

okhHwT4jxmti_zrxdz-jTg.text: I came to this restaurant/ microbrewery one night while cruising Freemont street. I am a sucker for microbreweries so I decided to stop here. My review is based on the beer since this is the only thing I had. The food menu though, looked extensive and delicious. It is also important to note that they have a really good happy hour specials! We went to the 11:00pm-3:00am happy hour which consisted of $3.00 23 oz of their house made beer. Their regular price was about $1.50 more. I think their beer prices is really good and hard to beat on the Freemont area! I tried the Royal Red Ale and thought it was really good. My friends let me try theirs and I also thought they were pretty good beers. If you are in Freemont street and want enjoy a nice beer in a more relaxed environment I would recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-w0EVaDe4eVwuTS2oJSCFw.text: This is our go to place downtown for craft beer and watching sports. The happy hour prices can't be beat and the bartender, Ron, is the best!

ogB2LPw08_LTMgQvkvAU0Q.text: Can't believe I never ate here in all the years I've been coming to Las Vegas.  Food was so good.  Ordered NY steak w/onions and mushrooms.  Came out sizzling.  Yummm.  Didn't have any of the brews.  Next time.

YrTahd34qOG3aDUYTs54LQ.text: Just found out they are decomissing there current brewhouse.... Gonna be sad to see all the  copper gone...Tried The Bitter End. Last beer (IPA) to be brewed in the current equipment....It's great like almost every beer I have ever had here in these 20 plus years(we won't talk about that weird pale batch back in 1998 ever again) and the food and service are fantastic. Sushi bar here for those that don't think like me and just consider it bait. And LOTS  of tv's to catch all the games and enjoy the full bat as well. Bug them to do the cherry stout again a past favorite. And make that bad boy a regular. And sit back enjoy any of there exeptionaly good beers and marvel at the cool decor

KkC0lWEG9uw54sxXP_2lAA.text: If I could give this place zero stars, I would.  The service is terrible and the food is even worse.  It does not matter how appealing the happy hour deals are, DO NOT GO HERE!!! For starters, after ordering, the waitress brought us the wrong beers. When we let her know, she offered to change to the correct beers if we tasted them and did not like it.  However she did not offer any rectification for the inconvenience.  Next the food came.  We ordered the pretzel bites, quesadilla and wings.  The pretzel bites were clearly frozen.  We might as well have eaten cardboard and the cheese hardly added any flavor. The wings were bone dry and the sauce was in a pool at the bottom of the basket.  The quesadilla, although being very simply cheese and tortilla, was the best part of the meal.   When the check came we were wildly overcharged for almost all of the mediocre food and our drinks, despite it being happy hour.  When we alerted the waitress, she corrected the price of the food items but the beer prices were still incorrect.  When we alerted her of the incorrect prices for a second time we also requested to speak to a manager.   This was apparently a mistake.  The manager, Audray, took 20 minutes to get to us, and when she arrived she gave us a story about having to come from across the street and was not even apologetic about it.  I proceeded to fill in the manager on the terrible experience that we had, the poor quality of food, the incompetent service.  Even though we waited twenty minutes for her, the best solution she could come up with was to comp our two drinks. We had a miserable experience and will not be returning to this establishment.   Save yourself the money and misery, eat anywhere else!!!!!

lm8E3Hfj1CdRc2JmZQ8hzA.text: I have to review this place because they have the best T-Bones, Rib and Shrimp you can eat in your life. Amazing food, their service might not be as exiting as their food but it was the best Red Meat.

kdb8tpuKrfRMQxzZPmMCLA.text: i went here early afternoon with my wife to have lunch with here. It was the first full day of March Madness so I expected it to be crowded. What I did not expect was to have to wait because a quarter of the tables weren't being used because they didn't have a server for them. One would think that with it being March Madness, a bar that is showing the games would be fully staffed.  The process of looking over the menu and ordering our food was pretty standard and went off without any hitches.   My wife ordered the Classic Cheeseburger well done and I ordered the BBQ Western Bacon Cheeseburger cooked medium. Our food was brought to our table and appeared to as we ordered it. However, my wife's burger was FAR from well done when she bit into it. We looked around for our waitress and noticed that all of the waitresses were huddled in one corner talking. Figuring that our waitress would be back momentarily to check on us, we decided to wait rather than waving her down from across the room.   ...And we waited...  ...and we waited...  As another waitress was passing by, we unsuccessfully tried to stop her. She did not even acknowledge us as she zipped by. Even the guests at the next table stated that there was no way that she did not see us. A few moments later we noticed her coming by again and attempted to stop her. This time, without even breaking stride, yelled out..."YOUR server will be with you in a minute"...as she zipped by again.   ...and we waited...  A little while later, long enough for me to have eaten half of my burger, our server did return and we explained the issue with the burger not being well done. She was efficient in getting another one made and bringing it out, but by this time I was pretty much done with my lunch.  The burgers we had were average bar food and enjoyable. The fries are your basic crinkle cut fries, which I love, and were cooked very well. Crispy outside and hot and tender inside. We did not have alcoholic beverages but the iced tea I had was brewed well.   All in all...Triple 7 Brewery is a microbrewery that can be a fun place to watch a game and have drinks. If this visit is indicative of the service though, I will pass.

cqeugwj8dfmK1fGgKYxgQQ.text: Poor, poor, poor customer service from the very first moment I spoke with the guy. I was a manager for almost five years in customer service and I have never heard so many "no's" in my life. Please work on communication and knowing your policies to be able to help satisfy your customers. You should never turn away a customer due to lack of knowledge. That is the quickest way to lose a customer. Thank you to the manager who finally stepped in after 10 minutes of dealing with pure incompetency.

UTuogYm5SBymsDYsYCmhAQ.text: The craft beer is great! Went there for late night food and had the saimin...it was delicious! Went back the next day, good strong coffee and a pretty decent burger. We'll keep returning, for sure. The staff are was so friendly here, we love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cUKQ45WlL349_2iB5sE8aQ.text: Okay so I don't like giving bad reviews.  The bar staff are awesome,  ther was 15 people in our party. Ok abit big but nothing to crazy. The female manager   Stated that they could not accommodate our party even though they had tables that could be pushed together so we sat at the bar. Which is fine for drinks but we didn't wanna eat our food up there. Pursley myself I think there is a better way of going about it if you're a manager of accommodating a large party and not saying that you cannot accommodate your guest anything is better especially since we could have waited a little bit if it would have made it easier so that she had a different server for the situation Maybe the area was not set for it but no she did not say that she just said she couldn't accommodate us. Very unfriendly very and, did not even try to explain poor management skills not a team leader. The bartender however was awesome took fabulous care of us And we appreciated his wonderful personality.  Now I do understand Because I used to work on the strip in a hotel. Most of the hotels in this town are  culinary Union , Being that each area must only have 5 tables at a time. But no one else in my party understood this and none of this was explained to them.  Once again poor management poor leadership. Unfortunately the rest of the people my group will probably never go back because one bartender doesn't cut it for an entire restaurant full of staff Sad considering the places actually a really cute little establishment.

s0AUIYpiVhwXHeQuIbXBlw.text: What can be said about a restaurant that fits the classic stereotypical Las Vegas establishment? You know...the one where there is cheap shrimp cocktail, decent drinks, and service that makes you feel you are at a diner, yet not? Well those same emotions came to light at Triple 7 where I found the food comfortable, service just a tad lacking, and prices rather cheap.  The menu features an eclectic fare of American classics, sushi, and of course shellfish. Never thought I could get a prime rib at the same place I could get a California roll? In either case, the food wasn't bad but at the same time not great. It was decent. Nothing special. I found the oysters a tad gritty while the shrimp were on the smaller side.   Service was a little lacking. It took us awhile to get service once we were seated and while the food didn't take long to come, drinks went empty and it took awhile for water to refill.   Ambiance is comfortable with a town tavern type of feel. Seating can be a little tight so you might not want to have what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas conversations. Prices are very reasonable with entrees being in the $10-15 range and they offer some cheap drink options including evening $2-5 beers.  All in all, it is decent. Nothing truly great, however at the same time didn't disappoint.

KJS7Cgy9DWXIaeoI_kKSgg.text: This was my third brewey stop in Las Vegas and m favorite.  You have to make it to old Downtown Fremont street , but defintely worth a visit.  I like the vibe in this place. with a big open space and they do a decent job with their brews:  I tried a sampler of 5 of their brews iincluding * High Roller Gold - what you would expect in a lighter beer * Market Pale Ale - decent * Royal Red Lager - my favorite * Blackchip Porter - decently delicious * Watermelon Hefe - Seasonal. Tastes like a sweet tart   Bartender added 3 for me that are not part of the normal sampler: * IPA - pretty good  * HEFE - solid hef * Saisson - drinkable  Met some cool locals at the bar.  Definitely a friendly place.  I recommend going here.  Ohh.... and when nature calls, ask the bartender where you can find the Berlin Wall urinals at this casino (little known tourist attraction... definitely worth it)

1b9Fj0FQ8Nl70vIgjGHMSA.text: Been here a few times. My last visit was very poor, which is why I am giving this place 2 stars.  Pros: -Great place to drink and eat bar-kind of food. -Convenient for those who are staying at Main Street or California hotels. -Appetizers were delicious. I think we got the potato wedges and pizza bread.  Cons: -There is a full bar, but when I asked for one of their special summer drinks on their menu, they couldn't make it. -There was a bug in my burger.  -Service was slow and was not friendly.

t68mDyA71owg0w_IUNOWZA.text: Got the NY steak (had to bring my own seasoning for it to taste good).  Veggies was bland (was only steamed). We waited for a few years to try their deep fried cheesecake and waited 40 MINUTES to tell us they could only find a lime cheesecake. They had to go look for the cheesecake!!! The MANAGER was busy folding forks, knives and napkins then was no where to be found.   There was ONE waitress (I felt sorry for her) taking care of the entire room! What a JOKE. NEVER COMING BACK HERE.  This place needs to be on Restaurant Impossible in a serious way!  Good luck, you need it

hE42PJguOjZbTtoaQp_CHA.text: I feel like i always end up here, although i've only been here twice. It's inside the Main Street Casino in downtown. Its nice cuz they have a pretty large menu, lots of sports TV, beer and not too crowded.   Their cheesy Garlic bread is super yummy. I had their chicken and avocado sandwich with sweet potato fries. They give you huge portions!

M3684oGXHfgRYf40hhRjIQ.text: I really WANT to like Triple 7.  It's the kid of place that is pretty cool to hang out with co-workers or take a time out from the action of Fremont Street.  The atmosphere is always good, service is usually pretty good - though some of the ladies are better than others (I've never had a male server there).  It's mere blocks from where I work, so it tends to be someplace we fall back on, but in the past few months, I haven't had great experience when branching out on the menu.  Nearly everyone has a favorite food and doesn't eat much else.  We like the salads, pizza, grilled chicken, sushi and most of the appetizers.   We keep going back because it's close, the drinks (at the Casino bar next to the buffet) are cheap and the service is pretty good.  They don't fret when 8 people come in all of a sudden and want a table.  If the food was better, they'd probably get 4 stars, but as it is, they get 2.  So... based on my experience - Do's and Don'ts  Do: Stop at the Casino bar before coming in - the drinks are cheaper (.99 Margaritas, $1.25 beer) Try the sushi - it's probably my favorite thing on the menu.  I've tried a variety of it and while the selection isn't huge, it is good. Have a salad or something else that you know the kitchen has to make.  Much of the food is frozen, but the fresh things are good.  Don't: Eat the burgers - they are frozen, premade patties that never taste good. Make it complicated - the kitchen doesn't take change well Try to get split checks - just come with cash if you're in a group.

MhaV4wKcGYlQIOtrF6KSOg.text: Horrible. I've been in the restaurant business for 15 years, and ran a brewery... The beer here is good.   Food was terrible.  I ordered the Ahi salad. The Ahi was rubbery and grey. A seared ahi should be BRIGHT pink in the middle. If could tell right away this fish was previously frozen and not fresh at all. The salad was drenched in oriental dressing, and for some weird reason, i found ice cubes in it. The wonton strips were obviously fried in old oil, they were dark brown and tasted like fish. I could not eat it, just too gross.   My husband ordered fish and chips, which were drenched in oil... Coleslaw smelled rancid and was warm. Tarter sauce was not fresh, already had the glazed over look. My lil one had a cheesy bread appetizer which was also soggy and drenched in oil.   Server was not attentive, and VERY fake. This was my first time here and I will not be back.  Come on guys, it was about 2pm and there was not really anyone in the restaurant... Kick up your quality or fire your chef. Totally nasty food!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brownish, rubbery, ill tasting Ahi. Salad drenched in a sesame oriental dressing with wontons obviously cooked in old oil
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cubes??

KBng5LjCKXaoKmfkdC0eWg.text: The Vibe: This is a brewpub.  It's airy and its got that simple pub feel.  You just want some diner food and beer, but not at a divey lounge?  This is a FANTASTIC alternative in the Fremont Street area.  You also can watch sports here too, and just feelin a chillax effect come over you as you hang out here.    The Attire: If you were business casual or something more classy than that, you will be expected to buy drinks for everyone less dressed up than you.  Come as you are with CASUAL as an expectation.  Consider: DON'T COME FOR THE MICROBREWS.  These are not great, and by far some of the weakest I have tried.  Coming from some experience of trying 200+ DIFFERENT beers, and having done beer tasting in San Diego, trust me on this.  Come here to hang out, get some grub and a drink, but not for beer tasting.

I8O8w9dCW8PkwTFS0-ia2Q.text: We enjoyed our meal here during our recent Vegas downtown experience.  Boyfriend wanted cheap prime rib, so he searched yelp and found this place.  He ordered a larger cut, so it was like ~$14 maybe (?) and scarfed it down.  I tried a bite and agreed that it was very tender and juicy.  Worth it.  I had the mahi dish.  Unfortunately the vegetable side is just one kind of veggie, and it happened to be grean beans.  I only like green beans if they are really fresh and these seemed a little wilted, so I didn't eat many.  Also, it came with a huge serving of white rice (seriously like two gigantic ice cream scoop-sized mounds), most of which I didn't eat either.  So I felt a little badly wasting the food.  If I'd known, I would have requested less rice and a side salad instead, or something.  Anyway.  Then the fish itself was overcooked and kind of dry.  I don't mind it being on the more well done side of things, but overcooked is going too far.  The only redeeming quality of the meal was the amazing pineapple salsa chutney sauce...I just slathered every bite of fish with the sauce and it made everything better!  Delish.  We loved the beer sampler (6 samples for $5.50!!  so cheap!).  I enjoyed the mango beer (although bf thought it was too sweet).  I also really liked the porter.  Bf liked the red and the pale ale.  So it was a perfect balance for the meal.  The atmosphere was like any brewery/restaurant..think Gordon Biersch.  But it was pleasant inside, lots of TVs, and the service was pretty good.  We'd definitely go back, and I would just order something different...probably sticking with the more traditional "bar food" or just getting a prime rib of my own. :)

pJPfdubDChdMrIJrbtjP5A.text: Food is a great value and the brews are among the best in town. For the 7 years I've been going here, food quality has been consistent. Prices have increased a bit, and the quality has not changed.  Service can be hit or miss, as this place is hoppin' on weekends. Happy Hour is a great value.

e0Rbixa4hss1DWtcow7PLA.text: Get the wings appetizer. it was AMAZING with the Thai sauce.  i also got some kind of italian sandwich with fries, but that kind of was boring. The fries looked and tasted like Ore-ida fries you used to get when watching TV as a kid. The wings were amazing though.  Cool environment, great for casual large group gatherings too. Fun atmosphere.  main street station is a pretty unique place in general.

JIXLS8ZWxmmOBWyBjDhwgw.text: Service is a 5 maybe even a 10. Both times I ate here the food was great but both times the fries tasted like they were under a heat lamp all day. I could have complained but overall the food and atmosphere were awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f9bhf4lWiU1KxMMTvtAbaQ.text: Lappert's Ice Cream was closed one night and the security guards at the hotel mentioned that 777 Microbrewery served ice cream. They were wrong, but I'm glad we came here anyway! Although we originally came here for dessert, we ended up having a late-night second dinner. We ordered the garlic french fries, chicken wings and deep fried cheesecake. The garlic fries were VERY garlicky! They actually had chopped up pieces of garlic on top of them which I have never seen before. The wings are delicious! We tried the honey dijon sauce and the cajun sauce. Both were good. The deep fried cheesecake was also a hit.  The service here was great and the atmosphere was very laid back. The beers are also very cheap. You can't find prices like these anywhere on the strip. Also, if you happen to have coupon books from the California Hotel, they are honored here too. After using our coupons, we only paid for the cheesecake and 2 beers which came out to about $10. I think I'm starting to like Downtown Las Vegas..

47PqekCGAjLqEn5-L_UFFA.text: This is probably one of the best happy hour places in the area . If you like local brewed beer then this is your place. Prices are great. A really nice selection of Brews starting at $2.50. Happy hour food isn't the best but it's not bad either. Great burgers, good pizzas. Nice atmosphere. Give this place a try.

mHKoM80sSog5hK3yByae9A.text: I like to hang out at this place for happy hour. The food is OK, like a B-. I had the Korean beef tacos last night and they were just OK. I ordered them crispy and they use prepared shells. It is a shame to season the meat and cook it fairly well and then plop it into a prepared shell. It ruins the taco.  Service is good for a place that is always busy. Good beer specials. Not fancy, but a comfortable place to meet with people for a basic beer and bar food.

b38suGE0ZlVVLEvq6SPXgw.text: We had visited your establishment on July 30, 2017 around 6:00 PM. We had friends in from Canada and we would just like to Thank our Server Gerry for the excellent service he had provided for us. He was extremely knowledgeable about the entire menu. He was extremely on top of his game while taking our order and the food was delivered very quickly. Kudos to you Gerry.... Thanks Again for your excellent service.

aFVZcxagG4cQyGz9yzSxUg.text: Well, I love the beer and the food is pretty damn good as well. Brad is an awesome bartender and I really commend his patience dealing with the people he gets at late night hours.   But I do have a few problems with the joint. First off, I've been charged 3 different prices for the same 16 oz beers, which makes recommending this place difficult. I was telling my friend Main Street has $1.75 beers, because I was charged that before. The next time was 2-something and the next time was $3.50 a piece. Very confusing.   Also, being a restaurant that is in a hotel and doesn't offer room service, I find it very ridiculous they charge 2 dollars for every to go order. Since I know this, I usually order my food, eat a morsel and immediately ask for a box. Seems less efficient for them, considering now they have to clean my plates, and my seating area just because I was avoiding a $2 charge. It's not that I don't want to pay 2 bucks, but I think whoever is serving me deserves that $2 tip, not the restaurant.    Also, they will not take an order over the phone so you can pick it up. Not even for hotel guests, not even with the $2 charge. It is inconvenient and I'm sure has lost them plenty of money, as they just lost my business for dinner this afternoon.

vUFbaYfP0HoUzxTbkkGwBQ.text: Great happy hour specials.  Their micro beers are great.  They have plenty of seating, so the wait is very short, even on a busy night.  The fish tacos are a great meal for the happy hour price.

_mQ3-nT0eah6yzGrqZd7Ow.text: First time going here.  Was excited to try the happy hour specials. We ordered around 6 items from the menu. Was not impressed by the food, mediocre at best. Ordered the 1/2 rack of ribs.  Pretty much the ribs were boiled then broiled. Afterwards dumped a lot of of barbecue sauce on top. Took one rib and that was it for me. Only positive was the service was superb. Don't think of coming back.

_eXYxiuHmSpd1mjSQWsMDQ.text: Great bar. Awesome happy hour, food, beer, and prices. The place is rarely crowded and a great place to watch a game. A locals paradise. The Mango Hef they make for summer is the greatest beer on Earth!!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Hefeweizen....best beer on Earth.

W3YHfNLKs0neD-jvEJx-PQ.text: Really terrible service. There was one woman in particular who was quite possibly one of the rudest servers/hosts I've encountered.  A group of roughly 20 of us arrived from a work meeting around 3pm, and it was not crowded. We were spread between the bar and high top area. Within about 30 minutes we were scolded  that we need to close our tab at the bar and open one with the server if we wanted to sit at the empty high-top tables near the bar. While she said this, 4 of us at the table had empty beers.   We waited 15 minutes for a server to come to ask us for our order, but they didn't, so I found the cranky woman and told her we were waiting for the server to come. She said 'you have to close your tab at the bar before you can order with us." I told her the bar tab was my bosses, we'll open another. She rolled her eyes and said she would send over a server. The server did not seem happy to be serving us. Soon after that, the cranky woman told our group to move our bags that were taking up a table (there were about 10 empty tables in the surrounding area, probably 20 empty in the restaurant). In addition, multiple people from our party made different comments about how rude she was.   The only reason I give this place two stars was because not all of the servers were rude, and the food/beer was not bad.

WmwXSI2tydEvdMbmJZMeDQ.text: Portions--GIGANTIC    Service--welcoming Venue--unique and interesting  Price was very right

ntNiVzxtIsfQwZogWQwQ4g.text: Wow, third review? Looking for a brew co with great beer, tasty burgers and fresh, huge oysters?? Just had the perfect lunch. A martini, oysters and a burger! Enjoy the photos!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Western Cheeseburger!
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Martini and oysters!
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster bar

C1bAyLSBuvf4k29GP0QWXQ.text: Service is always good here. During football days it gets quite busy so be ready for a 10-15 min wait for seating & don't expect your food to get to you quickly. However if you are ok with sitting at the bar you don't have to wait & can still order from the regular menu.  Food quality is pretty good. Ahi salad is a nice, light option if you don't want to feel stuffed. The Mediterranean chicken Salad is one of my favorites. Light, tasty & just the right amount of tartness in the dressing. My boyfriend loves their burgers, all of them. Burger fans should give it a try. Can't go wrong with the Flat bread pizzas & regular pizzas. Crust is thin & crunchy, perfect pairing with beer.  They offer take out orders but be aware that they charge a $2 service fee & the order must be placed at the restaurant; no phone orders.  Last tip, if you are a Boyd Rewards member & have a ton of points on your card, you can use the points to pay for your meals here! Just ask your server to check. If you use points they don't charge tax, either. It's a nice feeling to be fed for free after dropping too much money in the casino, haha.

YCCQTCY6Bf2j4k9eSydX3Q.text: Busy fun place, cheeseburger sliders were just so-so. Beer flight was good. Service was busy and could have been better.

Kj21syfXnMoph-zJ_yJY0w.text: Get the beer sampler for sure! For around $5 you get to try a 5oz serving of five of their microbrew beers. Their dark beer in particular was one of the better ones I've had. The beer is the star here but the food is okay too.  I tried a cup of the sirloin chili and was very impressed. It had a spicy, smoky flavor and used real shredded steak, not ground beef.   I had the half rack of ribs which was $9.99 and pretty good. Being from the south originally I'm very picky about bbq and these ribs weren't spectacular but they were  worth getting. They were tender but had a little more fat than you would get at most BBQ places. They came with good fries and green beans which honestly tasted canned and seemed to have a heavy butter flavor.   Overall I'd hit this place for some beer for sure and if you want to get some food it's not a bad place for that either.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer Sampler!

nbbwIFPDdJTQPXZr95pXWg.text: Great good, good service. I had the nachos, my bf had a western burger. Both were huge as well as delicious. We ordered the beer sampler, those were decent sizes as well. No line to be seated. Service could've been better but over all, good.

_aUcg7sRK-fgWm5u4jQJ8g.text: I'd been wanting to check out the Triple 7 Brewpub for a while but, believe it or not, it wasn't for the famous craft beers. As a teetotaler, I was more interested in the food and all-around vibe. The food was mostly good; the mozzarella sticks appetizer was just okay but I liked my cheeseburger and fries a lot. There are a lot of TV screens set up for sports and I was placed perfectly to watch two NBA playoffs games simultaneously. I thought it was interesting that there was a sushi bar in a section of the brewpub. I guess Main Street Station is trying to make the most use of its space.   If you're into craft beers and/or are looking for an alternative to sportsbook seating, I think you'll find the Triple 7 Brewpub to be a good choice while downtown.

Xf4AsD-YeqkTRjQUJXqwUw.text: Oddly enough, this place has really good steak. The hamburgers are somewhat dry, but the steaks are great! Friendly and smoke free!

58fWfSByHndTKlTgHABBFQ.text: Excellent. Had ahi tuna salad and a few pieces of nigiri (YELLOWTAAAAAIIIILLLL!!!!! SOOO DARN GOOD!!!) from the sushi bar. Sushi bar! whaaaaaaat? It was awesome. Great house wine too, reasonably priced, excellent staff. You must try this place, I think it is one of the few good deals in downtown Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna salad yum!!!!
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi nigiri - amazing!!
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened salmon

pC7Uqu6rCHzTXUAjvQNaXw.text: This little gem is located inside the Main Street Station Casino just off of Fremont Street. After leaving the Mob museum we walked over here because this is where I parked my car at to avoid the Mob Museum parking lol  We walked around and did a little gambling when we decided to grab a quick bite. The prices were very affordable and food was pretty tasty. Just by a stroke of luck we walked in about 15 minutes before the end of happy hour. We each had a 12 count order of wings for only 4.99 each! Wow! Good, solid wings too! Also had the hot Italian sub sandwich for 7.99 as well. That was really tasty too!  The service was friendly and attentive despite the fact that it was fairly busy and our drinks never hit the bottom of the glass. A big way of gauging service for me.   The atmosphere is great also. You have the brewery over on one side, TVs with sports scattered throughout, and that beautiful wooden decor that the whole casino has(which I'm definately a fan of).  A great find and I look forward to coming back next time I'm down on Fremont!  A solid 4 stars!

sPdIUOJqfaGdI7mbuzbBgg.text: Very tasty and well made Beers. The house beers are your standard line up, where this place shines is in the seasonals and specialty beers. Some are OUTSTANDING!! The VIPA series offers up some very tasty IPA's, and the Chocoalte Cherry Stout is a must try. I recently had the Lemon Grass Kolsch and it was amazing. Very light and refreshing with a slight hint of citrus, and that earthy lemon grass flavor was subtle but still enough to really bring life to the beer.  Food is good but not spectacular, but go for the BEER!!!

65lpJwoRcaT-zUlMrdVuug.text: Love this place! They have great happy hour deals; drinks and food. Their food is generally good! I've had several different dishes and have enjoyed them all. The service is always pretty good as well. If you enjoy craft beer, there's is a variety and all pretty delicious. They have seasonal beer, such as cheery stout and Mango Hefeweizen, which both delicious. They have included a "infused" beer specials and I recently had the mango Hefeweizen, which was a nice surprise since it is usually sold in the summer. I recommend this place is you are around Fremont street and are looking for a nice sit down dinner.

eL6keMDAdoEEvZve5HPhow.text: My brother and I came here for the lunch special.  Cubano sandwich with warm potato chips on the side. It was delicious.  Piping hot. Crispy bread and juicy meats. It was a jackpot in my mouth.  I ordered fish and chips. It was pretty tasty too.  Overall, great experience.

8rpeC367yN3U7_GaWyy2vw.text: I love bringing people here when they come to town. The prices are cheap and the food good. There can be a wait sometimes but it is well worth it. They have plenty of seating but can feel kinda clustered with people at times. I love to get a salad and the pizza. Oh.. yeah.. and they have all kinds of tasty beers!!! If you are paying with a debit/credit card be sure to have your ID ready because they card for all those type of transactions. I forgot mine once and actually used pictures of myself on my Facebook page to ID myself LOL. Hey.. whatever works!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza @ Triple 7 inside Main Street Station

Dte1umLI87_ce3s8Yx2FDg.text: After a long day of conventioning and a long night of walking walking walking through downtown, we decided we needed some dessert and unfortunately, the ice cream shop in the California was already closed.  Darn it.   We decided to head over to the Triple 7 inside of the Main Street Station because the word was they had dessert.    When we arrived the hostess seemed put out by our party of 10 and said she would have to look for a table.  We glanced to our left and saw a long table with 12 seats and asked if we could sit there.  She said we could but if there were ten of us we'd have to all be on one check.  It seriously felt like she wanted us to leave.  We sat.  A server finally came by and got our drink orders and then after a while another server came by and told us she was back from break and could take our food orders.... drinks had yet to arrive.  I was very thirsty and asked if I could get a glass of water (which I had already ordered).  She told me the other server was placing that order. Soon after, the drinks did get delivered by server number two, however she started at the opposite end from me even though I was the one who asked.  A little longer wait and then the food arrived.  I had decided to get mozzarella sticks instead of dessert as nothing on the dessert menu sounded like all that.  When she delivered mine, I realized there were no set ups on the table, so I asked if I could get some napkins.  The server told me she'd get us silverware once she was done delivering food.  She finished delivering, went and got silverware and passed out one roll to each person... me last.  Then she walked away and came back with extra napkins which she dropped off at the other end of the table.  I was totally feeling invisible.  The mozarrella sticks were not that great.  hard and rubbery instead of melty and I shared them...  when I aksed for the bill, she dropped it off at the other end of the table, too.  So bizarre.  Overall, I had a good time with good company, but that was despite the service.

rjmmlrTncKvge_aUsqVHoQ.text: Do not get the hamburgers.  They have a funky off taste.  The bloody Mary's were very good.  You can get the same beer on the casino floor bar for less than half the price they charge in the brewery..  Waitress kept complaining to us about how slow the bartender was. He poured my beer before he made my partners Bloody Mary.  I saw it sitting on the bar for near 10 minutes.

EGxhaUI3HxGwRM-M3eB4pg.text: Had a wonderful time here. Bar food was good and inexpensive, service was fast, beer was great! I will be back.

Iwmix910xngQuo5iVLV7ZQ.text: Like "Long Sox " said if they went back to the old school recipe we would go back ,so far they have fix their microbrews & ill willing to go back cause of the food &  beer everything is  good now which I like before I've been going here since 2001 & never had a problem  intill they changed their recipe & now  their beer  its getting back to order & I'm making this my place to go once again

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Me &amp; my BFF getting our drink on hella cheap u can&#39;t beat the prices

th47cgfmOSiaNEutw9i1CA.text: Decided to hit up the Triple 7 Brewery on a Friday night before beginning the Fremont Street festivities. I've eaten at the Main Street Station buffet many times and found it be one of the better budget friendly buffets out there. Unfortunately my experience at this venue was a far cry from it's dining counterpart at the Main Street Station.  We had a big party, 7 people, all hungry. It was Friday, so we expected a wait and were surprised when we were able to get a table quickly. The waitress was great. It took a little time to get our initial drink order, after that the service was flawless. Refills given before your mouth felt like the Sahara Desert, plates cleared quickly, and a friendly smile to go along with the prompt service. Too bad for her, the food the kitchen was putting out was sub-par.  So I ordered their classic cheeseburger, added avocado, and substituted onion rings for french fries. When the food came out the onion rings were barely above room temperature. They were soggy and literally had no flavor. Having had the misfortune in my youth of working as a dish washer at a restaurant I know a little about frying foods. This consistency only happens when something is fried, cooled, then fried again. No bueno. After a complaint to the waitress she brought a big stack of new onion rings to the table as several of us had ordered them. These were fresh and crispy. The burger itself was ordinary. Cooked okay, no great flavor, definitely expect more from a brewery. Everyone at the table at their meal, but no rave reviews. Prices are okay, definitely lower than the strip.  Fortunately this place is located near Fremont Street where I can drink my sorrows away and get some $1 fried twinkies.

WjQrvLxBZWK7GTSCSe8Hbg.text: There are some definite pros and cons to this sports bar inside the Main Street Casino. I didn't have my hopes set too high, expecting just a casino bar/cafe. They don't have a wide selection of beers they brew, but we were pleased with the two we tasted; I had a seasonal selection that was tasty enough I ordered it again another time. We started our meal with a french fry sampler they have - three type of fries with three dipping sauces. It was actually pretty darned tasty. For the meal, my husband ordered the prime rib sandwich (like a french dip) and was very happy with it. I ordered the Cuban sandwich, and this sounds crazy, but it was overstuffed. There was so much deli meat in it, you couldn't really bite into it comfortably, and then you didn't really get a good taste of everything blending together, like you usually do with a good Cuban. Main issue seems to be the service is really hit or miss. Our visit visit in, the waitress seemed to disappear for stretches, and the place wasn't that busy. Another time, a group of us went in, sat at the table for a good 15 minutes and no waitress ever came to the table, so we left.

bQlgVcHMQbpUrogTecM8-Q.text: If you're in Old Vegas and are looking for quality craft beer, Triple 7 is the place to go. They have a wide variety of beers at reasonable prices along with a diverse menu from wings to pizza to sushi.   I would say the food is your basic bar food, but it's pretty solid and certainly is better than most places in Old Vegas.

ExzVCyKoVVfNtCbsgVpxCQ.text: Ho-hum. I was expecting a lot more. The beer was good and my husbands steak as well but my prime rib was just barely warm when served. Also, the appetizers, soups, and salads are a joke. We ordered "boneless wings" and basically got your run of the mill cafeteria style popcorn chicken with ranch dressing. Probably wouldn't go again. If I had the choice between here or The Garden Court buffet next door, I'd head over to the buffet so you can at least judge for yourself if something is worth eating.

8ZSf95gfT8DGDKQDYehd6g.text: Whenever we go to Vegas we go here..... more than once. We love the food and the beer is top notch.  Sit at the sushi counter and watch them make fresh delicious rolls.  Was there on Sat night and had sushi and a beer sample. Fantastic!  Natashia and Theresa our servers were outstanding. Stayed for the 11 pm Happy Hour.  Bacon jalapenos and pretzel bites with cheese.  Delightful.  Can't wait to go back.  Such a gem!!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gone!!
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer sampler! 6.99 for these nice sized pours!!

ZBQcfGBiGTMUKQ6ExDj-1g.text: great spot at Main St. hotel. we were staying at The Cal and wandered over after needing some fresh air after hours of march madness basketball. the place is pretty big and so was the line was  for a table, but, we lucked out and scooped up some bar seats.   menu was traditional american fare. in house beer options were very interesting and delicious. i ordered 2 rounds of the High Roller Gold. light and crisp. price points on the beer was pretty amazing and they even had a happy hour. we came by for both dinner and late night munchies. overall, great spot and glad we stumbled upon it (literally).

Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY steak
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib

c9uAsT8X8Ekn4I2b_ewInw.text: This place brews a good red ale. It has its own microbrewery on site and a oyster bar. We ordered the half dozen oysters as an appetizer and they were really fresh. Comes with fresh horse radish and coctail sauce but you do get to choose the half dozen shots with vodka. We also ordered the prime rib even though it was lunch time. And I wanted the pork sliders with potato salad. Quality of food is fresh and better than Garden Court next door.

Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen really fresh oysters

9M0WEMF9BrLvOrVfZNuzlw.text: Great place to hang out in the Main street Casino to eat and drink. Comfortable atmosphere, service a little slow food good, chicken bowl has a lot of veggies, they offer rolled sushi, ribs fettuccine and a ton of other options as well as a fully staffed bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Alfredo
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZwqgmWCT6Dkg5W3WcK9gsA.text: The service and food used to be so good.  I took friend's in from out of town this past Monday.  Nine people.  All of us ordered prime rib (which was already cooked). Forty five minutes later, it still hadn't gotten to our table. We ended up getting it to go. I got home that night. One look at the piece of meat and I threw it in the trash. The color was off. When I tried to cut it, it was like shoe leather (I had ordered it medium.). Sad to say, we won't be back

q3HZctQ7pvxEaxlc5LGP6g.text: Meeting Yelpers from out of town is kind of fun. ..especially when EVERYONE is from out of town!   Sathy T. and Tim C. from LA just happened to be in Las Vegas at the same time that I was. After I had finished my family duties, Tim, Sathy, and I agreed to meet in Downtown Las Vegas for after dinner snacks!   Triple 7 Restaurant & Brewery at the Main Street Casino was a logical choice.   Some of the features of this venue include the helpful and friendly service, free parking, convenient location, and cool atmosphere - is the variety of beers and good food!   BEER: Sathy ordered a Blonde Beer called the High Roller Gold.  She really enjoyed it because I didn't even get to taste it! Hahaha! Just kidding!  Tim's Dark Beer was the Blackchip Porter with hints of toffee and chocolate. The server offered him a sample first - that's great customer service!  He liked it and got the large glass. ..yay!  Because I liked it, too - which was a pleasant surprise. I secretly wished that I had gotten this beer, so I could have it all to myself... but Tim shared and I drank about half because it was so smooth and mellow!   FOOD: I was more hungry so I got the Dragon Roll sushi which was satisfying.  I liked the shrimp in the middle and unagi (eel) on the top. The combination tasted yummy to me!  Another pleasant surprise was the dozen Fresh Oysters. They were the most plump and meaty oysters I have ever had!  Our server said that the oysters came from Louisiana. Whoa!  Thanks to Sathy for sharing her rations - she only ate two so Tim and I had 5 each! Nom nom!   I have been to this restaurant in the past and I will continue to return - not only because they accept the coupons from our Vacations Hawaii meal coupon book - but also because of the reasonable prices and Aloha Spirit hospitality!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dragon Roll
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Oysters!
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Store front

QlEkqqwLhzRiDArQHlGDQQ.text: The atmosphere is really unique inside for being a brewery with restaurant. The ceiling was gold, and brick walls every where.. had a vintage downtown Europe vibe. Lots of seating, very spacious.   It was a big group of people I was with, so we had to wait a while. A few tables opened up and we just said screw it and grabbed them since all the big tables were still occupied. By the time we sat down for dinner it was almost 9 pm, I decided to skip dinner and just have dessert instead. I ended up getting the brownie sundae. Omg was this giant, it was a meal in itself and I ate the whole thing. The brownie was very very chocolatey but that's my fav, and I got four scoops of ice cream with whip, hot fudge and some cherries on top.   I definitely want to come back and try a meal there. The prices were really affordable, and you get a bunch of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brownie sundae

3oZ-RPzzGdlOjYA4yD1fbg.text: Over the last 4 years this place seems to get better and better. When I first realized this place was inside the Main Street casino it just seemed like a sports bar with decent food, that had crappy craft beer that I wouldn't spend $1.75 for a pint on. As the years have gone by I've noticed a big improvement in their beer, and even better food. Normally when I think of food in downtown Vegas it's garbage like fried Twinkies, cheap buffets, or some tough $2.99 steak and eggs.  My last couple of visits here I've gotten really good burgers for under $10, good steaks for under $20, and surprisingly great sushi that I would have never expected to get a place that's known for beer, wings, & burgers. With all the high end/mediocre expensive restaurants in Vegas it's nice to know there's still a place where you can get some good food without breaking the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Right next to the casino cashier cage.
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5oz flight sampler of five beers for $6.99
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House hef, taste a lot better than it did years ago.

daReA37czL1U6TPlXVJ9Sw.text: My husband I love this place. This brewery has started to become a staple on our climbing trips. The place is great with all the TV'S and the long tables where you can join other groups. You can always meet new people here. The staff are great and the food has never been bad. I tried on our recent trip sushi and was happily suprised. The flights are a bonus. You may have to wait in line, but well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sushi rolls are pretty darn good I belive this is the crunchy spicy dragon roll
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband enjoyed his meatloaf

wTTQJkVd-Cz0dH--vNMIXg.text: This review is only for the beer, AND i only tasted one of their many beers so take this review with a grain of salt, it's a very narrow review.  I'll be back to try more beers and update when i visit next time.  I've stayed at Main Street Station many times over the years, eaten at their buffets, gambled for hours many times but never tried their brewery.  As long as i can remember, even when i turned 21 there was a brewery in this hotel and casino but i was never really into beers until a few years ago when the whole micro brew scene took off.  So i finally have sort of a taste for what styles of beer i like and don't like.  While walking outside the casino, i saw signs for $2.50 craft micro brews from their brewery on the Casino bar.  I had never noticed where the bar on the casino floor was because i always got free drinks while gambling.  I found the casino bar just to the left of the buffet.  Im not sure what they charge in the actual Micro brewery and Restaurant, but it was closed at the time and $2.50 sounds like a great deal to me.  I ordered the Black Chip Porter ($2.50) it came in a plastic cup, I'm not sure what they charge in the actual Brewery/Restaurant or the size that you get in the restaurant vs the casino floor.  I took a few sips and i wasn't too impressed with it, i just didn't care for the flavor.  I like dark beers, porters, stouts and dark ales, but i just didn't care for this one.  I actually ended up tossing it out after drinking about a third of it.  With that said I'd still come back and try their other beers, the Pale ale, hefeweizen, and their High Roller gold light beer look promising.  So although i didn't like their porter, i still have high hopes for their other beers, which i'll try on my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Craft brews on tap.

iFOykxf8E9tJvTGyrk8fPA.text: Great place to watch the knights game especially those 5 o'clock games during happy hour. And if you cheer loud enough, the manager will comp your parking. Food left all of us happy campers. We had wings, pizza, nachos, salads and sushi. The beers were ok. The atmosphere was on fire with everyone cheering and all. Since it is close to work, I could definitely come back to hang out and enjoy.

PQGYv48X1S9Qd6pSq0tcJg.text: Wow!!! What an amazing brewery pub!! If you want amazing drafts at a great price, decent food and great service, THIS is your place!! If you want fancy and pretentious, fine dining, do NOT come!! Food and drinks, especially at Happy Hour 3-6pm M-F, are priced sooo fairly!!.. $2-3 dollar in-house drafts, $3-7 appetizers.. chicken wings were great!! Accompanying sauces just right!!.. we'll definitely be back!! AND, Where do you find a pub with almost no attrition!!.. Florence served impeccably well!! Looking forward to trying the chicken flatbread and others... old school vegas.. well maintained, not Smokey.. long overdue visit

UOjb0fpv5HYKhk23P1MscQ.text: I love coming here every time I'm in Vegas. Service is always good, prices are good and the foods delicious! If you come late night, they have a separate menu. It's catered to the folks from Hawaii. Beer was a bit bitter for my taste but the high roller beer was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast Turkey Avocado Club
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer sampler
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger Sliders* $7.99! My parents split this for lunch and it was just right.

KlnIxaDByP7yOoAUQIszaQ.text: Located in the Main Street Hotel and Casino, the restaurant has a nice open lay out with plenty of seating. Service was friendly and prompt. Ordered the meat loaf entree plate which came with mashed potatoes and gravy and a  steamed vegetable medley. The meat loaf was tasty along with the mashed potatoes but the vegetables were way over steamed and mushy. Also ordered the nachos which came with steak, tomatoes, avocado, jalapenos, olives and cheese. Both menu items were generous in portions.

_mtwJF4d3StRg1Cn89VTQg.text: My sister recommended this place to the group while we're visiting downtown Vegas. Craft beer was amazing, the food was tasty while not overly impressive (we rocked the HH menu) Service was fast and friendly!

Bs3XdABz7yG8wgmkIqfjGg.text: HUGE micro brew and food establishment within the Main Street Station. We were looking for a place who could take 8 people and had a big selection.   The kids loved the many options. The adults loved the fresh made beer.  I personally had the prime rib, and I was pleasantly surprised at how good it was.  All in all this is a good downtown choice.

-oDjAS60JNVhnyVt2_KZhA.text: Triple 7 is right down the block from the Mob Museum.  It is a perfect lunch stop, if you like local beer.  We enjoyed a pre-prepared flight of five beers. The calamari and the crab and artichoke dip appetizers were well portioned and delicious.  The crab dip was rich and creamy. The sauce for the calamari was sweet and spicy. We enjoyed steak sandwiches that were cooked to perfection.
