Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6vKJXNEdGrro2Uhyk72Krg.text: On Sunday I met up with some friends to have lunch there at around 3:00. Others in our party ordered burgers and really seemed to enjoy them. The portions are large. Fries were ordered for the table. They were delicious, both the sweet potato and regular fries were golden, crispy and hot. I tasted someone's onion rings which were very good.   One of the dipping sauces served with the fries was a sweet sauce that is a cross between BBQ sauce and ketchup. It was the best part of my meal! Some in our party ordered cups of chili. Their cup size is very large.  I ordered the fish tacos. Big mistake!  The fish was on a nondescript, limp flour tortilla, on a few pieces of shredded, wilted lettuce. I wonder who told the chef that wasabi should go on fish tacos? The fish, although battered and fried adequately, was unseasoned. I thought maybe they didn't season it because it was on a fish taco so I tried someone's fish from their fish and chips order. That fish was also unseasoned and tasteless.   Also the staff seemed to be having problems taking our orders in a timely manner. There were 8 in our party and it was a bit difficult flagging down waitresses and getting our drinks. They weren't even very busy that day. Prices are reasonable.

hlc459nCSixLhTrzHKZzYA.text: Not bad for a micro brew in a Vegas casino. I stopped by for lunch and had a couple beers as well as some food. The menu is a little ridiculous in that they have a large selection. It's safe to say that more is not always better when it comes to menu items. I think it takes away from the quality when there are so many items on hand. Narrow it down and you can focus on quality. example.... I had half dozen oysters on the half shell. They were large, didn't taste fresh and looked funky actually! Safe to say I didn't eat them all. Just didn't look or taste right. The burgers they had looked good. Maybe next time I stop by I'll give one a try. The beers were pretty good! Price was good too. I'd probably come back if I were in the neighborhood.

9pevSmpfwdNT8HB2JcRZYw.text: Since Steven and I are trying to keep things simple on this trip we decided to go to just one brewery. There are other reasons why we just chose one brewery on this trip. Some of you probably can guess why one was chosen if you have been reading my reviews of the past month. That though is only half the story and I will tell the full spectrum of that story at a later time. We chose Triple 7 simply because they had a good overall score here on Yelp! They also had brews that I haven't heard of before. Like a Watermelon Hefeweizen! Well by the time we got there they didn't have the Watermelon Hefe anymore but they did have a Mango Hefe which I immediately ordered! This unusual Hefe went down smooth and tasted awesome. But only one beer allowed for this bird! The food at Triple 7 I could have take it or leave it. It is funny. Many people often say how good casino food is and how cheap it is. On this trip at least not so much. The food is mid priced I would say and often times is sub par to a regular restaurant outside The Strip.  I ordered a Taco Salad here and it tasted fresh enough but also seemed uninspired and didn't really have the TLC needed to make it a good dish. The guacamole also tasted a bit odd.  If Triple 7 didn't have such good beer I would not have been so generous on the star giving. The food didn't impress me and was one of my least favorite meals. But not the beer. Ho no!

EoiwvUcxa0_VdyxugrHOFA.text: Drive by here many times and finally decided to try it out.  Glad we did, service was great, food was good, prices were reasonable (we were here at Happy Hour) and atmosphere was fun!  We will definitely come ba

fPEjAlC1A_trm6rCOHegNQ.text: Service was ok. Got the food pretty fast, but the fish and chips gave me food poisoning.

yYdrCYJriICFoeOi6Fm-Fg.text: Hmm, this place really deserves a 1-Star review due to the lack of service but if she wasn't such a scatter-brain, this place would be 4-stars... Our waitress waited 20 mins before we flagged her down to serve us, had to flag her down for each refill of our drinks, had to flag her down for add'l orders... Lady was never around!  Triple 7 is a micro brewery... And I have to say, EW. I had the pale ale and well, it goes in tasting like Sierra Nevada and once it settles in your stomach, UGH!!! Horrible after taste! That alone prevents me from ever drinking any of their brews-- EVER.  The saving grace for this review NOT being a 1-Star review is the fact that the guacamole burger wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be! LOL But when you slap some guac on anything, it always tastes 10 times better!  Burger was good. Beer was "EW" and the service was beyond horrible. Don't come here in a hurry... You'll have to wait a very LONG time.

qSowgYOsmqAf0dQPLmFKNg.text: Good food, decent beer, it's definitely better priced than most places in Vegas.  I wish they had more craft beer or more options for the beer that they brew...not everybody likes IPA's and lagers.  The food was very good and that is reason alone to go back.  Portions are more than enough and the staff is very friendly.  The casino itself is amazing!  I love these old classic places.  I'll take this over those new boring casinos with an upscale 'character'...really, no character is more like it.  I will come back here for the food and maybe they will have a slightly better selection for beer next time.

hQhKIXjXckjbyqliURyBog.text: Whenever my mom and I go to Vegas, we always go to the 777 Restaurant for dinner since the Market Street Cafe (at the California) usually has a long line.  During this trip, we visited the restaurant twice.    With the first visit, we ordered burgers (mom got the cheeseburger and I got the mushroom burger).  She opted for sweet potato fries and I got regular fries.  The burgers came out quickly and they were cooked the way we wanted.  Nothing too spectacular...  But on the second visit, we ordered their BBQ chicken pizza and an order of potstickers.  The potstickers were okay and came with a tasty sauce.  The pizza was awesome!  It was a bit bigger than one from CPK and was enough for the two of us to share.  There was just the right amount of chicken, onions, and barbecue sauce on each piece.    The atmosphere is somewhat noisy and it was hard to have a real conversation without yelling across the table.  There are various sports shows going on around the bar.    I know that we'll return the next time we come to Vegas.  I'll just order another pizza to try.

5Af0lvZxaSoOz_mf3AYvWA.text: Great selection of Triple 7 house brewed beers and pretty good food, but a little bland. Great atmosphere with plenty of bar seats and tables. Will come back for sure for the beer. Will eat lunch or dinner elsewhere. This is in a not so desirable part of town, wouldn't venture here at night.  Go during the day,enjoy some really good beers and get back to the good restaurants on the strip.

lhwlhXoHyPBU2E2-Gnlfpg.text: We had a particularly horrible experience at this restaurant with the family. A huge delay in getting a seated and you could see the servers were clearly overwhelmed and which I do understand but it's not really our problem they refused to hire extra staff.  Upon getting seated it was at least another 15 just to get an order in. When we finally got our food vegetables had clearly been frozen and were  still almost cold,  meat was not cooked correctly and just all-around a dismal experience. Go else where.

SJEHol-LyINlhx9KRmdpVg.text: I've wanted to try this place for a while but never got over here on my last couple trips to Vegas. Well, I finally made it and I wasn't disappointed. This place has a large, open, airy atmosphere with glassed in areas so you can see the brewery. Their prices are much better than the typical gouging you get on the strip.  The Good: I loved their sirloin and black bean chili. The meat was tender, flavorful, and a refreshing change from the typical ground beef you find in chili. I like chili and this is one of the better versions of this dish I've had.    The Grilled Orange Roughy was nicely seasoned, without detracting from the flavor of the fish. The portion was good if not overly generous.    I'm a bit of a cheesecake snob so I wasn't sure about trying their deep fried cheesecake. Fortunately I decided to give it a shot. This was surprisingly good! They take a slice and cover it with a sugar tempura batter, then fry it. I suspect the cheesecake is either frozen or partially frozen before they fry it since the center was VERY cold, although not quite frozen. The crust is crisp and crunchy, giving the cheesecake a very different texture than I'm accustomed to. The flavor of the cheesecake itself was very good too, rich, smooth, and creamy.    I also tired the beer sampler which was a great way to try all the micro brews they had available. You get 5 5oz glasses for $6. All the beers were solid offerings, good and nicely balanced flavors. Despite this, there were no unique standouts that made me sit up and say wow. If you like your IPA's SUPER hoppy you'll be disappointed. Instead they went for a more tempered, balanced approach, which I certainly appreciated since I'm not an IPA fan.  The Bad: One of the sides I got with the orange roughy was rice and that's all it was, just white rice. They made no attempt to season it or do anything to it, just a pile of white rice. With all the other flavors going on everywhere else I thought this was a glaring omission. It was also something I didn't order, but I'll get to that next.  The Indifferent: The service was pretty good overall. Most of the time my waitress checked back regularly but there were a couple times where she seemed to disappear for a while (and they weren't particularly busy). The main reason I'm putting the service here is because she got my order wrong. The fish was supposed to come with the vegetable of the day and choice of potato. I chose mashed potato and got plain white rice. If the overall service had been just a little poorer I would have put it in the bad instead of indifferent.

M2Q3sQEDVH-WpSOZVlXdAQ.text: Natasha and our hostess were great.  They have great bourbons along with their beers.  Came 2 nites.  But don't drink the wine.

ic3k67Jd6Vonkr11uKwcvA.text: I would recommend this restaurant to everyone.  I loved their Oyster Shooters.  Their burgers are good too. My husband had their Rueben sandwich and he said it would as just ok. A bit too oily for him. My daughter had the Fish and Chips was good and she would recommend it.

vY-DDSVA1u5llW5xBB7utw.text: Every time I come to Las Vegas, I make a point to come here only because it feels so comforting and homely. This last time, I came during a slower shift and wasn't greeted for almost 15 minutes. Its usually not like this.  When our server did show up, it turned out to be the same server we had the night before! I forgot her name but she was great! Really made up in the lack of service in the beginning.

ZJic9EicJVG8waafnfpf5w.text: Horrible service. Took 20 mins just to take our order. Beer tasted flat. Food was average.

HpOCsf3rLXHmCrnVkTnBdw.text: My favorite place to eat when I'm staying downtown.  I very rarely go for traditional dinner in Vegas, so trips to The Chart House, Vic & Anthony's or Hugo's Cellar kind of go out the window.  Aside from that, I just don't want to spend a fortune on a meal when I'm going to spend the balance of my evening gambling, drinking, and wandering around Fremont St.    I usually wander over to the Triple 7 between 12 AM to 3 AM, and no matter what I've ordered, I've never had a bad meal there.  That's telling for me, because usually a place will have a few duds, and you just have to learn what not to order.  Trust me when I say the Triple 7 always delivers good food.  I read other reviews refer to this place as a gem, and they are correct.  It's what you want when you look to a meal you can enjoy at any hour.  Some of my "Must Try" recommendations are the Portobello Mushroom Sandwich, Triple 7 Wings (when you're taking down a few of their Triple 7 Brews), Monterey Chicken Sandwich, Fish & Chips, or my drunken go to: Baked Italian Sub.    Look, I could go on and on, if you're looking for a solid meal and you're downtown, this is by far the best place to eat at. Give it a shot....

S9cwu4yEaxhVzdndoh-uSA.text: Great beer selection, food is really good with a great selection. Great place to watch sports! Try the wings for sure!

nhM2LVQSBnStlQCbdlXV2w.text: I love this place good is good prices are fantastic they have good beer on tap! I love there wings and pizza, they also have really good sushi!

NK4QJHigl7ZVmfD09_yT_Q.text: Cool pub style bar downtown Las Vegas.  I like how easy it is to get here!  Never mind the homeless people walking around outside they are harmless.  The food here is pretty good.  Had the calamari and wings.  The clamari was light, crispy and tender.  The wings were crsipy, juicy and big.   It is a nice atmosphere in here.  I like walking through Main Street Station - it feels a little bit old school in there.  the bar itself is open and inviting.  The service is good.  It has a nice friendly atmosphere.  A good place for large groups because it is big.  It is just a nice place to kick and drink a few beers!

hcfUhrMfQsiCoKCU4u3taw.text: The Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery was conveniently located inside my hotel, the Main Street Station Hotel. I came three times in five days. To the restaurant. Not in my hotel room. Please get your mind out of the gutter.  My 11 day work trip to Las Vegas lead me from The Strip to Old Las Vegas. It's definitely not a place to be "seen in the scene." But "Old Vegas" has to be experienced. It's full of charm, character, and characters.   Seriously, the sun goes down and the weirdos come out to play. It's freaking awesome.  Anyway, this place provides good service, good food, and good service at great prices. What's not to like about that?  The menu has a variety of dishes and house brews. There is something on the menu for everyone. And it's all super cheap. My meals consisted of the fish and chips, fish tacos, and a bacon cheeseburger. It was good, good, and super good.  Speaking of good, the service was as well. The servers were helpful, patient, and never screwed up an order, even if we had a party of 8 or more. Nice.  Anyway, if you are off The Strip and exploring Old Vegas, this is an inexpensive dinner option. And the variety of beer will keep the drinks flowing and the party going.  Viva Las Vegas.

Bt1F4wK0DRyv9GELcHeAgQ.text: Can't go wrong with two free steak dinners!  The Seafood Buffet was too long of a wait so my wife and I decided to wait 15 minutes... we couldn't have been happier!  Excellent service and all sports shown on huge screens, make this place a must stop while in the Downtown Las Vegas Area.    You can thank me later. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmmm

ycj5Lpcc1ooPvwOJGJDXMQ.text: Food was ok, nothing special. Good happy hour specials, if you're there on a weekday. Not much of a wait to be seated. Service ok, if you get Theresa she will completely ignore you once you say you're done drinking. We were trying to get her attention for a good half hour, and once we decided to just leave cash and get out she decided to pop by as we were leaving.

qj_rAevmJ1iJBnG42eF3pg.text: Best Korean short ribs, husband ordered the 777 Cuban and loved it!!!!pair it with a high roller gold beer. Friendly bar tenders.

GZOJD3o5xP7pzYnL9ECwgw.text: One of many restaurants that does honor the Boyd's travel meal coupon.  This restaurant is located in the Main Street Hotel, we have been to Main Street countless times, usually travel with my mother in law, and she doesn't care for the "bar" type of environment so we could never eat here having her with us.  This particular travel, it was just me and my mister, so we were excited to give this place a try finally.  We visited the restaurant everyday during our stay at a near-by hotel.  Items we ordered during our many visits included, sushi, cheese burger w/blue cheese, chicken wings, a creamy chicken pasta dish, garlic bread, pepperoni pizza, strawberry short cake, and the main reason for our repeat visit is the root beer float!    My mister and I did not like any of the foods, none of it! the creamy chicken pasta looked good, but it was sooo bland!, I gagged after my third scoop.  The pasta noodles was way over cooked, the sauce tasted like thick cream with no taste, hardly any chicken but they did give a lot which I wasted 90% of.   I've had better frozen pepperoni pizza and didn't care to the leftovers with us. The strawberry shortcake was huge, how can you go wrong with a ssc? Well, sadly, we didn't care for this either.  The cake portion tasted kind of weird, almost like a corn bread texture and look, but a bit sweeter.  I can't recall if the strawberry's were fresh or frozen?  Hardly ate any of it.   My mister ordered the sushi, and had a bad craving for sushi, ate a couple, and said he tasted better from Costco, pre-made sushi, sitting in the refrigerator.   Good thing we were using our meal coupons, so it didn't bother me too much.   BUT!!!, let me tell you! The ROOT BEER FLOAT, is the best I have ever tasted.  The vanilla ice cream is served in a chilled frosty tall mug, and the Henry Weinhard root beer is left in the bottle.  One serving of this delicious RBF is enough for both of us.  This is usually the only item that we have to pay for.  So refreshing, and satisfying, even on a cold winter night haha.

8PIXl2pJO9tzKy0FmseArg.text: Hanging with my peeps at the Main Street station.  Haven't been here for a while but it's still great and has a great beer selection and awesome service.  I was really happy with the Royal red beer. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. good times @ 777

n6jXKNudlVz-36l53rDuTA.text: Went for dinner here with my mom tonight around 9ish and sat at the bar. The bartender was pleasant but maybe a little flustered.   My mom order a burger with fries and enjoyed her meal. I ordered the Sante Fe salad. My salad was good but when I got it I noticed there was no cheese on it and I thought that maybe I read the menu wrong, so I asked the bartender if I could get a side of cheese for the salad and he kind of acted shocked and shrugged his shoulders and said ok.. well he charged me 1.25, no problem if I'm asking for something that's not an ingredient on the menu but I later looked up the menu online and there it  was in the description... jack cheese....   Ugh... I want to like this place but I don't like to be charged for something I didn't receive the first time... oh well. Just be sure to check your tab and the menu is my advice.   --- I wasn't sure if I was going to come back here but my husband was starving and didn't want to wait for the Sunday brunch at the buffet.   We ordered the trio fries and potstickers for appetizers. Hands down so good. Fries were so hot and crispy and the dipping sauces were great. Pot sticks yum!   Hubby got the Cuban with onion rings and I got the Katsu sliders with potato salad. Both were decent, maybe a little dry but I loved the potato salad. So good.   We also had 3 stoli $4 mules each and wow strong and amazing. I wish they were a little more ginger and lime but the man loved them a lot lol   Once again, I checked the bill like last visit and was charged for an extra mule, easy fix but like I mentioned in the last review, check your check and make sure everything adds up before paying.   Better experience and food this time so I'm glad I was able to try them again.

Z5leyClRMuw9VXdWJYg1fA.text: Tasty beers & REALLY good French onion soup! Cool atmosphere and friendly staff as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AGKvlgLXTPZ9w2sKWjNHrQ.text: Had the pleasure of friends treating me to dinner here last night and so glad I decided to join in. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Entire menu looks delicious making a decision hard. You can't go wrong with anything you order.  I eventually went with the prime rib dish myself. We were shocked how fast our food arrived, and my friends and waitress kept laughing because no one could get a peep out of me after that. I was busy! Shout out to the fried cheesecake as well.  P.S. Don't forget to have them validate your parking for you before you leave and save yourself $10.

kQYwd2RxnIFZCT70NAPOfQ.text: Good beers brewed in house. Late night dining. Great greasy appetizers that will keep you going when your out gambling! Triple 7 is located inside the Main Street Casino downtown in Vegas. It is a short walk from the Fremont Street Experience and is always a hustling busy spot to watch t.v. or a sports game while you grab a bite and take a brake from gambling. They have a grill and offer every type of burger you can think of. They also have a full bar so if beer isn't your thing, no worries. They got you covered. The service can vary depending on how packed the room gets. Come in with a casual vibe and you wild be just fine!

F0VuA3sRkMvbH57MrGbdIg.text: This place is located in the Main Street casino. They are open late unless they have a cleaning scheduled. They have a huge selection of beers and also offer beer samplers. The food ranges from pizza to steaks and even sushi. It's more of a sports bar/eating place. Depending on the time you come service can be hit or miss. Overall food is pretty good and it's very convenient if you're staying downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese sticks

yJI0Wlk7b5RYHmktrWm60A.text: Okay honestly the food here sucks. You can tell it's frozen and not fresh which is meh. The good things about this place are the service and the coupons/discounts they got goin on. They seated my party of 9 fairly quick and it was a full house but they were so nice. Also my cup was cracked so my soda kept leaking all over the table :/ .

antFeuLDMV9mKkRm329WwQ.text: My wife and I only had beers here so I can't comment on the food at all. However based on what I saw on the menu I would definitely come back! The beer is pretty good. Generally I only like lighter beers like blondes and golds but not porters/stouts and definitely not IPAs. Still didn't like the IPA (I don't think I ever will) but the porter we got in the flight was great! And of course we loved the high roller gold. The atmosphere is very chill and I would love to have food here in the future!

DZsCiDIeSK-hGzvc0oh4cw.text: What a great, off-strip dinner! I'm in Vegas for a conference and my sister joined me for some fun. Given a very small per diem, I was looking for a nice steak dinner without the strip prices. My fellow Yelpers recommended the 777 Brewery, and I'm glad they did!  We started with drinks, a Black Chip Porter and Sis had a mojito. Both were tasty. The porter was a bit mild, but had a light, smooth, nutty taste. Sis said her mojito was very good. Next, we had the pot sticker app and it was awesome, one of the best I've had. I then had a "side salad" that was the size of a meal, so we split that. Finally, our 16 oz rib eyes came out. They were delicious! Sis had a perfect rare and mine was a perfect med rare. Baked potato was awesome, the side veg was the only meh part of the meal. I was so full, it didn't matter. My only disappointment was I couldn't take my leftovers home.  Our total bill was $56!  After dinner, we walked the two blocks back to Fremont Street for more fun. Oh, and the casino was fun too!  If you want a get off the strip and have a great meal, head over to the 777 Brewery!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying a Black Chip Porter

6KksEP06Vl2uRWvZ4oba6w.text: What a great meal we had at Triple 7 !! Our server, Ashley  went out of her way to see that we were taken care of. Prices were more than fair.  Happy Hour me u can't be beat. The food was great, service was superb.  Highly recommended  !!!!!!!!

yzhNt1Qy2TFbbBsZSBeEog.text: Great Fried Calamari. Sauce too sweet. Three sample fries. With salsa ranch. Bbq. Sauce. Used salsa ranch for all.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J5OR9yzQmX0uXTyvB9ZhfA.text: If you see a large party inside just quickly back away and start finding elsewhere to eat. Just a few days ago my partner and I went to check it out, we were excited to check out a new place. It took about 15 minutes for us to be seated which was normal, though we will say the hostess was just randomly placing people where ever she would find a place, we sat down for a few minutes and our waitress comes over and says "I'll be right with you", we were okay with that, until it turned into 20 mins of waiting just to get our drinks at least. Well when she took our drink order we took advantage and ordered our food (a burger and a sandwich). Well minutes go by and everyone seems to just be attending to this bachelorette party, the waitress comes back about 40 mins later apologizing about the delay but offered us some soup. We waited it out but it was now an additional 35 mins, and this point I was bothered because all we ordered where some sandwiches. So I decided that this was to ridiculous so we left. I was just so amazed of how that went down. I wish it would have been better honestly.

CkdNPPA7Yc6cYMEiAVJVwA.text: As usual, Sam is the man at the sushi counter.  He does well with what he has provided.    They have recently tweaked their menu.  I tried the oxtail chili cheese fries this time around.  Pretty ono!  Next time I'll get to the kalbi tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Chili Cheese Fries

ppezR6Ak24TRrYNQA7mnoA.text: If you're looking for a place to eat and drink at any hour, this is the place. Stands alone as a micro brewery, again open 24 hours. The staff is excellent and it's perfect for any size group.

o9f472WDq-e-cF12zVocrg.text: We called three hours before our dinner time to set a reservation for 20 and they were able to accommodate with no problem. Our waitress was Tammy and she was very sweet and fun to have service with. The manager came out introduced himself and made sure we were all happy with our experience. Everyone's food was exactly as they ordered and very good!!! Thank you Triple 7 for making my husband's 50th birthday dinner success and a wonderful time for all our guests! Sandy M.

3AZfqiIkRc9DO13J_mhx_A.text: Managed to get a table for 10 here during the big game between Duke and Butler.   I had the mahi mahi plate.  It was delicious.    It was served blackened with a nice salsa on top.  Steamed rice and fresh string beans were included on the dish.  It is a bar/brewery in downtown Las Vegas so I was only a little disappointed in their lack of a kids menu.  My 10 year old son had the half pound hot dog.  It was huge, he could only finish half of it.  My husband tried the teriyaki chicken sandwich.  He said it was good but on the small side.  I also tried one of my daughter's BBQ ribs.  It fell off the bone and had some flavorful sauce basted on it.  The service was attentive despite the fact that none of us ordered any alcohol.

gBTy4dKSfajspPts-gTxrQ.text: This place was pretty good. From what I remember. I was pretty drunk that night. My wife her friend and I stumbled in to the place to get something to eat i wanna say 9 or 10 pm at night on a Thursday. We were seated quickly. Order drinks. I think we had like 3 appetizers. The Asian pot stickers. Which were pretty good. I am usually scared of Asian food just because it usually gives me stomach problems. But they were good. The cheesy garlic bread, and the meat lovers flat bread. Both were great. Our server was also good. always made sure our glasses were full of water and what ever we were drinking. I wish i would have tried one of the beers. I definitely will next time i am downtown Vegas and hungry.

vyS3p-kPJcyiQGkuk-_ZVg.text: This is one of my absolute favorite places to go on fremont.  I absolutely plan nights with friends and this is the first place we go for dinner and beer.  Their royal red lager is my absolute favorite and the great thing is that when you're in the casino the bar sells the microbrews for like a dollar something.    Their sweet potato fries are fabulous I was actually bummed when I took my sister who was visiting from Chicago there and they were out, the chicken sandwiches are fabulous theyre tender and just mouthwatering.    I def. recommend this place to anyone who's never been or wants a moderately priced meal good food good atmosphere at a casual place.   They also have seasonal beers, and a sampler of all of their beers which is really great youget a taste of everything.

mJdCmISqpHUzHNmVnuay_A.text: I wish Yelp allowed for half star ratings...I'd rate this place a 3 and a half stars.  Ate here last weekend.  Nothing extraordinary about this place.  The service was quick and friendly and the food was good enough to satisfy my appetite.  It's a great place to watch the games on their big screen tvs while you wait for your food to come out.

4r8vi-kqAOCP1B25FM7WRA.text: Love this place! Its great for watching the game while grabbing some ono grinds!   Their loco moco, wings, saimin and burgers are great. They're also open late night, so when you're done gambling and headed back to your room and wanna grab a late night bite to eat, head over there.   Their servers are really nice and friendly, which makes everything even better. They also have their own beers - try them, they're really good.   Overall, I really like it here. I definitely suggest making this a stop if you're staying Downtown - and even if you're not. :)

03XA_cJjRjJt8CXXUC9C3g.text: We come here for dinner every time we're in Vegas and almost always get the prime rib. The food and the beer are great and at a great price which is why we keep coming back. The service is meh at times,  especially when they're busy.

w976m7wjbRg4Dz1j3i-xMg.text: This may be the best-kept secret in Downtown Las Vegas. The food, while not the 5 Star fare you'll find at Joel Robuchon's in the MGM, is decent --- especially considering the sleazy locale. It's open pretty late, which is nice if you need a rest from the $3 blackjack tables at the Four Queens. The best thing about this joint: the beer sampler is only 5.50 for 25 oz of beer!  Random observation: there are a _lot_ of Hawaiians working at, and patronizing, this establishment.

qaBnlOgEyF4r5Ijvr1pIpA.text: We got to our hotel late and this was one of the few places open near the hotel. We decided to go in and it was enjoyable. Wasn't crowded as it was after midnight on a Wednesday night. Had a couple of the their beers but missed out on the mango beer. Maybe next time. The burgers were good and hit the spot after our long flight and drive to the hotel. Didn't get a chance to visit after the first night but when we stay at the Main Street Hotel, will for sure go back again, especially if they have their mango beer.

9wAgwiBsbLEBaxS5j-wbmw.text: The wait was crazy long. sat and waited and when she did come and ask what I wanted she walked away as I was ordering. So we walked out.

7geteyvGqzw8d10GvMhk4g.text: Ate there last night. I have been going there for years. We ordered the chicken Marcella and the pork loin.  The chicken was grisley and spongy as if it had been microwaved. The chops were bland and the green beings were soggy. I have no idea what has happened to this place.

Dk_PLyO5g-POTJ0tKYVwLg.text: They have an excellent IPA. This is definately a place to check out, the age of this Casino has been kept beautifully.

JZYoridj-4EO0WLCbJQZUQ.text: GREAT brews and nice prices on the beer and loved the Pumpkin Ale mate.  I had the buffalo sandwich, it was ok.  I was thinking there was some meat on the sandwich but it was a veggie meal.  I got the garlic-y special fries and they were a nice adder, good pickles too so get some extra if you like pickels.  The partner had the special which was a bbq, bacon chicken sandwich and it was the bomb.  We ended up getting a side of the bbq sauce to dip our fries in, it was tast-EE!!!!  The area isnt that great and the casino is old, but the craps table is hot and it was fun!    Don't ward off because it's a little off the path.  Get over to this joint and check it out.  You can NOT go wrong gambling here or drinking the home brew through the casino!!!!

eaqqP5z-dht020DJuaDS6A.text: Walking through the Main Street Station was like a trip back in time. Balconies, tin ceiling and chandeliers oh my. Things were looking good so far as my friend and I made our way past the low limit tables and surly old gamblers toward the brewery. We were there on a Saturday night and the place wasn't all that busy. We decided to sit at the bar for dinner; easier access to the brews was my logic.  The selection is what you expect from any brew pub...a blonde, a brunette, a red head; yes I'm talking beer still. The entrees are subpar to say the least. The steak was not seasoned and the pork chop was very thin and tough; sawing through that was quite a feat.   Bartender service; and I use that term very loosely:  very poor. 3 bartenders, 8 patrons at the bar including us. It took 10+ mins to be greeted and when we were it was not friendly at all. The bartender had to go back and forth between us and his POS for each item we ordered.  Really, you can't remember 2 simple orders for gods sake? How about a pen and paper to make up for your lack of memory or listening skills?  They never once checked on us during our meal. Was it because they knew the repsonse already? They never once offered us another beer.  Let's do some basic math for those following along; usually the higher the bill the higher the tip, no?  Finally, we are presented with the bill...finally we can leave and forget about the poor excuse for a bartender. Have you ever seen this?  Now he hovers in front of us waiting for us to tip/total and sign. Haha the joke is on you; you can stare us down all you want. You see, we don't like math either and the bill total plus ZERO tip is easy math. Get a clue...or better yet, a job that doesn't require customer interaction, common sense or the listening skills that even a 6 year old can handle.  One day, I'm going to see this guy standing on Fremont begging for money...yes, I will chuckle to myself, maybe a little out loud too.   100% service fail leads to 1 star; your mediocre food and decent atmosphere is worth 2 stars but your staff brings you down to the lowest rating allowed by Yelp. I don't make the rules here; if I did you'd receive 0 stars.

JF52Z-dBwzQ19Gk2zkfOKg.text: Beer was not bad, but the fresh raw oysters were the best I ever had.  Next time I'm in Las Vegas for business, I will go straight for the oysters.

XvEe0Lv4Dp-RcrlchUaALw.text: PATHETIC. This place has gone from bad to worse in a matter of months. Wish I could give you Zero stars.   I decided to give 777 another chance since my review back in March. I wish that I didn't.   As I said in my prior review, the best thing here are the microbrews. Correction, the best thing about 777 WAS the microbrews. I ordered a High Roller and immediately noticed that it did not look the same. It used to be a golden color, now its more of a red/brown.  I asked the bartender whats up with the beer and he said that they got a new brewmaster. The High Roller tasted nothing like before. The bartender said that many people have been complaining and offered to give me a different kind. I went with the Black Chip. It tasted like right (must have been an old batch before the new guy came).   I ordered a burger and ate it at the bar and also ordered some korean tacos to-go. A few minutes went by and I noticed that the bartender quickly swap out my bill with a new one. I looked at it and he was charging me $2 because I was taking some food to-go. WTF? The bartender said he can't do anything about it and said he can get the manager. Yes, do that I requested. The manager came out and I told him that I have been coming to 777 for 15 years and and this place has fell to $hit. I told him the food prices went up considerably and the quality has never got better. I also mentioned that the beer is not the same. He said its a different color but should taste the same. What?? This guy is clueless. Get a clue and rename your beers something else, and not try to pass off $hit as diamonds to your customers.  I finally mentioned to him about nickel and dimeing me for $2 because I wanted to take an order home. He took the $2 off but still.  I am NEVER EVER COMING BACK.

qoTsCdUYuiObo99sn27_wg.text: A great variety of beers to choose from. The variety of beers consists of lights to ambers to darks. Can't choose, try a sampler. Offers a great price and a perfect amount of variety. Why choose when you can have them all. The to go growler lets you have the great beer at home. Has everything on the menu from sushi to nachos. The prime rib burrito is my favorite. A huge burrito is enough for two people or some for diner and some for lunch tomorrow. Pizzas are o.k., but could use a bit of improvement taste wise. Service is fast and friendly. This place can tend to get really busy around dinner time.

YNhWaUlfGfarerBlPiryMg.text: Excellent beers, good sushi, exciting atmosphere. The beer sampler for 5.99 is great. Went right during dinner rush hours and didn't have to wait.

xUS_rmmFJh2GNH0hdQBn2Q.text: My husband and I went here because we read great reviews but it was horrible. The beer was bad and the burgers were horrible. Won't recommend this place. Never coming back for sure

a-7oG7A2iTU9WN_QWGo96g.text: This place is a cool little spot to lunch or get a drink after work. The staff here is always nice and the are very accommodating to large parties. This bar/ restaurant has a micro brewery inside as well as a full bar. They always has sports on the tv's and it is usually a fun atmosphere. The menu is pretty diverse so there is usually something everyone. Granted I don't go here often but I know I will be back to Triple7 and I would recommend it to friends.

A9Pp6XDH_e5cyHD2ZLI3oQ.text: Way good food and reasonable pricing. Staff is friendly and efficient. Definitely a keeper.

W2cYk1SMkXs1nRvRKdSqIA.text: My friends and I stopped here for dinner after gambling for 2 or 3 hours in the Main Street Station Casino.  I had read several reviews giving this eating establishment high marks.  The restaurant was very busy (about 7pm), but we were seated immediately without any delay.  There are long bars on each side of the room with seating in between.  Our server came right away, delivered menus, and took our drink orders.  They offer a sampler of 5 or 6 different micro-brews you can get for $5.50.  Two of us ordered this sampler.  I enjoyed all the varieties, but I think I like the "Royal Red" brew the best.    The menu was quite varied.  I ordered the pale ale ribeye, medium well.  Sides were baked potato and green beans.  I also ordered an appetizer of fried calamari.  The calamari was some of the best I've ever had.  Generous portion, very crispy and light.  My steak came out more on the medium rare side instead of medium well.  I almost sent it back, but I don't really like to complain so I went ahead and ate all but the very center.  The sides were just okay.    Overall, the food wasn't bad, the drinks were great, and we enjoyed the lively atmosphere and the casino/hotel itself as well.  Will be going back again next year.

yieq1El06mD6kTeWT_KA5w.text: We went here on a Sunday afternoon and it was PACKED. It had pretty atmosphere with all the microwbrewery equipment visable thru the glass w/ a sushi bar to boot. it also felt kind of haunted.. that old style feel, which really worked for it. We both ordered a hamburger , me just a plain ole cheeseburger which was delish- patty had that flamebroiled taste to it. was good. got pretty full so ate mostly the meat and cheese. The fries were ok but got cold fast. My bf ordered the bacon cheeseburger with the onion ring in it.. forget the technical name on the menu for it but it was good but he said he wouldnt order it again b/c it was so messy. I told him just to take out the onion ring.. problem solved :) oh and the bbq sauce. I'd come back def. for the HH specials they have going on but ... those dont pertain to football nights?? wth? most places have specials FOR football nights so that didnt sit well with me.

R5CKGHSOY97d2XkUcPq7EA.text: Shrimp and artichoke dip, flatbread pizzas, and cheap homebrew. Tried the sampler until the happy hour special started, then stuck with the IPA. Did not have a weird aftertaste like some IPA's out there. I will be back.

HT-xd7Tt67R8DMSMfPaokg.text: Was there last December and was very disappointed.  Previously, in 2008, I had a good burger and salad with the beer sampler.  Fast forward to December 2010, I was really hungry and ordered the extra large prime rib.  It was not much bigger than the regular portion and was dry and tough.  I ordered it medium rare and got a medium.  Added on the soup for a few dollars more and got a teacup size portion of really crappy soup.  Needless to say, portion control was strickly enforced and left me still very hungry  So hungry I ordered an appetizer, hot crab and artichoke dip.  It was like soup.  Need not say more.  Unfortunately, Yelp does not have negative ratings, or I would have given a minus 2.

9RbeKyVnBGu5MH-weRuA2Q.text: Came in for quick apps and cocktails. Really surprised about the portions - very generous - had the fried green beans, pot stickers and edamame. Much more than we expected. My friend's Maker's and coke perfect, my Crown rocks  kinda light, but can't complain about the prices - here it was  $10 or so on The Strip it was almost $30 for the 2, wow location, location, location. Want to come back for the microbrews.

Dr0yNo_8hg5G79PlVAxH9g.text: I've eaten at this place a few times now and they have good food at decent prices. After losing tons of money at the table, this place is a win. Their beers are good and the burger is always a winner here.

H5q3ueMREx62OMJsPpAQbQ.text: More a locals spot but good to try if you are staying downtown. Beer is alright, but the specialty beer is amazing. Food is the best party because it's amped up bar food plus they have a Sushi bar. Great hangout place after downtown concerts or a 51s game

FjKW8_wnfKOrxOI72Pdpaw.text: The garlic fries and calamari apps were great. The sushi not good. The dragon roll sauce was not right, it was more like a polynesian sauce.  The brewmaster roll had way to much rice. My brother in-law had the guac burger, he said it was just okay. They do have great prices and our waitress was great.

nuOsaAmt02g3fTmg5drnDg.text: The cheesy garlic bread is AWESOME and the prime rib is a good deal too.  Service is a little slow, as this place is always packed, but not too shabby.

Nxd38CZxmWac4UIDFBz5Xg.text: You can't go wrong with this place if you are staying in downtown Las Vegas. Come for the beer and enjoy the nachos! If sushi is for you there is also a sushi bar inside.

sdhSzFnlreijaEVGydoTgQ.text: Wanted a place to eat that I hadn't tried in Vegas before.  I read yelpers review of this place and couldn't believe it was less expensive and higher rated than the Country Club at Wynns (one of my personal favorites).  Well it is good but it is no CC.  They shouldn't even be in the same category (American traditional).  But the truth is, it is way better than most places I have been to in Vegas.  The Nachos were crazy yummy and paired perfectly with their Pale Ale.  I'm a bit of a microbrew snob but their Pale Ale was very flavorful and hearty.  It is inside Main St Casino which is not a bad place although I decided to drive over to the Nugget from there instead of walk even though it was just about 3 blocks.    The food is above average.  The service slightly above average but for some reason they were very slow on bringing me the check.  In their defense, they were getting busier really quickly.    This would be a good place to catch the game and hang with friends.  All the amenities of a heavily TV'd sports bar but with real food.  I think the Country Club is substantially better this Triple 7 is far better than most places in Vegas.  Very nice!

6Xqbrj7powYtJaESkkyyfg.text: Triple 7 Brewery is another find located in Main Street Station. This place is a big roomy open area micro brewery with a sushi bar inside along with many flat screen TV for sports games. Triple 7 has an descent menu for lunch/dinner and late night along w/ specials. They have everything from salads, pizzas, Sandwiches, burgers, chicken strips, fish n Chips, mexican food, steak, prime rib dinners, shrimp, sushi, oyster/shooters, full bar and more. I like there Nachos and prime rib special for $6.99-$7.99 i think...The have a happy hour and beer specials, House specials for a $1 during Happy hour and late night specials. They usually have games playing or playing music. This place is Open 24 HRS.......

GV4vQ-vRmkfGKPrrm3BYOw.text: Had to try four times to get into the place...first three times they were 'closed for cleaning' In the mid evening ?!?  Anyway, went in just before noon and was seated promptly in the mostly empty place.  Took awhile to get my drink ordered and even longer to get it. The food ordering took even longer.  WTF!  The two other waitresses were almost hovering over their tables and I got the slow poke. Ordered the California Burger and was disappointed as I could barely pick it up or eat it since it fell into a million pieces. The fries were average as was the cost of the food.  A timely refill of my iced tea would have been nice... Murphy's Law of Food Service:  The emptier the place is, the worse the service--happens every time!

1RqsXZkDaedBJuSDY4vWRg.text: I went to this place 2 nights in a row on my trip to Vegas.  The menu has a great selection (great pizza!) and the service is great.  Both nights were late nights and even though the item we wanted wasn't on the menu, the waitress still offered it to us.  The prices were great, the the brewery was a nice place. The hotel/casino area looked great too.  I plan to stay there on my next trip.

PpYRs7LZg_rq-7Eb3ijzDQ.text: Crab and artichoke dip, garlic fries, fried mushrooms, steak and black bean chili, nachos, wings, SUSHI and OYSTERS, STEAKS and home-brewed tap beers. Yes!!

hJuNcWxoWk-uod1_7IAZvA.text: Used to come here years ago for happy hour, sushi and the like, but hadn't been here in a long time, and decided to stop by for lunch.  Was a bit quiet and limited in customers for a mid-day lunch, which was fine by me.  Menu was extensive as ever, with new items that I did not remember (i.e. beer battered tekka-maki - sounds pretty interesting, if not defeating the purpose of tekka-maki).  Anyway, I had a mediterranean chicken sandwich on ciabatta, with greens, roasted red pepper, balsamic, etc...  It was really good, flavorful, fresh, and had a huge roasted red pepper on it.  Came with fries, but I upgraded to onion rings for $1 more.  When the sandwich came, it had fries on the side.  Waitress corrected it quickly (left the fries but I did not eat them), onion rings came out fresh, and were very good, hot, with a good beer batter.  Will plan to coming back for happy hour to try the beer again, and other things.  Great varied menu, and really nice classic space in a classic casino design.

alQJYFLfxfLj9DjwaHWFDQ.text: This place is great. The food is delicious, and practically free it's so inexpensive. They've got a lot of home brews which are great, and they do Monday night Football with giveaways and prizes. The only downside is that it can get pretty crowded. It's still the best restaurant around the Fremont area. Strongly recommended to get dinner at before a Fremont adventure.

raesw3yAerEhVC95b4aNsQ.text: 4 stars - for the beer flight. 5 Stars - PRICE  4 Stars - location  Tried 5 or 6 different beers for $6 bucks. THAT'S AWESOME! It was their flight and the bartender added in their brew of the month. Pumpkin beer, which was surprisingly nice.  I like beer, but I am no "beer connoisseur". The dark beer was ok. There were 2 that I thought were very good, and two that I didn't take a liking to. Sadly, I can't remember which ones. SORRY.  BUT - the flight was well worth it.  Customer service was great. All we ordered was that flight and sat at the bar and had a chance to chat with the bartender. It was pretty slow so we weren't rushed or anything.  First time to this casino for this spot and was pleasantly surprised. Clean casino and fun decor. Would def go back!

r3956EiKLyX9FGmXCku5mA.text: This place is probably my favorite stop in Vegas.  Great atmosphere, great beer, great prices.  The food doesn't disappoint either.  thank you triple 7, so nice to have a cozy sanctuary away from the typical Vegas ripoffs.    Oh yeah... microbrew slot comps too.  ....heaven

EKPnhkelXn5ZRKInP_2TVg.text: This is probably one of the best bars in Downtown Las Vegas!  We have been there a handful of times and it is always busy.  We have only sat at the bar, but you are able to order from the full menu while at the bar.  We went twice this last weekend - the food is decent, drinks are inexpensive (even after happy hour/11pm at night!) and the staff is friendly.  Beers were $4 and well drinks were $3; very clean and fun atmosphere.  We will definitely go back again and again!

Qm8WmCQWsfZviiWyrJJGBQ.text: Poor service. Accommodation for a large party is impossible to none. Hostess with bad attitude. Manager dismissive.  Super  Bowl weekend (Saturday night) and were told a big corporate party was coming. Hence, we couldn't be accommodated in the back of the restaurant, but alas, they never showed.   Our waitress, Kristin, Grace and Alan who were helping her out, were awesome.   Went there for good friends' birthday celebration. Otherwise, would not have been there. And after this experience, not coming back.

UCm3BzEg6kPHY5TKUonPXQ.text: I have been here several times before and it is consistently a great place for food and drinks. We sat at the bar to catch the NBA playoffs. Great service from the bartender, who kept an eye on us despite getting really busy.  BTW, this place gets really noisy when it's full. Menu selections to suit anyone, from bar appetizers to burgers, salads, sandwiches, to full entree's. Our group got something different so we each got a taste.  Definitely recommend 777. Something for everyone!

q_FaAaEG6YEOCAy5E7exjA.text: I only had appetizers. I really enjoyed the raw oysters on the half shell. They were good sized and fresh. I also enjoyed their spinach dip with chips.

Rd9u-9eApCC51XmE-_I7Kg.text: Came here few times on our last trip to Vegas and had a great experience! We sat at the bar and asked the bartender to make up drinks for me, and those times were always surprisingly good. Food was good too. But we mainly came here for the affordable cocktail drinks. Bar is huge, the whole place is huge and nice. Two thumbs up for the great service! Will definitely come back!

kIatZoXSQWQJy4E_D9YGhg.text: Amen for great service.  First time here.  Mahalo to our waitress Kawehi for taking the time to answer some questions we had.  For an appetizer we ordered the Nachos Grande ($9).  A good size for 2, maybe 3 people.  My wife and I also got a beer sampler ($7) 5 5 oz glass of some of their own brews.  Not bad.  For entrees I got the Prime Rib ($16) which came with soup or salad, steamed veggies and a starch.  In my case I got fries.  The wife got the San Francisco burger ($11) with the Vegetarian option of using a portobello mushroom instead of a beef patty (no additional charge) which came with a side of Onion Rings (+$1).  Way too much food.  We had no idea it'd sooooo much food.  We weren't able to finish it all,  Thankfully they provided boxes for us.  Because we were visiting with Vacations Hawaii we were able to use our coupon books and our final bill came out to about $18.  Not bad in my opinion.  Even if we had not used the coupons, I still think the value was there, especially with the great service.  The ambiance is pretty melo with TVs televising sporting events live.  Lighting is dim, but we were cool with that.  Everyone around us seemed to be having a good time which made the experience even better.  It was also nice seeing staff sing happy birthday to a young lady on a table next to us.

TX4pyx19O9hPLvECSInTAA.text: My friends and I had a terrible experience here, they forgot the appetizers that we ordered, forgot the soft drinks we ordered, charges us for the wrong things, made us wait almost 30min before things on the check were corrected, and the Management didn't even seemed like they cared. I will never eat at this restaurant again.

Nng6MKA34imGi6okU-70KQ.text: Solid beers and fast service.  I was still recovering from a buffet so nothing to say on the food.  A little bit off from the main Fremont street activity but also a bit quieter.  Solid selection of beers, nothing exceptional but nothing painful either.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the brewing gear.  Shiny

-qYKegWGoMufIkXyqrX82w.text: Solid lineup of core beers along with a rotating seasonal tap that generally provides something a little more adventurous.  Great appetizers which often times is sufficient reason for us to stop in and get just apps and drinks.  Wide variety of pub fare that even includes fresh made sushi.  If you're in downtown Vegas it's worth stopping in this brewery/restaurant located in the Union Station  Casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonight&#39;s seasonal IPA

L1ksZ4p_82u1pmr6i05H2Q.text: I've never been so disrespectful at a restaurant by a server... we sat down for 15 minutes and nobody even offered us water.  At the time we finally got the attention from a server she said we are busy and you will have to wait for someone to help us.. okay I get it maybe the restaurant was short handed.. the same lady ended up taking our order which we advised her to take notes because we had a lot of items in mind.. she bragged and said I've been here for over 10 yrs..and on the first 3 items she got it wrong and got us attitude.. I decided to go to the bar and get our food from the bartender and she got confrontational and asked if I had a problem.. super threatening like she wanted to fight me!!! Unbelievable!!! My friend called me down and we went a head with our order.. we ordered prime rib Haha it was a piece of over cooked stake .. 30 minutes in the restaurant and nobody offered even a glass of water . Never ever again will come back at this place. Be aware the server's name was Ashley.. dont ask for to much.. she may get overwhelmed and kick your ass.. the manager ... uh we never met her... even though the whole restaurant was aware of how she acted .. customers looked .. people turned heads.. anyways .. we didnt see her. Food was okay.!

b9OMwTabuLUKJVJxIZcJcw.text: A real brewery site with their standard beers with a special seasonal brew. I love to stop by for the seasonal brew. 12/17 its a red rose beer which is like a mild red wheat sour. Delicious.   Variety of dishes available and a sushi bar.  When its busy, it can get crazy in there. When its not so much, its easy to get a seat and a good bite to eat. Friendly bartenders and servers.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red rose beer

oVUiOaddrT3YWRKknXDRFA.text: Excellent beer. I love IPA and they had a very nice New England brew. The food was okay. Go for the beer it is outstanding and after all they are a brewery first.

onM1enx00DMRXyljCiIAyQ.text: We get dinner at this brewery every year when we're in Vegas. It's the perfect place downtown to grab a bite to eat. The food is better than most of what you'll find in Vegas and for a much cheaper price. I don't drink beer but everyone else says the better is good as well.   We got the chicken katsu sliders, the Kahlua pork sliders, and the tiger bomb sushi roll. All of it was very good. We've gotten the flatbreads in the past which are also good.   I would highly recommend checking this place out of you're looking for good reasonably priced food while in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiger bomb roll
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken katsu sliders
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kahlua pork sliders

7PnzXZIhPqsWMfi7ZFR20Q.text: 4 meals , two containing sourdough bread and both sandwiches were spotted with visible mold ! I ordered a rare burger which came out well well done , when these things were brought to the attention of the server she offered to void the moldy meals she said "all that will be voided I'm so sorry" she offered to have the meals remade as they should including my over done burger.. well after receiving the new meals they proceeded to charge us for all the meals except for ONE of the moldy sandwich's , we asked to speak to the manager and the manager was crass and rude and had ZERO understanding or desire to resolve the problem , we stated we didn't feel we should pay for the three meals that came out extremely wrong/moldy , he then proceeded with "fine done take the re done meals" and took our food that had been done the right way and mold free , he didn't even apologize . The server was sympathetic but most of it was out of her control . I went here with my friend we are both from northern Minnesota and don't have these "fancy" places but if this were to occur at any of our restaurants we would be compensated and then some . Awful manager ! Awful cooks !!!

KjGttqbZ45iHZnQGrEEF-g.text: Came for the National Championship-as we always do.  Its usually packed-but we've noticed that in recent years there are a few open tables-and open seats on the bar.  And this is why.  1.). For the past 3 years the bottled beer is not cold.  2.) Lots of TVs -but the sound is horrible.  3.) The food -not as good as before.        The spinach dip -was watery         The nachos -not as good as before          Some stuff came out burnt.  Triple 7 in the past was the place - but slowly its going away.  Too bad!!

X57XMQvUQJv4FwGkCAMJGg.text: This is my favorite brewery/restaurant in town. Really good freshly brewed beers, like there blonde, red, and stout are worth coming here just for that. But wait, how about nice variety of delicious food, and big screen tv's along with great customer service. You get that here as well. This place can be very crowded, and you still get outstanding service. Management and the entire staff deserves an attaboy. Thank you triple 777.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Red
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fiS9oDH4D8_bFwyrutY6fg.text: Always a great spot for late dinner chicken wings are always good service most of ty he time ok s great great selection of micro beers . Double happy hour or social hour good place for your after midnight snacks.. But if you like your French fries crispy you better ask in advance.  Ohhh only females ss servers on a union house .. Kinda weird.

ZOgZrGrc5-dfqvDS2u0dDw.text: Don't appreciate them changing the channel to a basketball game that is not only over & in on 95% of TVs, especially when Dodgers are playing with bases loaded

ww8lBCZGnmUwMDNyIAWg4w.text: We always come here to eat when we visit from Hawaii and it's not very consistent.  Meaning,  sometimes the food we order is good,  sometimes it's not.  However,  this past experience was fairly decent,  thus, resulting with a 4 star review.   The food was not bad.  I got the south western salad... I think that's what it was called? Had the corn,  tortilla chips and lime dressing.... anyway,  it was good, however,  the dressing was just too strong for me.  The lime flavor was just too much for me.  However,  for the most part all the ingredients in the salad complimented each other very well and I enjoyed it.   Service was good.  Lady was very attentive and always checked up on us.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My southwest salad.
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asian salad...? I forgot the actual name.

dSGucjNP17Om2jw-AfJgNA.text: Two things I love about the Triple 7:  For one, it's not out on the main strip and is hidden inside of the California so you don't get the riff-raff of casual Las Vegas street goers looking for a bar. People that come here seem to mostly be local residents and patrons of the California and Main Street hotels.  Two, the last time I came, there was a COFFEE infused beer and I love coffee to no ends. It was amazing while my drink was cold and first came from the tap, however unfortunately as the night went on, it got less tasty and grosser to drink. I know it's not normal for beer but I wish it had come in a smaller glass to keep the drink fresh so when I wanted more, I could get a fresh batch faster.

yb26TOW3076Eku8NqnHnZA.text: Great place to eat and open every day from 11am to 7 am, great bartenders and drinks too

YYXrecDNzKVw11p2nBaSow.text: We love this brewpub at MSS, one of our favorites downtown. After a few hours of roulette, we asked for and received a nice comp from the pit boss for the 777. It was busy, so rather than wait, we sat at the bar, as we only wanted a couple appetizers and drinks. Our 2 favorites apps - the calamari and the 5 cheese bread - perfect with the marinara and ranch. Service and smiles were great from the staff,  we return here every trip to LV, consistently tasty food and relaxing unpretentious atmosphere.

vi0MJioJlNuKfdRuy21LUg.text: I've been there a few times I had the sampler of beer every single one on the sampler was so good she let me try couple other ones off the sampler they have the best beer anywhere when I plan to go back to Las Vegas I have to stop there every time it's worth stopping for just the beer I recommend a sampler of beer and that goes good with the Korean tacos the atmosphere is wonderful and don't forget to stop in to see the Berlin wall in the Men's bathroom

lF6GIKaXzjs5Jxo1jrKRaQ.text: Prices have gone up so Triple 7 isn't the bargain it once was for group dining.  There are some new menu items so we tried the pot stickers (small gyoza, not bad), battered and deep fried green beans (really good with the wasabi based dipping sauce but can't taste the green bean), and stuffed pork chops (ok pork chop but the stuffing's consistency was not good - like stuffing made into baby food.  Too full for dessert and only one visit to Triple 7 on this trip (used to be 2-3 visits, sigh).

YxbpX16MG6kDDrYV_Gtf7A.text: Happy hour wings were terrible- they were the smallest wings I've ever eaten, I don't think there was barely any chicken on them, just ate fried skin;(  The brewery beer was good and cheap!

UdwPj4OjcmEUyCjG8AF5qg.text: As Far as cheep food in Las Vegas, it's great. As far as good beer in Las Vegas, it's great. The service sucks and the ambiance is just slightly better than the main administrative office at your local DMV. This is probably due to the fact there are a bunch of sad people eating while taking a break from losing money in the casino. They try to offset the vibe with tons of sports playing on the many TV's on every wall.  The beer is really good, its too bad the place is stuck in the old smokey casino.  The sushi rice is not quite right. but its alright for the price.    The hot dog simmered in the pale ale with the chili, total worth it. The beer is great!

NLwPa9k5zlrKqsNhxht89Q.text: Hostess seated my wife & I at 10:15pm on Monday night. She said they were closing at 11:00.  Lots of employees, including waitresses doing everything around us except getting our order. Waited over 10 minutes, then left. Unacceptable.

7ARX9r3NpeLHuF0kblw8mw.text: We went during lunch for my mom's birthday. We decided to go here since we had a coupon or gift certificate from Main St casino. We didn't have any beer, so this review is just for the food and service.   Nothing really special about it, except the dessert... the deep fried cheesecake.   It was good, but not good enough to plan an exciting adventure to this dessert, (check out some of my other reviews, I've had a few adventures ;) )   Service was ok.  Food was bleh-ok. So-so.   The waitress we had seemed to be waiting on ALL the other tables on our side of the restaurant. It wasn't packed, but it wasn't empty. There were two waitresses working during a Saturday lunch time. I can see why it wasn't packed. We didn't get any rude service, but didn't get any great service. She didn't check on us enough to be qualified as great-excellent service. Other than taking our order & giving us the check, she checked on us maybe... twice. She seemed like she was just there. Just there for work. Sorry, that won't score you a good tip.   We ordered calamari, the fries, a few dishes, some sushi, and the cheesecake. All of it was okay so-so.   Nothing great about the calamari or fries, fries came with a few dipping sauces. The seasoning on the fries seem to separate from the fries. That doesn't make the fries tasty. The calamari was so-so as well.  No one at our table really liked the dish they got. It was all just okay. Nothing bad. Just so-so quality. I got the fried sushi roll, there was nothing tasty about it. I've had fried rolls before (at breweries/bar type places) and they were delicious. So I was disappointed with this one. I've been to other non-Japanese or non-Asian breweries and bar type places that have good sushi.   Other dishes we ordered were philly cheesesteak it was okay. My brother barely ate half of it. My other brother ordered fish and vegetables, he said it was bland. He only took a few bites and didn't eat the rest. And they usually eat a lot!   We ordered the caterpillar roll, but the waitress gave us a california roll and charged us for caterpillar roll. (it's a few dollars more than a california roll.)   She apologized for it, and changed our bill, but again... she just seemed like she didn't care to serve us (or maybe be at that job.) Who knows...   The fried cheesecake was good, my first time trying it, so I'm glad that was more than okay. But it was just good, not great. Maybe that's also because of the disappointing service and all the other food we had while there.   No one really enjoyed their food, so we probably won't be here again.   If I ever go there again, I'm gonna have to try the mango brew.  They didn't offer us any beer menus so how was I suppose to know?

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried cheesecake w/ strawberries &amp; sauce

ThHDxlbmupbcMgsr3cocUg.text: Lunch on 12/14/2015 - The atmosphere is nice, wide open, tall ceilings, good tvs, and a view of the brewery. But... the beers weren't great (on the scale of ok to poor) although the double down hefeweizen was on par with the style. My friends had the San Francisco burger and the prime rib sandwich and we're happy with those. Waiter was very friendly and no complaints about the service. Giving 2 stars because it's a brewery and should have better house brews in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer sampler
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of brewery from inside the restaurant.

tqtRbAF6nHpjy2K5MyAT6w.text: When I travel I like to visit local breweries.  Usually you find something unique and delicious m, something you can say "go drink this".  In this case, it was their strawberry sour.    It's a good intro sour for people who don't drink sours.  Not to over the top.    Unfortunately the rest of their beers are mediocre at best and you'll find yourself wishing you just went to a bar instead.

dAksoX-ZPAC_xlgRuF0S2A.text: Located in the Main Street Station Hotel and Casino, Triple 7 is my go to restaurant. First off, the ambience is great. There are around 10 flat screens around the entire resto which means that you can watch your favorite sports game from any spot. Secondly, they have a flight of their signature beers ( Five 5 oz glasses) for $5.99!  I've come here many times and have tried the following: triple 7 wings (honey-dijon), caesars salad, cheezy garlic bread, black angus sliders, fried calamari, hot crab and artichoke dip, french onion soup, chicken ciabatta sandwich, korean tacos, blackened salmon, bbq ribs, ribeye steak, prime rib, and....yeah i think thats it.  My go to dish is the blackened salmon served with a pineapple chutney, fresh veges, and rice. I love the spicy and sweet combination of the dish. My wife loves their honey dijon chicken wings. I always bring visitors here bc the food here is a good mix of american comfort food with some asian influence. The only things I would say that are not so good is that the crab and artichoke dip had imitation crab and the chicken ciabatta sandwich had a little too much bell pepper. They have lunch specials of which their rotisserie chicken was moist and tasted way better than the chicken you buy in sam's club. Love this place....oh ya, did i mention that you can use your aloha coupon book here and they have happy hour specials too?

6QuPvm_57obC9UqPA8-ytg.text: I'm sorry but Vegas beers made me miss Wisconsin brewing.  Their strawberry sour ale was interesting, but the High Roller was tasteless.

lYxmcfSXG3EhNpSpX-NZYA.text: While on vacay in LasVegas, Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery came highly recommended!  I can honestly say the suggestion was the BEST! I ordered Pull Apart Pork Sliders w/coleslaw and a side of Sweet Potato Fries. The Sliders were sheer perfection, the Coleslaw was creamy and tangy and the Sweet Potato Fries side came as a huge portion shared by our table of 4! Their beers we sampled were amazing. This place is the epitome of fun and feasting!

7_YopAZKaMxWlwE8ibTaVg.text: Went to see downtown Las Vegas and stumbled on this place the beer was great and the one appetizer we had (Oxtail Fries)was also great. We are going back down today to try their other menu items

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Fries
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A picture of their Oxtail Fries fries and copper tanks

wx3wKxWd0pZimJ5o5o9TfA.text: Third time here and food was great. Although, we visited on a Sunday at around 6 and they were fairly busy , so we  sat at the bar . Bartender was a red headed dude who carried a bag of attitude. The experience with this guy didn't ruin our mean, but it sure boiled my blood a bit. Try the fried green bean fries with wasabi ranch.

6Xr14n5S-bdx2oIRA-_JgQ.text: I love it here. I've been here about 100 times and finally writing about. It's the best. Kinda like yard house as far the menu goes. I love what I usually order. Prime rib calamari wings pot stickers black and bleu burger fish and chips and the sushi. It's all good. The staff is wonderful. Rosa is the best.  Been coming here for 8 yrs. They know me and that's a good feeling. Awesome food staff and beer period.

StQHFoJlQaltE9CfvxTDpw.text: This place is awesome. A locals favorite for years. I get a half pound hot dog with chili, onions, and cheese that comes with fries and it hits the spot every time. Pizza here is really good too. The place gets packed even tho they have plenty of seating but don't let the large crowd keep you from stopping in because they seat people quickly. If you are a beer drinker then you will love this place. Cheap, yummy food and good times.
