Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UZfoeWZUKAfLgAcUMFgJ4w.text: This review is just for the happy hour specials they do during NFL games. I ordered the sliders and jalepeno poppers at 5.00 each, can't go wrong at that price right? Wrong. The "angus" sliders were tiny even for sliders and thin as a McDonald's hamburger patty, the bun looked like and felt like a Hawaiian roll but tasted like thick doughy nothing. To top it all off they only give you 2. I've ordered sliders many times in my life but and sometimes its 4 burgers most of the time 3 but 2!? Anyway they were terrible. The poppers were fine since it's basically impossible to screw up but at 5 bucks for 4 measly poppers its no deal at all. To top it off I had to wait 10+ minutes staring down the barkeep to close out the check. I get that he's busy and not his fault but it just added to the frustration. Anyhow never thought spending 10 bucks plus tax would make me feel so ripped off but it did.

EePjTtOPEaaJfQJmHVQ9MA.text: I can't speak for the beer. It was lunch and I was hung over, so I had a soda. This is a microbrew pub in the casino area of old Downtown Las Vegas, and not the sort of place for which I'd typically write a Yelp review.   However, I ordered the Western bacon cheeseburger, which turned out to probably be among the top 10 hamburger experiences of my life. It was dumbfoundingly and wholly unexpectedly incredible. The burger itself is thick and juicy, smothered in a tasty barbecue sauce, and garnished with roasted red peppers, onion rings, and Monterray Jack cheese. It was perfect. It's been several days since I ate it and I'm still thinking about it. A cheeseburger, that is. I'm still thinking about a goddamn cheeseburger. That just doesn't happen.

FN41EA092Y-35TInaHKWcA.text: Triple 7 is a neat place. It's tucked away in the Main Street Casino, an old timey gambling hall with some strange artifacts. The restaurant itself is updated but still maintains a cozy feel with tall ceilings and a lot of wood and brick.  The micro brews are surprisingly good. I don't mean to hate on Vegas beers, but when a restaurant offers a flight of five 5 oz pours for $5.99, you prepare for the worst. My flight came in a wooden holster and contained four of the regular beers and one seasonal flavor. I can honestly say that they were all very good.  The food is typical bar fare with a lot of burgers in the $7 to $8 range. Nothing is great but the prices are fantastic, so I'm not complaining.   As you might expect, the main draw of Triple 7 is the craft beer. If you go, definitely focus on the drinks and limit the amount of food.

urcf350c-Q39ezOCHxGEqA.text: I've come here on two occasions, and during two different trips within five years.. And I can say, it's still just as good as I remembered.   The first time I came here I ordered a simple beer (very veryyyy cheap) and a Philly Cheesesteak Sandwich, and let me tell you.. Mmm Mmm Mmm!! So yumms!  On my recent trip, I ordered 6 oysters on the half shell (comes with horseradish & cocktail sauce) and fish n' chips. The oysters we're very fresh & my family & I took one each & cheered to being in Vegas. The fish & chips we're pretty good as well. The fish meat was very soft, yet flaky, and the batter wasn't too thick, but not too thin. One thing I would recommend is the philly cheesesteak & an iced cold brewski! But Triple 7 hasn't disappointed yet, so feel free to try anything on their menu with a beer, & you should be good to go!

1l2a0WM4DUJ8OkGytlIVSg.text: My favorite casual place downtown.  Great atmosphere, always busy and full of people.  Beers are 5 stars, food is 3 stars but really good value.  Try the Shrimp cocktail (HUGE shrimp), Fillet Sandwich, Chili, Ribs or beer battered shrimp.  Plus it's any easy comp for the gamblers out there!

ujsgpRha32IYzEwa9v0E4Q.text: Great place for the beer lover. Great variety. Something for everyone. Food isn't bad either.

r6NkAHNj5Ro-5GcubTBHpQ.text: Everyone else is giving this place much higher reviews, so I think I just ordered wrong.  I ordered the four cheese pizza and it was absolutely disgusting.  It reminded me of elementary school pizza...not good.  I did get a look at what other tables were ordering and their food did look good.  I also had the fried mushrooms and they were just okay.  The beer sampler was good and that is why I am giving this place 2 stars instead of 1.  It was reasonably priced around 5 bucks or so.  The service was just okay.  The place was packed and I think our server was doing the best she could do.  I would try this place again if I was downtown, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go there.

bIZUHqvUatwaacl0X_I9mg.text: I think I have been here about 3 times and I can honestly say its been mediocre to bad.  This last time I tried their sushi which I can highly recommend everyone to stay away from.  Although it was flash fried it came cold and bland yet still had a funny after taste.  I'm positive they have some good tasting items on their menu I just haven't had any yet.  On a positive note, my dad enjoyed his ribs!  I would say stick to the bar food and beer.

d_J6AA9azvZ1c-qsgOgGKQ.text: Beers are great! The food was not great! The garlic fries had no favor because the garlic all fell to the bottom of the basket. It was jarred garlic too, not fresh. The salsa that comes with the chips and salsa must be "pace picante sauce". I should know better than to order that.

2d2naKxs9Ea0tjLD-qJeqw.text: came here after the Spike and Hammer show last weekend and boy was it awful.  Such a disappointment after having such a good meal a few weeks ago.  I should give them only one star but the beer was good.  I ordered some of the wings I had last time that were outstanding, but this time they were dry with the meat of the chicken itself not tasting very good quality.  They weren't like this the last time I had them.  :(  Then, I had a side caesar salad that tasted "off."  I couldn't figure out what was wrong with it until I figured out that they served me dressing that had spoiled.  I sent it back, feeling kind of bad but the salad was just horrid.  they offered to bring me another one, but if the dressing is spoiled, you'd think they wouldn't be dumb enough to offer me another.

qqK3Ds2o7ppl8RACeaWI3Q.text: I love this place. Great beer, great prices and their food is pretty good too. I always make a pit stop here when I am in Downtown. Great for Happy Hour too!!

w7AGBXkitm-1OUbCu69xbQ.text: After hours of playing on the tables it was a nice place to stop and rest my feet with an ice cold stout and fresh raw oysters. And eating at a place called Triple 7 has to boost your luck especially in Sin City.

8LLfujDMC5glcFGpzNpHPw.text: Triple 7 is the only restaurant at Main St Station and offers a wide variety of okay food for inexpensive prices. But since it's the only one, it can get very busy and crowded even though it's a large space   The bartenders are friendly and efficient, and they offer a full bar with a decent booze selection. They also offer a variety of their own brews, with the High Roller being the best of the bunch, in my opinion

yrnqrLvW8wz2PF7r7Xtuuw.text: Sushi was great.  But the Short Ribs were under cooked & rubbery.  The NY was under cooked,  rubbery and flavorless.  The vegetables were steamed with no flavor and my husband's baked potato wasn't warm.

SFPidr5QNrynDzQ4qQZNMw.text: I really like this place.  Took my aunt and uncle here Monday night while they were in town.  I really enjoyed the High Roller Gold, which is one of their microbrews.  They also have televisions everywhere which was great because the Stanley Cup finals were on and we were able to watch that.  This is a great place to come and watch sports at as it is quite reasonably priced.

gOeH234d5UsSonvTZcJxYw.text: Best place for $8 prime rib! Open late night but some times they run out of the prime rib.

0nuMgkRr4MfprCKAgyh5Bw.text: You need a quick lunch and you work downtown?  This is a great place to go!  They are fast and usually the food is pretty good.  The only problem I have is the parking stinks, but some times my work friends and I make the effort!

kRwzCEnsQZhSs4CeItb81w.text: I have never been to a restaurant that literally had everything for everyone! From sushi to burgers, Triple 7 is sure to meet the foodie needs of all diners, whatever their poison may be.  But the food is not the highlight at this downtown spot...it's the beer!!! Their everyday taps are decent...their seasonals are not to be missed. Make sure to greet the staff, as they are extremely pleasant and helpful!!! I have been going for years and make it a must every time I visit Vegas!!!

26Krg4eCMtK5a2C2AdH5NQ.text: I was really disappointed with our latest visit to Triple 7.  It had become a staple on our annual Vegas excursions, thanks to its casual atmosphere, friendly service, and good food for the price.  Unfortunately, our latest experience left a lot to be desired.  The food was a mixed review.  I thought the smothered potato chips were awesome (even though my bf didn't care for the white cheese sauce on them).  I can't believe that the Angus sliders were actually Angus -- they tasted like the meat from my grade school cafeteria, kind of spongy and weird.  Plus, it was odd that they only gave us toppings for two burgers (two pickle slices, two tomato slices, etc.) when there were three burgers.  The cup of chili was so tiny that we thought they brought us corn chips and dip by mistake, but to their credit, the chili was very tasty.  (We'd had the bowl of chili before -- it's a much better value for only a couple bucks more.)  The entrees tasted great and were plentiful servings, but my only gripe was that the ahi salad only had one small piece of avocado in the whole thing.  The main problem was the service.  We were seated promptly, but our server was obviously overwhelmed.  She was apologetic at first, and having worked in food service, I am generally sympathetic, but at points, our server was nowhere to be found.  Drinks came 15 minutes after our appetizers.  Tables around us turned over twice by the time it took to get our entrees.  We requested to-go containers at the time we got our entrees, having waited so long that we'd lost our appetites, and we waited another 15 minutes before I walked over to another server's station and asked for some.  I ended up walking up to someone who I think was the manager (who was dealing with another customer who had waited endlessly to order) to get the check.  Just inexcusably slow -- about 1.5 hours for just appetizers and entrees when we already knew what we wanted to order.  I've had much better experiences here before, so I hope the most recent one was just the exception and not a trend.  I'd still give Triple 7 another shot the next time I'm in Vegas.

IPcE5lQdH4-kY0SK8KDXIQ.text: We went here for lunch today and really enjoyed it.  Parked across the street ($5) and got it back in full at the cashier with our restaurant receipt.  We had a few dishes...stiffed tomatoes, the black and blue burger in a lettuce bed instead of a bun, the chips and cheese appetizer ( DELICIOUS) onion soup and the cheese steak. We all enjoyed our meal.  My husband is a beer snob and he tried the beer flight.  4-5 oz samples for $5.  He really enjoyed 3 of the 4 and bought a full growler to take with him.  My dad who is 73 lives in summerlin and had never been to this place and was pleasantly surprised and said he plans to come back.   Per the signs on the walls they have won numerous beer awards.   The brewing machines are visible which was interesting and there are also TVs on with baseball.  It didn't smell like smoke which is a nice plus.  We would go back.

U_aW321o_xdgvzOAhlxGIQ.text: Nice restaurant.Very good service. Food is good. Pizza was not so good. Ordered the veggie pizza. Crust not tasting pizza like and different mixture of cheese no bueno for me. Sushi and salads are really good. Would difinitely visit again.

8avP5AhW_fZEUfa31xDIwg.text: Avoid. If you can get an employee to notice you, he or she will, in turn, insult you for wanting to spend your money there.

Z-3qWmzkb7TPuwCnX4c7Qg.text: Huge portions at reasonable prices and good, cheap beer. Toto, we're not on the Strip anymore.  We came here on a recommendation from a friend, and was one of the reasons we came downtown in the first place.   We started with the fried mushrooms that were tasty and PLENTIFUL, at a great price. When we found out the soup was New England clam chowder, my husband HAD to order it for the sheer curiosity factor of how they would do clam chowder in the desert. The answer: Not well. There were carrots?? in it, and it was so thin. The taste wasn't bad, but   doesn't get the Bostonian seal of approval.  My husband had the fish and chips which were HUGE, and the cole slaw was actually really tasty. He said the fish was great, not greasy or heavy. I had a cheeseburger, and it was solid. I had onion rings with it, and they were solid but a little too much breading.  I had the Hefeweizen and it was AWESOME, and a huge glass was less than 4 bucks. My husband liked his choice as well.  Overall, a nice change of pace from the overpriced stuff on the Strip!

ppDuioFXHzWOGRRFQSsTlA.text: I am so happy I found this place!!  Definitely worth the trip.  My buddies and I get together once a year for a guys weekend in Vegas.  Every year to kick off the weekend, we go to a brew pub and partake in a feast!    We used to do this at the Monte Carlo Brew Pub on the strip until some idiotic executive from MGM Mirage decided that Brew Pubs don't actually need to brew their own beer.  Since then however, I'm happy to say we found the 777 downtown!    If you don't frequent downtown, then maybe you should!  The relaxed atmosphere, reasonable prices, and friendly people make it a welcome alternative to the over-priced "hip & trendy" Strip.  If you're turned off by the $25 "apple-tini's" and gaggles of Paris Hilton wannabees of the Strip...then simply hail a cab and set a course downtown to the Triple-7!!!   The atmosphere is awesome, service is wonderful, the food is great, the prices are very reasonable, and most importantly....the beer is amazing!!!  Definitely worth the trek downtown!!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0Q36NGgaPwAboX3ePfzCqA.text: Food portions were huge as well as their beer sampler. Great beer!  I had the taco salad that was made with chili and it was delicious. My wife had the Ahi salad and I was jealous. The Black Cherry Stout was pretty good.  I will be back.

9lquV3Owh7cgW22I4yYrCQ.text: Some friends in Vegas with us told us to try this place. A group of us went in and had great food and drinks for a super reasonable price!! The service was great and friendly.

oGIbDnhs4rdVGyvAKvl45g.text: Customer service was great. The decor was very nice. Food not so great. My bf ordered the saimin wonton and I ordered prime rib. The saimin probably tasted the best out of the 2 dishes. The wonton was pretty huge and the meat inside was not so great. My prime rib was nasty and hard as hell. I had to slice them into pieces and put them in the saimin bowl to make them taste decent. The green bean were frozen green beans and the baked potato didn't look good at all. Their idea of a loaded potato is sour cream and butter. But it fed us at 1am when we were looking for something to eat.

6RIShRc9hQS84cBg_uV1bg.text: I ordered the Frisco burger and it was ok.  The patty was a little bland and the bread overly greasy but the reedemer was the 1000 island sauce which was tasty. The fries are good as well (especially with their gravy or ranch sauce). My boyfriend ordered the mushroom steak sandwich which was "alright" -- that's how we got the gravy. The highlight of the meal was dessert. We got the deep fried cheesecake and the espresso. I HIGHLY recommend it!

hXCKoy1Ix9rB5xX1_qOTHQ.text: Bland, poorly prepared food and terrible service. But the atmosphere is pretty sweet and the High Roller microbrew was worth drinking. This place would be out if business anywhere but a Freemont St hotel... Definitely will not be back.

kUvn27GtDub9xrY4CUTICQ.text: I had family come into town to visit another family member who is temporarily stationed at Nellis for the next month. My uncle and his wife are from small town America...very small town. My uncle has ventured out into the world a few times when he was in the service, but his wife has traveled mostly within the the midwest and south. They wanted to take us to dinner, and wanted to stay on Fremont as that is where their hotel was.  After debating between Chicago Brewing Co and Triple 7, we decided on Triple 7 as it had been almost 5 years since the last time we were there.  We arrived and had to wait in line for about 20 minutes. It was Friday night and the place was hopping. We didn't mind waiting as it was a good time to catch up.   Once we were seated, the waitress helped us immediately. Over the course of the night, the waitstaff was really friendly and very helpful. For drinks, my self and my cousin ordered a couple micros. I had my traditional Red (the Royal Red Lager) and he had the brewmaster's special (an IPA). Later I had the sampler...but I will get to the beer in a second.   The menu had a few veggie options, which was totally unexpected. They also had a presumingly vegan option (veggie sushi). I had the roasted veggie sandwich, and the wife got the veggie sushi. My family had burgers and chicken fingers. My sandwich was very good, a little messy by the veggies were roasted quite nicely and the fries were pretty amazing. It was like having 2 sandwiches, which is why the wife and I shared. The veggie sushi (avocado, carrot, red pepper) was very tasty as well.   On to the important part, the beer. The Royal Red was pretty light (similar to a Killian's). It was malty, but not too strong. It went down smooth, but not the best local red I've had. I also had the sampler. Overall the beer quality was pretty average. The pale ale had a nice wheat aftertaste, and was pretty smooth. The IPA was hoppy, but more earthy than anything else. Admittedly, I usually don't like IPA's, but this one I disliked for the earthy flavor, not the hoppiness.   Overall, this was a good choice. We would definitely return for the food. I wouldn't come just for the beer, but it was decent, and I would support the localness of it.

GSeXgg6y_l7HgEpVCt0QdA.text: I've been here many times before and I thought the food was decent.  I decided to take my parents since the line at the Cal was way too long and they didn't feel like eating hawaiian food at the restaurant on the second floor.  We ordered the fried calamari, nigiri sushi, baby back ribs, cheese steak sandwich and cheesy bread.  The fried calamari was decent, but I wouldn't get it again.  The breading was soft and not crispy.  The nigiri sushi was horrible, the sushi rice tasted like rice porridge and the fish had no taste.  I've been here before and the fish was pretty good, so I was extremely disapppointed.  The baby back ribs was decent.  The meat fell off the bone and the sauce wasn't too bad.  The cheesy bread was decent, nothing special, just cheese and pizza dough below it.

RpbOq5PyfS4bAMHh3c9iCA.text: AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL :( I was so so so super excited to try this place and not one single item we ordered was any good..  crab and artichoke dip literally tasted like creamy water fried  tuna roll- gross mozzarella sticks were ok but the sauce was worthless portabella mushroom burger was loaded with a gross amount of cheese and wayyy to salty pizza was flavorless   so sad because we were so so excited to try based off the reviews

rkga9ShmL7yg-o6VnUKCqQ.text: We decided to stop by here for lunch recently.  I had the Portobello Burger, which has a giant portobello in place of a hamburger.  It was quite nice actually, and if you like mushrooms, I highly recommend it!  My friends had some dishes that they didn't quite like though, including the personal pizzas, which were not unlike most generic casino pizzas, and the fish tacos.  The dining area is very large, and can accommodate the largest parties.  The walls are lined with various awards that they have received for their beers.  The brewery itself is clearly visible through the glass walls.  We watched a brewer do some house cleaning while we enjoyed our beers.    Speaking of beer, the reason to come to the Triple 7 is the microbrewery.  I ordered the porter, which was a nice stout.  It was very smooth and tasty.  It paired well with my burger.  I also ordered a sampler of the other beers.  The Stout IPA they had specially for this season was also a really good beer.  I wouldn't say its the best stout that I have had, but the extra hoppy bite that it had was quite nice.  I wasn't impressed with the other brews, however.  The red ale was more of a light beer with a red ale tint to it.  The blackcherry stout was a sweet, cough syrup thing.  Non-beer drinkers might like that one.  The other light beers aren't really worth mentioning.    Any brewer who experiments with craft beers in Vegas deserves a good review though. In my opinion, the food was good enough to come back for the beer.  Stick to the stouts though, as that seems to be the Triple 7's specialty.

0H444e-q3XcY2fz3Ky3t6Q.text: People have been raving about this place to me since I started going to Vegas.  Let's just say......what's the hype for?  The food was average......the beer is good (but I can get it for free at Boar's Head Bar or on the Casino Floor).    My check came and I was less then impressed.  My food was acceptable, but the way this place has been promoted to me for years (in those years I stayed at MSS) and I've had better food at Four Queens (Magnolia's).    Give it a shot if you like people, but don't go with expectations of a good place.  It's just like the 99, Ruby Tuesdays, or TGI Fridays.

I7FUK0tco-5Ol37PH7W21g.text: A great place, my family and in-laws showed up on a Thursday night, it was packed..Good sign..went to the buffet instead...good..really good.. fast forward one hour..My father inlaw and I indulge in a few brews..its the German way..you know?? He has two large red lagers that he enjoys while I get a sampler at a FRIGGIN GREAT!!! price!! solid brews..we walk back to the room, I head back down, have a couple great brews cheap,,a Nice girl started me out, but she talked to cocktail servers for an hour(Hookup???) lol...anyways I watch the Australian open, with a great priced burger that I ordered medium rare, and loved, the guy who ended up taking care of me was very nice, and did a great job! If in Vegas..check this place out!!

ahG0aYB11S4UbDvcvm0QiA.text: This place would totally get 5 stars for food, but the service here SUCKED!  They take forever to greet you and bring your drinks and take your order.  But the drinks and food are AWESOME so don't let the crappy service get in the way of an AWESOME experience.  I came here 3 times in the 5 days that I was staying in Vegas.  (Ya, it's that good)  I was a little disappointed that the garlic fries no longer use fresh garlic, but like a bottled costco type of minced garlic.  The fried mushroom app is another tasty one.  And how can you go wrong with 40 pieces of peel-and-eat shrimp cocktail for 12.95$!!!!  I ate the filet mignon steak sandwich and added jalapenos to it.  YUM SCRUM!!!  I also tried the nachos which is like an entree itself not an appetizer, and the wild mushroom pizza is also gooood.  Another awesome thing about 777 is that they brew their own beer.  I had a beer sampler (five 5-oz samples of all their microbrews: gold, pale, special, red, dark)  The gold and red beers were awesome!  Definite yummy.    I didn't bother to try the sushi so I can't really say anything about that.

jMg1yiu2aInzVK1BOcGwIw.text: Triple 7 in the Main Street Hotel is good for a late night snack.  Atmosphere is good, service is good, and food is good.  I'll be back next time I'm in Downtown, LV!

HsWBGDkAlbQW9GYL4JqwHA.text: This place is awesome. Best in it's price range in Vegas...and I'm a local.  The food is great, from the appetizer's to the prime rib.  Everything is cooked to order and to perfection.  There are TV's throughout and are typically tuned to sports.  If there's a game on you want to watch specifically, just ask, they'll put it on for you.  My beer drinking friends say their brews are fantastic and they don't skimp on the mixed drinks either.   The service is great, everyone is friendly...which is a rarity in this city and it's pretty quick too.  Open 24/7, great prices, great food.

COo9l5z8rX6IMtmyjxZTsg.text: My favorite brewery in Las Vegas! The place is nice and great place to hang with homies for amazing Brew and food. The menu ranges from Bar food to comfort food to fresh made sushi. They have something for everyone. If you get there for happy hour, they have 50% of appetizers and micro brew. The Meatball Sliders are amazing. 3 sliders on a warm bun, smothered in a rich and tangy sauce and dripping with melted cheesy goodness. The fries are crispy and salty the way a fry should be. The wings are awesome. I prefer them extra well done. Nothing worse then biting a wing and the damn thing is bloody. We been there so many times, i can go on and on about the food. The beer is incredible. They take time and pride in their batches. Barleys Beer is ok but pales in consideration. Chicago Brewing company comes in 2nd to Triple 7 Brew. They have their signature beers and tend to add 1-3 new flavors monthly-Bi Monthly. The Black Cherry Cream is awesome. You can taste the Cherry and so smooth. The higher content beers like Monique can put a spin to your dome when you drink a couple lol. When your done grubbing, head over to the bar in the casino. You can get a pint of Micro Brew for $1.75. Cheap compared to anywhere else. Check them out and give them a try. If your a beer lover, it wont disappoint. Until next time, Let's Eat!!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball Sliders and Fries

GtDNQOd9aLSGqV6dqqkGMQ.text: Love coming here for the wings and the tasty High Roller beer. #fullstars

T8-oxmuM1jAzCX8Jm-7AYA.text: Great late night eats. We were here after hours of gambling downtown. Good food, not bad service although some what slow. Great prices and strong drinks. Would definitely come back.

53c6-TTwhOLtJY9xxMcxyw.text: LOOOOVVVVVVVVEEEEEEEEEEEE 777. Everytime I come to Las Vegas, I stop by here at least 3 times in 5 days. The Blackchip Ale is the bomb and it's so refreshing. It better be, it's made right there. Give me 3 of these and i'm set for the evening. I have tried the other house brews but I'll stick to the Blackchip. The prices are really decent but so is everything in Downtown. I can order a philly cheesesteak, 3 beers for under $16.00. I f I could only live here. Triple 7 also takes vacations hawaii meal coupons. I have actually used 2 meal coupons and got my dinner for free. The waiter hooked me up so I had to hook him up with a nice tip.  My wife loves their pizza but I'll stick to the oily foods. Taste so much better. Love you 777........

DRW7qbjWw8ZMQyF36hFApQ.text: I just got a hankering for a Vegas trip again, which reminded me that I never reviewed Triple 7. How can that be? Oh yeah, it's probably because I had a few too many of those amazing microbrews and had a slight lapse in memory.   I had some Vegas pals always telling me that this was THE place to go for cheap dinner and amazing beer, and I always would reply, "Don't bother me. I'm playing blackjack." Well, one day the blackjack dollars ran out a bit too quickly, so off to Triple 7 we went. And we were pretty famished (and sober) when we arrived, so we went to town on that menu...Meatball sliders, garlic fries, nachos grande, Prime Rib ($10!!), and, of course the microbrew sampler - you get five 5oz pours for $5. Can't beat that!  When the food starting arriving all six of us got a look of dread in our eyes, thinking, "Dear lord, what have we done?" If Vegas is about excess, than we sure as hell were doing something right, because this was a MASSIVE amount of food...and mostly pretty damn cheap and amazingly tasty too.   The beer? Ah, the beer. It's so good when it hits your lips. It really is. The Porter was my fave, but the night we went there was also a brewmaster's special that had upwards of 9% abv...I think that was the one that really did me in. We left that place full, tipsy, and more than satisfied. Can't wait to do it again.

9JxWzHyVilE88XkxCmFjnw.text: Service wasn't great, food was meh, beer wasn't good.  The price was good and I've had a lot worse in Vegas.  This place just wasn't what I'd hope it was.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer sampler.

QS66Hgb5pLCDGirG3y-VYQ.text: Had a large group 16 people for dinner, the food and service was excellent  , good prices, glad we came here

SWhvE-eO8OqjbUO039fsEw.text: Oh man, I had a great time at Triple 7.  It was pretty busy on a Sunday night when I arrived, but I sidled up to an empty seat at the bar with no problems.  Then I ate and drank to my heart's content and paid pocket change for the experience.  The space is rather large and there are two bars flanking either side of the dining room.  The brewing equipment is prominently positioned on two levels along the back of the restaurant.  It's a nice, open space and I felt very comfortable.  The bartender/server who attended to me was efficient if a bit abrupt.  That's okay--he's a bartender, not a waiter.  I prefer brusqueness to plodding service at the bar.  He wasn't chatty but he answered all of my questions and was quick with the refills.  The beer was fantastic and cheap.  I especially enjoyed the porter and the seasonal Oktoberfest.  Each style was well represented, which in my experience is rare in brewpubs.  There was a high level of consistency.  Plus, you could drink here all night and pay the tab with whatever's leftover from your taxi fare downtown.  For dinner I ordered a burger and fries, and they were acceptable.  The burger was cooked a bit longer than I would have liked but it tasted just fine.  I noticed that they also had a sushi bar adjacent to the regular bar.  That was unexpected and seemed a bit out of place in a brewpub, but hey!  Maybe some people like sushi with their microbrews and fried mozzarella sticks.  I didn't try any.  I left about an hour and a half later having consumed a burger, fries and four beers.  The total tab was less than $20.  What a great value.  If this place were located near my home I'd rarely eat or drink anywhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ce2eH4t1rHIQRRTNxVRu_w.text: Walked right in and got a table.. always a plus when you want Cold drinks and food. Margaritas, Bloody Marys. Beer  no complaints.. Waitress was nice and food was good and plenty left over. We had the Soy beans and Calamari for apps and all the meals were well received. Onoin soup was hot and cheesey.. yum

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup.. I love soup!

kn8U1STG1vembyxraOyasw.text: We always come here at least once every trip. My family loves the jumbo shrimp. I always order the prime rib. Did you know you can use your Ohana book here on selected item!

sj7UVCmvhezfH5APBoBvpg.text: Came here after the Kings game and were disappointed.  Upon being quickly seated we waited.   And waited and then waited, waited some more and after listening to four songs, I sarcastically asking the hostess that seated us is if there was wait service or whether something had changed.    She didn't apologize, just questioned that no one had come to even drop off water and went towards the back muttering.   Two songs later, we admitted defeat and just left.   This was at 11pm. The place was barely 1/3 full. Could it of been that we were Asian and none of the staff was?  At a hotel that caters to Hawaii?  We didn't get a chance to be asses since we never were approached with any type of service other than being seated.   I personally have eaten here 25+ times before with no issues like this. It'll be a while before I think about going back. There is nothing that special about the food here, then there's the service.   Meh.

y8qruMPkuR109KtKhuZNsA.text: Awesome service! The manager was very kind and accommodating. Our waitress was quick to make sure we had water and whatever else we needed and the food was delicious.  I highly recommend Triple 7.

kTQUVdn0KWPGuupDq0FkQQ.text: There are two microbreweries on or near the old strip. This is the only one where the beer is brewed on location.   Triple 7 is an interesting space. It's like a pub meets sushi bar meets, well, Vegas. Brick walls, plenty of seating, big tall ceilings and yes, a sushi bar with a big neon sign behind it.   If you're coming in for the first time, order a tour of microbrews, the sampler is only $5.99.  Do you like mango? Try the mango hefeweizen. Light in flavour, it goes down easily... too easily. You'll want more! For something a little different, the King's Kolsch is a lemongrass beer surprise! It seems to be an up and coming flavour in everything from beers to vodkas. I'd ask for a sample sip before you order... just to make sure you can handle an entire pint of it.  If you're hungry, might I suggest the Korean short ribs and Korean tacos? I know, weird to have a Korean influence in a microbrewery right? Not any more odd than a sushi and oyster bar. Anyway, both are delicious and both come with a side order of cucumber kimchi. The short ribs were saucy and delightful, though my server, Monique had a description that gave them way more justice than I ever could. The tacos came in a half soft, half crunchy shell and had that same bite. After those and my tour of beer, I was so very full!  Tip: If you're going to order some sushi, you won't be able to do it right from the sushi bar. You'll still need to go through your server! Just roll with it...   Bonus: No smoking allowed inside the pub. You can escape the smell!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean Tacos. $9.99
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean short ribs. $6.99

6T0_pR9FjdO6xyf8RWa6DA.text: We ate here today with a party of 8. All primerib and ribeyes. Very good for the price. They were so nice to our birthday boy.  Our server, Natasha was the best.....and very sweet. I highly recommend.

UNK9Yya8q_mgL5d2w23u_Q.text: I waited anxiously for 2 years for another mango brew, and instead of cream ale, this time it is a mango hef.  I got there at 2:40 and noticed happy hour started at 3.  I got a half dozen oysters on the half shell while I waited for 3 PM.  The bartender was awesome.  The oysters were huge!  A little before 3, he hooked me up with a 16 oz mango hef and told me he would add it on the bill at 3 for the $2.  Normal prices are 16 oz for $3.26 and 23 oz for $3.95, so during HH you can get 32 oz for $4, a good deal.  Lots of brewmaster's specials, but I only wanted the mango and one was enough to get me a bit tipsy.  To counter that, I ordered the Thai chili wings (1 dozen for $4.50 during HH) and chatted up a random Vegas-defect who was at the bar.  The wings were crispy, hot, and delicious.    The restaurant is really large and the bar area is too.  The TVs are large and flatscreen.  This is a good joint to get a cold tasty beer and watch a game.  Great Happy Hour spot too.  I will definitely be back for good beer, good service, and good grub.  MANGO hef!!!

PxIWA_l55QyE6kkx-kYttw.text: The drinks are cold, the food is hot, and the service is good.   That is the best way to describe this place, we had a good time here. The drinks were very cold, especially when it is hot outside.  The food was tasty and severed in a very fast manner.  Our waitress was friendly and helpful with the menu and when we asked a question, she was very knowledgeable.     If you are down on Fremont St, this is a good place to grab something to drink and eat.

XPIs4lw13AMcqdzQfFEjkg.text: Great place to get burger and fries, corn beef sandwich and sides.  Drinks of various libations.  Also great wait staff.

iOLCwE0UMpjE0OXMDVGSqw.text: Met up with some friends here to visit.  We were first seated at a table for four.  After no server came to check on us or take our order, we moved over to the bar.  The bartender was I thought very attentive and took our orders.  Michael K. ordered the beer sampler and April and Anthony each tried some light beers.  I just got a little wine.  The atmosphere is pretty cool, big heavy wood bar with room finishes like the stamped tin ceiling tiles, heavy wood beams, big brewing vats visible.  It's a fun atmosphere and for the beer drinkers the prices seemed very modest.    It's a fun place for a group and we had fun visiting with each other.  We didn't order any food so I can't comment on that.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of restaurant

DpBVj5LXgSdxK-X8_Fc-Bw.text: Stopped in here to try there beers.  The beers are pretty good.  Every time I have stopped in here, it is pretty busy.  The last time, I saw several member of the LVPD having lunch here.  That is good sign.  The service is pretty good and friendly.

Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ellUrKsvx03qmHaAdZETGw.text: The last time we were there their specialty/seasonal beer was Dark Cherry Stout. We were excited to taste it, but it tasted like cough syrup. I like their Porter, their Hefe, in fact, just about all their craft beers. Very good! The restaurant is really neat with the brewery in full view of the restaurant. Their bar is long, beautiful and very comfortable. Their bartenders are all professional and they know their job. There is a great happy hour, that we enjoy! There is nothing bad to say about this place. Each and every time we go to Vegas, we always go to Main Street Inn and visit the Lucky 7's Brewery. Of course, we will be back!

mpm9QcrI8VV1IE7KyRqhOQ.text: Heard so many good things about this place so we finally decided to check it out. We had high expectations, as everyone we know who has eaten said it was great. We ordered a steak and short ribs, then waited 40+ minutes for it. This might have been because of a number of reasons, our servers switched because the original one when on break. In my opinion, there is no reason we should have waited over 40 minutes for our food. It wasn't very busy and there seemed to be more than enough staff working. During this time our server also only came to check on us once. We could see our food waiting near the kitchen for about 10 minutes. Once we did get our food, it was a little over cooked but tasted pretty good. Our server started checking up on us more and seemed to be in a better mood. Overall, the food was better than the service.

qN0LE-bViipsnx-YxR1vtw.text: We had to wait in line for about 30 mins which is not that bad because it was very packed because of March madness . Service was great very attentive food was great !!!!will totally come back

wBLatZE2fQkLLmht-mhKyw.text: It's been months since we've been here, but when we visited, we were excited to checkout a brewery. My boyfriend got food poisoning from our dinner.  We almost had to extend our stay because he couldn't leave the bathroom!  I remember that everything looked so perfect that I knew from being in the industry that it all came prepared ahead - not really anything wrong with it, you just know that it all came from packages and is quickly thrown together rather than actually doing meal prep.  I specifically noticed this with pieces of chicken.  Seems like cheap ingredients, so doesn't surprise me that he got sick.

w4VBUl47BfvZFzgT5RTwoQ.text: Stayed in the Main Street hotel and Triple 7 is just by the casino's. We walked in with no waiting line and the waiter didn't keep us waiting. We ordered our food 5mins in to walking in and had gotten our meals around 10 mins of waiting. The water cups are huge! Just the way I like it, about 1 liter or so. The food was good considering the BBQ bacon cheese burger I ordered. It came with sweet potato fries and a special sauce (recommend)   Service was really fast and I wouldn't mind coming back!

myvAXOQ1YV7yREUg29liiA.text: I have been coming to this restaurant for the better part of 15 years. The food has always been good. However the last 3 times I have been here the service was awful. I sure hope the can get this restaurant back on track.

1v-kYOiimGNPsvfGiDr0uQ.text: The service was outstanding, the beer was good and the sushi was amazing. Highly recommended, great break from Fremont madness.

XTVIF5GIg5VgzxYBu2KzXg.text: Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery is located in the Main Street Station Casino Brewery Hotel in downtown.  I always love coming here whenever I'm in downtown.  I especially always look for bar seating.  The bartenders are laid back, super cool, friendly, easy going and easy to talk to.  We always have great service every time we come here. I especially look forward to the seasonal brews since they brew their own beer there.  You can't miss the beer tanks when you walk in since they're practically noticeable floor to ceiling.  The restaurant is very spacious, high ceilings, with flat screen TV's everywhere focused primarily on sports. Yay LOL  They have a wide array of selection, from starters, burgers, sandwiches, sushi, pizza, full entrees, salads, you name it.  They have a really good happy hour and late night happy hour with a nice selection of appetizers, tapas, pupus ranging from only $3 - $7! Draft beers, cocktails and shots are also from $3 - $5!  Talk about a really good deal!  Triple 7 has a very nice, good feel ambiance about the place!  And, as their motto goes "Save Water Drink Beer"! LOL

fQc-xpeGEnYtg02W69v-sQ.text: While hanging out in Mainstreet, my parents recommended dining here. Missing some Island food, we ordered and enjoyed their:  Spicy tuna roll Tiger bomb Calamari  Korean short ribs  The food was delicious and reasonably priced! The servers were friendly and brought out food out quickly. Definitely worth the stop if you're in the downtown area.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their calamari was amazing

_WRBIBRFhQvf-cV4EUFkeQ.text: Went here for dinner and it was the worst experience ever.  Me and a group of friends ordered appetizers and they never came.  Ordered soft drinks and we had to remind the waitress twice if they were coming.  We used dinner vouchers that were supposed to be free and the waitress requested the wrong ones and she ended up charging $130 on my debit card.  She also tried to charge the appetizers to us that never came.  After all of this she explained to me that it would take 10 business days for the funds to go back on my card.   I asked to speak to the manager to see if there was anything he could do and he acted like he didn't care.  I asked him for proof of a receipt that the funds were indeed reversed and he told me "not to worry about it, the funds will go back in".    Our orders were wrong. The service was terrible.  And my card was wrongly charged.  Not much else to say unless a manager reaches out to me and makes it right.

eKGJtLdTafdiHxoSTs152A.text: Large portions and decent food! My husband and I ordered the nachos which was more than enough! The kids got California rolls which had ten per order for seven dollars! Super great deal! They loved it! Nice reasonably priced late meal after a night on Fremont Street.

-G1Xur84_mkwkWyjYOjoFw.text: We got there and stood in line for about 30 minutes. The system to get a table sucks, the could learn from other restaurants like Tony Roma's. We had a party of 6 and when we got to the front, they said they didn't have but offered the counter, which we took.  Our waitress took a few to come by and take our drink order only. She looked stressed out and was not friendly at all. She dropped off our drinks, walked away and never said anything. We were growing impatient after 15-20 minutes, then an older Filipino waitress came by. She apologized and said she just got to work. We kind of let that slide. The one star is for the spinach dip.  The food was not that great. I did not like the Oysters, they did not even carry Ponzu sauce  Everything else was okay.  It seemed like they need a systems overhaul of training for staff (they looked very unorganized), they had a lot of open tables but lots of people waiting outside (I believe it's because the service staff are not well trained). Management was no where to be found to pick up on the angry faces around the room.  I would not recommend coming here.

AdprF4nrBIusHGXTtaomPQ.text: lucky number 7.  7 may be a lucky number, BUT 3rd time's the charm.  Literally.  Since it took 3 visits before my friend and I actually were able to grab bite at Triple 7 R&M.    LOCATION/SETTING: Casino level at Mainstreet Station Casino Brewery Hotel in Downtown Las Vegas.  As I've already mentioned, 3rd time's the charm:  1st visit:  Closed (limited hours on Sundays?) 2nd visit:  Closed early 3rd visit:  Open!  The restaurant was crowded and full of life when we arrived at nearly 11pm on a week night in early October.  The restaurant is a mix of mostly tables, bar height tables, and the bar....of course.  Since the restaurant was packed, we had to wait a few minutes before the hostess showed us to a bar height able in the rear by the kitchen.    In the end, my friend and I shared the nachos grande and the Asian street tacos.  The nachos was more than enough to share, a very decent sized portion.  The tacos were alright, but a forewarning to those with a lower spice tolerance:  there's a bit of heat in the sauce (Sriracha in the mix).  I'd do a repeat order on the nachos on a future visit.  SERVICE: It was alright.  The server was friendly, though I assume she didn't check on us as often as she could due to the crowded restaurant.  Again, service was ok.  BOTTOM LINE: Lucky number 7?!!  I'd totally visit again to try different things on their menu.  I just hope they're open!

M5RQ0brGGhrRzcbR_-lw5A.text: Years ago I loved the food here.  We came last night and the food was horrible.  The sliders had no flavor, underdone, and cold.  The nachos and bone in wings were the same cold and flavorless.  When we came we asked for a seat where we can watch the Mexico/USA soccer game.  The response we got was "Your asking too much for me being this early".  I think that was the hostess attempt at humor...  We came across town expecting good food and a good deal but instead we got warmed up cardboard tasting $70.00 meal with a side of what did we just pay for realization.

8AgDKtYSaYRkx9v1pjScdQ.text: I gave them 1 star because our waitress was nice. Otherwise we they gave us moldy bread and totally messed up our meat. They made them all new the waitress said we weren't going to have to pay. Then they billed me then the manager comes out I express my anger and displeasure, he only says, "but they made again for you" I said I'm not paying for any of it and he took the food back to the kitchen. I thought later I should of screamed to the rest of the customers and said they r serving moldy.

JYXOmAyw5wMO5j7xg-x2VQ.text: I had a beer flight along with a good prime rib dinner.  The beers in the flight ranged from alright (I just don't like pale ale) to quite good (Royal Red and the seasonal IPA).  The prime rib was cooked perfectly and very good.  My first trip, but probably not my last as long as I keep coming to LV.

s9eV9Bn67sX9kdqtgFIsCA.text: We were redirected here from Market Street Grill at the California Hotel next door. We were on the hunt for our graveyard special oxtail soup. Unfortunately the soup was not available at Market Street because they closed the kitchen overnight for cleaning. We mosey along over the Triple 7 Restaurant since the signs indicated they were serving our beloved oxtail for Market Street that night.   4 oxtail soups please..... our soups were served quickly. They had an abundance of meat, bones and a mixture of carrots, celery and mushrooms. The soup came with one scoop of rice and shredded ginger and cilantro on the side. We had been waiting all evening for our special oxtail soup so we were ready to grub. Meh. My soup was warm. Not hot. I wanted my soup hot hot hot. Some of the oxtail meat was fatty and it would have tasted better and sat better on my tummy if it was HOT. I'll have to remember next time to order my soup extra hot. I dumped the ginger in the soup for a yummy taste. Some of the rice was hard and crunchy. Why? Maybe it was the bottom of the pot. I don't know but yuck. I didn't like that either. The soup filled my tummy and satisfied my hunger but it just wasn't the oxtail I was hoping for. Boooooo!!!   The other downer to our culinary adventure was the active renovations going on in the restaurant while we were eating. They were cutting metal with a saw. While that area of the restaurant was covered with a divider, we could smell the metal air particles coming over to our area of the restaurant. It made it difficult to breathe and we could taste it in our mouths. That was disgusting. We didn't want to eat metal or breathe metal. The waitress apologized and said she was having trouble breathing too but that didn't stop the active renovations in the restaurant. Honestly, the restaurant was closing in the morning and re-opening at lunch time as part of their regular schedule. I would recommend that the restaurant operators wait for the active crew renovations until the restaurant is closed. It was noisy with the repairs and their work ruined the smell and taste of our food. This was the deal killer for me. I won't be back.

p5cwVvW88bfjzm2Nv_5mBw.text: Came in July 26 around 10:45 pm , waited for happy hour . The food was great but the customer service was a thumbs down!! the lady that serve us look very frustrated and confused. Our  seafood came really fast but our food came super late.  I think our servers shift ended so there was a male that who replaced her  and he also took OMG so damn long like the lady server just up and left and did not tell him what was going on coz he also look confused..When paying our bill he took the debit card and didn't come back for 15 min.

9HZ25uwYZujwgtLBArMaPw.text: Came here to redeem a dinner with our Vacations Hawaii coupon.. ehh it was okay. Not that bad, but wouldn't get the prime rib again. Really chewy and flavor wasn't that great for me. Service was okay.

8ICK6_g170pi5nSTgWk_RA.text: Atmosphere is pretty good but the "katsu" sliders...not so much. If you know what real chicken katsu is then don't order the sliders with katsu sauce. It's more like large breaded nuggets with vinegar bbq sauce.  Sorry, but .  Now the Poke plate was well liked so I'd say knock yourself out with it.  Give yourself a little more time if you have plans.  Definitely give it a try though.

jmNQyPqpCNSctOuOYZNbKw.text: I really enjoyed the French onion soup, the fry sampler and the pizza. My husband likes prime rib and I wanted to try a new place and when I saw the onion soup I really wanted to try it. It's rare that a place knows how to make it properly,  but so far this is the closest to how my dad used make it. I will totally be back.

Tk-ea5U-UIbzTHnps6oBRA.text: Their prices are awesome! I have never felt more at home, thanks to Shane and Noke! They offered us amazing service and great conversation. They were very knowledgeable about the beer and made great suggestions. We will definitely be back!

iWRkrqRYAuMDd2EvhHefLw.text: Always a favorite of ours when we stay down on Fremont Street... we found ourselves here three different times on our last visit to Vegas.  The inside of the Main street Station Casino is worth coming to see alone. Triple 7 is home to probably the best happy hour deals in downtown Las Vegas.   I find their beer a bit hit and miss to be honest, but nothing has ever been awful. And the prices on their beer are awesome, especially during the aforementioned happy hour. If you can catch their seasonal/ rotating Black Cherry Porter it is my all time favorite here.    We LOVE their sushi bar... it is a Las Vegas gem. If you are a sushi fan, don't miss this. Their menu is great, we have had a little of everything over the years and while not much is "standout" everything is always good. This last time we hit the happy hour special Portobello Mushroom Fries twice and loved them. Heather is a big fan of their wings here as well.  Good beer and eats for cheap in a very cool old train station turned casino. Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer!!!

hB4xIjc_Ao4XH9S-2VlHKQ.text: This is a good stop if your downtown! We tend to begin our adventures here before a night out on the town! Food portions are huge! Plates are definitely shareable. We normally order the fish and chips and the nachos, which are ginormous. Their microbrews are average, and in some cases lack flavor. I normally stick with their vodka sodas or house wine. Dinning area service is hit and miss, thats why the bar is are ideal spot to sit. Overall very standard bar food for good prices!  Tip - If you park at main street station you get free parking by food and drink purchases.

3CNDf46_HWWK3EnI1fPkIw.text: Took my family here for dinner on our last trip out to Vegas. It's a sports bar type of setting so don't expect it to be quiet or romantic, but we didn't mind at all. It was busy the night we went, but didn't have to wait more than 10 minutes for a table which was great cause we were hungry! Loved that our waitress gave us iced waters in large cups so we didn't drink them empty so fast. It's the little things that bring joy when all we drink is water. Haha  They have a pretty good menu to choose from. We decided to try a couple different appetizers, so we had some oysters, peel & eat shrimp, and hot spinach & cheese dip. Everything was so good! They toasted the bread for the spinach dip which made it taste even better. We all ordered steak for our dinner since we were craving steak since the night before (side note: never have conversations with others about yummy ass steaks on an empty stomach) and it didn't disappoint as well! It was cooked perfectly as requested. Craving happily satisfied!   I've been to Main Street so many times before in the past and can't believe I never ate here sooner. Definitely won't be the last!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HYHURsb6Xu5WMnzqT-Hw-w.text: We walked in this restaurant probably around 1:30 on Friday night. It was good and bartender was pretty friendly! Service was super quick. Great cool place to hang out! And I believe they have sushi and oyster bar if you come in at certain hours!   I ordered chicken teriyaki bowl and I really thought it was going to be a small portion! But damn! It's a bowl for 2 people! Plenty of food! Love the veggies!!   Drinks was pretty strong! I'm a martini gal! And some bartenders make em top apply flavor-y but this one was real good!! Will come back to try more of their food! They have tons of food on their menu!

Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki bowls w/ veggies!
