kvO8rpINIr7dhp8T-VzNSg.text: Food was very average. Beer was average as well. Atmosphere was lacking anything unique or memorable.  I wouldn't recommend making a trip to go here but if you're already near and into trying craft beers - eh. Go ahead. Nothing to write home about.

W6n0iNfV8y7QfMnbzc3GkQ.text: It is the best beer in town, I have been coming here 15+ yrs.  Bartenders a great.  The food is average casino/bar food.   But I am there for the beer the food is secondary.  The place is always busy.  They also have a good happy hour.

Lc-AWs98wm1sD4a-uCkhqw.text: Had dinner here with two friends...We all had the Prime rib...mine was a bit overcooked but still tasty...their soup of the day was was a nice combo of chicken soup with a tomato base. Their IPA was decent...nothing big or bold but right down the middle for style. Service was SLOW...apparently only the bartender can cash out checks for a 40 table bar area??? Overall it was ok...if I was in the area ..I'dd probably return, with the hope that service would be better

lZM3w9Duqvw2kDM1iKEW7A.text: Had dinner at Triple 7 Restaurant on Tuesday.  My boyfriend and I waited for 10 minutes in line for dinner, and were sat at a nice table.  We were greeted by our server in a timely manner.  Travis had the pumpkin ale beer and I had a diet soda.  The menu caters to all kinds of choices; pizza, sushi, steak, ribs, and sandwiches.  We needed an extra minute to decide and the server was patient with us!  Travis and I ordered a sausage and mushroom pizza with two side salads.  The pizza was good, drinks were refilled, and plates were cleared.  The room was full of business and the TVs had a baseball game playing.  Overall, the experience was good!

URysxOSdtJH5gHpIHSaQZw.text: Good restaurant.  Ample portions.Was delighted see such a variety of food sections.  Would not hesitate to go there again.  Plenty of interesting beer choices.  I had the steak salad.  Not the usual "lots of unnecessary lettuce filler with a small portion of steak."  Steak was delicious and a good size portion surrounded by freshly grilled vegetables on top of fresh greens.  The other selections in our group were a burger & fries, prime rib, stuffed pork chop, 2 beers and a glass if wine.  Satisfied customers all around.

qixWrRWbvWEnblnnNvpeNQ.text: This place is a disgrace to brewpubs.  I really wanted this to be my first one star review, but the server was too nice (if slow) and they are at least trying to make good beers. The atmosphere is like a CB and potts that went out of style. Oh yeah, with and awkward sushi bar in the back. Your typical depressing downtown vegas crowd. Food was pretty gross. I may not ever eat shrimp again because of this place. It looked like shrimp, but it tasted kinda look rotten overcooked chicken.  The portobello mushroom was very stringy and also tasted as if it had just been microwaved after being frozen since the ice age.

9VEFCxmaqG0DFhGVt2hgdQ.text: Good place in an old school casino.  Came here with a group of 15 and were seating quickly, the service was great and the food was pretty good for the price.

jiU5PUr2eIQSO9qgYP7DzA.text: $1.50 pints in the casino was probably the best beer deal I found in Vegas, though I thought it was odd that the same beer was twice that in the brewpub.  Beers were decent quality and some happy hour food deals were alright.  For thrifty beer drinking gamblers in Fremont area, this is your place.

4xIVqyQk-05XAqiyzdEdFA.text: Good menu selection and decent prices.  I always go for the beer sampler and fish & chips.    Yet to be disappointed.   Probably one of my favorite places to go downtown for just a regular meal.

aEcU5tRrXoAPKdaTUQIRiw.text: This place has all the micros you could think of. The sampler is a great way for you to try a little bit of everything. On top of beer, they have a menu that covers all the bases from American Grill to Sushi.  They also have a happy hour, which is always a bonus!  I had a burger here with some beer and it was a great choice.

6seKtBGShtZXqfEFrIT8ig.text: 777 is my favorite late-night place downtown, and since I am usually looking for a meal around 3am, I have tried lots of them. I always get the same thing, and I am completely full and out the door, including tax and tip, for $10! The Loco Moco is very hearty and a real bargain for only $5.25 from 2am-7am. They also have 16oz micro brews for $2 during that time.I have only been there during lunch/dinner hours once before, but I had a very enjoyable meal that time, as well. I had the Mahi Mahi, which was great. Then I had probably the greatest dessert on earth, the deep-fried cheescake.

wPbmfD1Xg1ALAKjs0F42XQ.text: The atmosphere was great and the food was okay. My coworkers and I went for happy hour. We had mozzarella sticks, wontons, and the quesadilla- typical bar food and it was pretty good. Service was not so great. Our server was less than attentive and flat out refused to split a check. It wasn't like we were asking her to split it seventeen different ways. We just wanted to split it between TWO parties. My feeling is that any place that makes it difficult to pay your bill is sending the message that our business isn't important. She also refused to give us a takeout box.

_Q9lOyMbeVBSXJIHMO26vg.text: I'm a huge fan of this place.  Bang for your buck, hands-down one of the best places in Vegas.  It's a place that when it comes to comfort foods, there is no better place.  Buffalo wings are the best I've had in Vegas.  The cheesy garlic bread is unlike anything you've ever had anywhere else.  It's a meal in itself.  Great way to start.  The fried calamari serving is huge.  Just put some lemon on that and you're all set.  As far as entrees.  Their Beer-Battered Jumbo Shrimp looked like pieces of fried chicken on my plate...HUGE and delicious!  Burgers are always made just perfect.  Nice size as well.  The pizza and pizza crust is great, but stay away from the 4 cheese pizza ONLY because it has WAY too much cheese.  If you're into that, then it might be pure ecstasy.  I honestly can't say that this place has too many misses.    If you go after midnight, they have a special on all their own brews.  My favorite is the High Roller Gold.  It's $1.50 for a 16oz. glass.  Well worth it.    I promise you will NOT walk out of this place disappointed.  Enjoy

9jlZzTEzTbaK2koSofAf2g.text: Beer is a 5! Food is what made it a little lower. Service was great. All the beer was great. Pale was my favorite. Belgium IPA was different and really good!

CuHZFO-Zp93Vg56p0BW-eQ.text: We have added the Triple 7 to our 'must eat one lunch' at least list.  We enjoy the food, beer and neighborhood tavern feel.  The burgers are very good and the variety of their beer makes it interesting.  The pricing is very reasonable and using Yelp's scale, I would rate it a $$ also.    The casino is classic and worth the visit if for no other reason than to view the woodwork.  It's just a block north of the Plaza at the west end of the Fremont Street Experience.

qJuY-iipIYKAeai2ODe-8A.text: We usually stay at MSS, so we eat at Triple 7 at least twice each trip. This time around we had a great server one night that was attentive and caring even though she had a ton of tables. We received plenty of refills and our burgers were delicious as always. The micro brews are still we'll priced and delicious. Here's where they lost two stars...We also visited late one night during our trip and it was an awful experience. Our server only came by once and never refilled our drinks. My wife ordered Alfredo pasta, when it came the chicken was rubbery and inedible. The server was bothered by my wife's request to send it back, only after waiting 15 minutes for her to come back to tell her the chicken was bad. I noticed that there are a lot more loud and annoying yuppies that frequent this place now, not as fun as when I started dining here 4 years ago. Lets get more Hawaiians in here again, they are always friendly and respectful. If I wasn't loyal to Boyd I probably wouldn't return after this bad experience.

eTp3N6unpmPdQjQquOSMEg.text: Just a fun place!  Good beer. Sushi Bar. Great food. TV's everywhere. One of the best casual dining locations downtown!

gPItSGtU_atm_JSAys27uw.text: This place has potential, but since I tried the wings and wasn't feeling them I can only give them 3 stars for now. I'm sure next time we come the score will improve based on all the other food options that everyone in my party seemed to enjoy. The mango hef was pretty good, so I'd come back to see what other flavors they cook up in the future.

aqRiiJWdgQpy-nUYaK1buw.text: a disappointing trend to a what used to be a pretty good quality place? have always eaten here multiple days during visits. our latest trip brought us here for dinner. The dinner special was a seared ahi salad for $12.95. Now by vegas standards $12.95 means something extraordinary. What we got was an iceberg lettuce salad with an overpowering asian vinegar dressing. Top it of with a medium rare ahi with strings in the middle!!!!! totally unacceptable. I've never had a bad meal here for years until this past week. so sad..once my favorite place drops to the bottom of the list. dared not try to order the sashimi and sushi for fear of more poor quality. is it the economy or lazy chef?

YeHV8Xs0zpQnKPrrvHQSwQ.text: Great place right off Fremont street. Great parking, & even better food.!!

_VVu-vwIb2LpavHQ8SXf-A.text: Possibly the most insulting situation I have ever been in. Our waitress ignored us after the meal was brought out. Never got a refill, and we waited for approximately 20 minutes at the end for our check. In the end, I only got it because I asked for the manager. He dropped the appetizer off the bill. Ill stop somewhere much closer to home next time.

lpf2oNlvc_kX4svuT3zLcQ.text: I recommend this place. Been here about 10 times, Usually when out of towners come visit.  Pros:  1.  Wide selection 2.  Price, especially cheap beers 3.  The Salmon, Calamari, Oyster Shooters, and Fish/Chips  Cons: 1.  Depending when you go, there's a wait. You get seated fairly quick, but waitresses every once in awhile forget you're there. Maritess is the only exception. She's always around and pleasant to talk to.  2.  Don't get the sushi!! Not fresh, too loose, and too much rice.

CEDzLAQUUC-FYvTj7twUrw.text: This continues to be our favorite place for late night food that provides the island flavor satisfaction we seek that other downtown area places don't have or when we don't feel like waiting in long lines for oxtail soup. Anytime sushi option with the meals make this joint unique I'm food choice variety.   I'm really not a beer person but I guess people here come for the best of that too' Love the atmosphere and service is fast considering the variety of dishes the kitchen needs to prepare.   Food for the mood...you can be sure that if you're feeling light there's great salads and appetizers, fresh oysters, edamame, artichoke dips, sliders, and every traditional favs. Or if you're feeling hearty try king size prime rib, meatloaf, Alfredo with garlic bread, many more!!!  Food has always tasted grand, I don't know what the bad reviews were eating but I haven't had anything I didn't like. So give them a try...a full house and lines out the door during mealtime don't happen at joints with food that suck!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiger bomb and dragon roll
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari and edamame!

mPZ0BpbfzQqTncBoWQaYCQ.text: The beer choices were decent.  The appetizers were good.  We had the sliders, fried pickles and bacon wrapped Jalapenos. The dinner of different types of burgers were all good.  The service was fast and courteous. price was eh.  We would come back for a night out.

SP5UoYXrwHJ08kdq8Ppa4Q.text: Mmmm yum, had dinner here while staying the night at the adjacent connecting California hotel.  My lover boy and I decided to order an appetizer and two meals to share.   Hot crab and artichoke dip...a yummy appetizer that is so rich smooth and creamy! Ir comes with tortilla chips and garlic bread slices for dipping, this is a winner!  BBQ chicken pizza, very good! Mmmm sliced purple onion, cilantro and smoked Gouda cheese with a nice sweet and tangy BBQ sauce.   Brewmaster's Tekka maki sushi roll, mmm yum! Ahi roll in beer batter, deep fried, comes with a nice teriyaki dipping sauce and wasabi.  High roller gold draft wheat beer  This experience was very fun, we had an awesome server by the name of Ana she was fantastic!   This place is busy on the weekends, we went on a saturday and there was a small line forming to be seated through out most of the night.   Would definitely come back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. High roller brew
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bbq chicken pizza
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. crab and artichoke dip

qZtq6Hfzt_iVHZouDDVt8w.text: If I could give this place a negative star I would. The first time I was here the service was terrible and the food was unbearable. If it wasn't for the fact we waited an hour and I had two three year olds starving we would have got up and left. Needless to say it's three years later and I thought I would give it another chance. What a mistake! The service was as terrible the waitress took forever to show up and when she did she was very argumentative and unwilling to make slight substitutions to our order request. When the food finally came out it was Luke warm and the presentation looked as though my 7 year old made it and threw it on a plate. This place is terrible don't waste your time or your money.

5qt7tQz-zp_fF2_1ighPsA.text: If you have no other options and this is the only thing open, then go ahead and get it, but the food is not great. Greasy and sub-par.

2zCuF-lVnfwTaK6grrivRw.text: This is a good spot. Their beer is good, not amazing or anything but not objectionable.   The food is also good. The ribs were good, the steak was good enough.   Its cheap, and best of all, its open late. As long as you're not looking for fine dining, this is a good place to go.

Bsz8qyBjVogyZeL4eVE3Bg.text: Nice interior with a charming Old World feel. We weren't very hungry so we just got a plate of shrimp cocktail to share and drinks. The shrimp cocktail was pricey and, honestly, not good. But we stayed for awhile because we could people-watch (there was a steam punk convention of sorts that day) and we enjoyed the ambience of the place. Our server wasn't very friendly and seemed to be in a rush always.

5eaez_mXb9hdeDqsLzF27Q.text: I have visited this place on multiple occasions. Always drawn here by fresh brewed selection of beer, late night menu, reasonable prices and ample seating.   It's really no frills and very straight forward, food is much like any grill/coffee shop and nothing to write home about.  I mostly like to sit at the bar and enjoy a house brew and occasional appetizer.  Really, there's nothing outstanding about this place, service or food, it's a very standard downtown coffee shop type venue, burgers, breakfast, Asian section.  Tons of seating options- tables and a long bar, means it's very unlikely you'll ever have to wait for a seat.  If you want locally brews on tap, good value and unpretentious spot, give them a try if you are nearby.

w9Qf4_VpOz2CCWjzyJWQyg.text: Based on my equation of great + plus really good food + mistake-free service = 5 stars, upgrading Triple 7 to 5 stars is a no-brainer. Every time I come here I am more and more impressed with their brews. My last visit it was a wonderful Lemongrass Kolsch. This time it's a phenomenal Sour Saison. Triple 7 took two of my favorite styles and made a memorable brew with a perfectly balanced level of tartness. And their other seasonal, a hoppy wheat brew, was also excellent.  On my last visit I heard great things about their sushi. You wouldn't expect sushi from a casino to be good, but the downtown casinos have a high volume of Hawaiian and Asian patrons, especially Triple 7 and the adjoining California. So this time I ordered a nigiri sampler and it was beautiful. The hamachi and ahi were outstanding, and all of the pieces were HUGE.   I can't imagine a future Vegas vacation without a stop at Triple 7. Some of the best craft brew I've ever had, some of the best sushi I've ever had - how could I NOT consider this one of my favorite places on earth?

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh did I mention the sushi is freakin awesome?
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flight of the house brews ... but  the seasonals are what make 777 amazing

1gCQ2AugG9rHkC8H5QB-Pg.text: The 777 Brewery is a great place to grab a beer and a burger.  At first I wasn't real thrilled about walking through the casino of Main Street Station, because of all the smoke' the Brewery is really good the beer is ice cold and the the foot is awesome.  I have been there three times and each time we have had a great experience.  We have gotten good service each time and the staff are wonderful.  The Beacon Chicken Chopped Salad is a must!

blxDozreQn5p_RQ1Iq4LXQ.text: This place is consistently good and reasonably priced. The service is good too. Lots of variety on the menu too. Highly recommend.

wJl1fB7t9xMvyDueMc7mPQ.text: Came in for a beer and had the porter and it is pretty good. A little roasted flavor like a porter should have but not chewy.  Also had two happy hour appetizers which were quesadillas and Mac and cheese. I give the quesadilla a 4 out of 5 but the Mac and cheese only a 2.5. Bar staff is friendly and there are some locals here which to me is a good sign. Worth stopping in if you are out in Fremont St area.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour appetizers.  Not bad for $3 each.
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here&#39;s the brewing equipment so it&#39;s the real deal.

jyGg8ls-MKUMy4HS16ygWQ.text: I kept hearing that Triple 7 was one of the original microbreweries in LV and previous years, I was never really interested in trekking all the way downtown to try their beer.  Well I finally made it and after I tried some of their food and beer, I wanted to stay longer and try more beer if I didn't have a previous appointment to make.  The bartender and staff were pretty friendly albeit in the afternoon hours, it was pretty dead in there.  They have happy hour specials but the prices here are pretty cheap for beers and food alike.  I got an order of potstickers and a big 24 oz beer for under $10!  I mean, that's at regular price so happy hour will even be lower than that!  This place isn't the prettiest or newest place to drink beer in the town but the value can't be beat.  Main St Station seems to be getting the shaft compared to the California across the street is super full of people in their restaurants.  I love Hawaiian food but I love beer more!!  If I'm walking by this area of Fremont and Main again, then I'll make sure to stop by in here for a blonde ale!

2K5kYucqSseS07f1X3iy_A.text: The food was amazing I can't lie, but the fact that they charged me an additional $2 just cause I got it to-go instead of dine-in really pissed me off. Especially cause they didn't even tell me about it, I just seen the charge added to my bill and thought wow how unprofessional. I'd go here again for their happy hour specials but other than that, I won't be back. Don't get me wrong, the food was more than great, but not for their everyday prices that BY THE WAY do not match the prices of their online menu that you can look at on here .

OR0PNHI4aCEfmpg8WyUx9Q.text: This place is a hidden gem!!! Take the time to go! The prices are good, the food is great, the wings are the best and Richard is the BEST bartender EVER!!!!! This will be my hangout every time I'm in Vegas! If you want a great beer, food, drinks and atmo, you MUST come here!

h2l1n0OBwoajjTwMct_bqg.text: Service was terrible.  Waited 45 mins.  For food which only for a restaurant only 1/3 full. Food was not to what was order. I say choose somewhere else because attitude sucks.

1oQXYgzM8M7-KaNX4xd1HA.text: Stopped here on the way from Utah to Bakersfield. We were starving and needed some good eats.  I ordered the SF Burger wtih onion rings and hubby got a barbecue burger with sweet potato fries.  The burgers came out RAW. I kid you not. The onion rings were hot and crispy and so were the sweet potato fries, but seriously? A raw burger when we both asked for medium?  We sent them back and got new ones. Our server said the kitchen told her that's what medium is. Seriously??  The burgers were now cooked and hubby enjoyed his. Mine however had a weird texture that grossed me out. I ate about a quarter of it and was done. My "new" onion rings were cold and super greasy. I couldn't even touch them.  Service was good. Our server and the hostess were both friendly and attentive. If the food was good, this place would have been a solid 4 stars. Two stars just for the service.

ccfMhQIweGAbXcjAwwZGeA.text: Super great hideaway a place my husband can get a gourmet burger and a micro brewed beer, and my children can devour the chicken wings and I can get sushi and a sake !! A Perfect brewery for my family.

qm-PgayG10MUAh6J9WM4Kg.text: Love this brewery, amazing customer service.  The bartenders were super helpful and joyous.  We had drinks and appetizers our bill was about $30, super cheap.  We opted for Dinner and dinner didn't disappoint.  Great gem in Downton Vegas.

3FTn7t5LhfC8SHWf3vy8TA.text: My friend I made on this September 2019 Vegas trip suggested this place. I have been here once or twice before as I recognize the interior. Well, we were staying on the Boulder Hwy so we took the free shuttle at Sam's Town and arrived at Fremont and then walked over to California and then upstairs it connects to Main Street Station. Triple 7 is inside MSS.   They brew their own beer. It is good too. I like stouts and porters but they did not have many of those as they are in season mainly during the winter or cooler months. However, I did get the one stout they had and also tried their red ale. The stout was awesome and had a Guiness consistency to it but much more of a flavor profile and bouquet. Fantastic! The red ale was good but I liked the stout better. It was $4 for a 23 oz during Happy Hour which we planned for. So for food I got the 2 oysters for $1.50 (small and ok), portobello fries (super portobello shrooms cut into wedges like steak fries and fried-solid!) and I got the honey garlic wings (10 for $8-decent-nothing special).   Interior is cool and a nice open space and vibe. The brewing tanks are present behind glass and tons of tvs for sports watching fever. The interior is modern and clean  Our waitress was nice and very attentive. Excellent service. The beer is the highlight. The food that I had was good for the shrooms but meh for the wings and oysters. If I lived in Vegas I would be hittin' this place up for their beer during HH. Next time Iam in Vegas a trip here or two is beyond definitely in order. You gotta try this brewery. Bomb beer!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5kX8mQbBrWXq1o_-VQrKlw.text: This message is for Chris J.  I tried to reply to her and send her a message, but for reason, the Yelp website kept failing to send.  So here is my reply to her:  There isn't much more to say other than what I reported.  I know that cost-control is a big issue with all restaurants, but if that is what is causing the things that I reported, then I think that your food quality at 777 will cause your restaurant to do more poorly in the future.  I love the ambiance of your restaurant/pub/bar, and it is a great place to watch a game and have a meal.  But those things that I reported are certainly deteriorations from years gone past when I have dined (many times) at the 777 Brew Pub.    Also, I also know that you folks implemented a new "comp" system for guests.  Now the comp is put onto the players B-Connected card.  In my case, I had a comp for my two kids, and my gold card for my wife and me. I told my waitress to pub my wife's and my meal on my gold card and my two kids meals on my comp.  She said she would do this, but apparently didn't.  I had no way of knowing this at the time we ate at the 777 but the waitress took the entire food bill off my B-Connected card.  So the comp was used and the balanced charged against my points.  The gold card was never used for my wife's and my meals.  I discovered this when we got home and I was checking the B-Connected website.  My point count did not make any sense and that is how I found out the waitresses mistake.    Like I said, I think I outlined quite well what my problems were.  If there is a way to fix them, that would be great.  If not, and if cost-control/reduction is the driving force, then sobeit.

J_2kqmZ49-G75JeMrnMyNA.text: Better than the overpriced buffet. It's located off the casino floor. Triple 7 is unique from other casino bars because it has its own brewery, so you for sure want to get a beer here. Beer isn't horribly overpriced either. The food menu has some good options, but the beers are the best items.   It has some very good deals. It's $5.75 for a 23 ounce. That's a price that's hard to match for microbrewery beer in Vegas ounce for ounce. The beer is what they're known for, but they make cocktails too. Flagship beer is the High Roller Gold. It's a golden colored ale. This is refreshing and smooth. Food here is a lot of the usual stuff like seafood, steaks, and the like. The appetizers for edamame are about $3.99 or so.   Much better food than at the buffet. Even though most people come for the beer. The rest of the hotel isn't as great, but this definitely makes it worth coming to for fresh beer and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. High Roller Gold And Edamame

WRk3rGIciICk3m-BR9HvGg.text: Looking for a non standard casino dinner, grabbed a quick bite at Triple 7.   They are always good for a reasonable prime rib dinner and they delivered once again.   I ordered the Prime Rib medium with double veggies and a side salad.  Note on the side salad.  I ordered side salad with blue cheese and no croutons.  What came was a sad plate of butter lettuce and dressing.  Would t hurt you to toss a carrot or something in there.   Overall, not too bad of a dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib.  It&#39;s the lighting, but it was actually cooked.

qVi0okqgRXTVicfiReWOfQ.text: A solid 3 star place. Came here with a group of 10 and they were able to seat us right away.  I got the Steak Frites. The steak was actually cooked perfectly except that it was hard and chewy. For a $17 steak it tasted like a $10 diner steak you would get at a diner. The fries also tasted frozen and old. I would not get it again.  The Santa Fe Salad was pretty good but there were too many toppings compared to the actual amount of lettuce. It had a nice dressing and was a pretty decent salad.  The cheeseburger was also okay but just average. This place is okay for a quick meal especially if you're staying at the hotel and casino. But it's not good quality. It is also too expensive for the quality.  This place is also a brewery so they have a lot of drinks but it's cheaper to just get drinks outside at the casino.. Service was pretty good but she never refilled my water. Food was brought out quickly though.

wSBkLmRNuXTnoMYCWhw-QQ.text: Got the mushroom burger, spicy tuna, and oysters. Service is pretty good. Fries are hot. Oysters seemed fresh.

sR1TkZl5puk5FavSj0O2dA.text: Went here about a month ago and it sure was a busy night. We got seated right away at a high top table. The place wad packed as everyone was watching the basketball game.   We're starving and wanted to share something so we got the steak and fries and mushrooms.  The mushrooms here are my favorite I can eat it everytime I come here.  Sometimes twice a day.  Well everything was going great food was tasting deliciousas always drinks were cold.  Although the bartender brought me the wrong beer I had to chase him down for the right one.  No problem.   I was on the last piece of the mushroom and all if a sudden I pull a long hair from the batter of the mushroom.  I was like oh SH%/! I lost my appetite.  Then a young gentleman came to check on us and ask how were doing and we told him what happened and he said would you want to talk to the chef we said we don't want to grumble but okay.   The chef came to our table and he was so apologetic. He surely was nice. He asked who our server was and we told Him a young friendly girl.  She came over and apologized also. They're really nice and understanding.  It does happen I understand that.  I loved watching them prepare all the foods as to where we were seated next to the kitchen. So many different types of plates coming out of the kitchen. Chef was nice enough to comp the bill. We said we want to pay for something he said no your bill is taken cared of.  This place is really nice to come to if your at main street and want to take a break from gambling and want to rest something.  Come eat here.  They do have sushi to.  I will come back and try the mushrooms again...

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and fries
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Street Tacos
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceaser salad

mpzjEUQ0SInKyZoI9RVrxQ.text: We ate here a number of times during our recent stays in Las Vegas, and that's an endorsement in itself because we love trying different places to eat.   We've always been happy with the prime rib and steaks, and the beer is lovely. Two happy hours each day, afternoon and after 11. If you're staying nearby, it's extremely convenient with long hours. (Closed 7 in the morning until 11, and a couple of Mondays each month for deep cleaning.)   I love the ribeye steak, and the T-bone is also outstanding. One night I had a side of onion rings instead of potato. My steak was engulfed in onion rings. The platter was so full the veggies had to go in a side dish. There's also a sushi menu. The other night my son tried the ale-battered shrimp which turned out to be five huge shrimp - probably 3 ounces each - with a delicious, light, crisp batter coating. The side salad he ordered ($2) was huge and fresh with cherry tomatoes and cucumber and lots of croutons.   If you are ever unhappy with anything, just tell them. They'll make it right.

mAgw6GV4DCVFUDh7rkZEBw.text: Located in Main Street Hotel and Casino (about a block from Fremont Street in Las Vegas), this is a very beautiful restaurant. Also a brewery, you can see the huge copper beer barrels(?) in the background and gives it a nice touch. They have huge TVs everywhere with a few different games on. We enjoyed a Long Island (one of the best we've had) and a Malibu and Coke. The bartender was great and friendly, and on top of refilling our drinks. We also ordered the French Fry Sample and the sauces to go with it to snack on, soo good. Pretty decent prices too. Really enjoyed Triple 7 and highly recommend visiting. It's a nice change from the Las Vegas strips and people; it's quiet and pleasant to enjoy and hang out.  Will be back to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Fry Sampler : Truffle fries and Sweet Potato Fries. Ranch, spicy ketchup and an garlic aioli. SUPER GOOD.

QFUmUVRGaTstHh9pW99AbA.text: Located in the old part of Vegas, it's a favorite spot of my in-laws.   Went to Triple 777 for dinner the last time I was in town. The place wasn't too busy, pretty clean, aside from the typical 2nd hand smoke from the casino you have to walk through to get to the restaurant.   Also, did I mention, it's a microbrewery!   I ordered the 5 beer sampler which comes with five 5oz beers. Not sure if it's always the selection I'm about to list but included in  the flight was the Special (I think at the moment it's the Double Down Hefenweizen), High Roller, Black Chip, Royal Red Ale, & Marker Pale Ale. Of those, my favorite was the High Roller because it reminded me of a Stella Artois. Yum! I really don't wanna be too opinionated on the beer because I understand everyone's palate is different. I will say it's a nice variety to sample.   As far as food went, I got a margherita pizza and the ale battered mushrooms.   I'll start with the mushrooms. I thought they had potential of being really good. There was a good balance of crispiness of the batter and the mushrooms, portobello to be exact, were seasoned pretty well and they were thick and "meaty" slices. The only disappointment was it was a bit too oily.   The pizza was less disappointing. The crust was on the thinner side, cheese was ooey & gooey. They did not skimp on the tomatoes and fresh basil which makes me believe that of you ordered other types of pizza, they won't skimp on those toppings. I wanna say the tomatoes need a lil salt or maybe some crushed red pepper. Otherwise, it's a decent pizza with a decent price and it paired nicely with all the beer drinking.   Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita Pizza
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ale battered mushrooms.

4E330PktScSM8k2abH6FXA.text: Stopped by to meet our friends here. I've never been inside Main Street hotel or this restaurant but I mean it's downtown and it practically looks like all the other hotels downtown.   What caught my eye the most about triple 7s was there huge brewery. You can see the tanks right behind the sushi bar from a see through glass while dining. Pretty neat!   As for food, like everyone says they all come in huge portions which is awesome for sharing!   We ordered mozzarella sticks, Caesar salad with salmon, and my boyfriend ordered a sushi roll.  I totally forgot to take pictures but I got a snap of what I could!  The Caesar salad with salmon was actually really good! The romaine was super fresh and crunchy. And the salmon was super juicy and marinated really well.  The mozzarella sticks were basic but served hot and really fast.  My boyfriend ate all of his sushi roll and did say anything bad about it so I'm guessing it was good!   Overall, not a bad place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oTrH5A9jDfT69eQKO_iwGQ.text: Went here on 7/3/19 and all I can say was ATTITUDE ATTITUDE ATTITUDE. Poor customer service. Our waitress just ruined the whole vibe for the dinner. Like I'm sorry I don't care if you are having a bad day or your shift is almost over. Workers shouldn't make customers feel like a burden, when all we want is to have a nice dinner and a good time.   The food is fantastic as always. The oyster shooters, prime rib, the pizza, etc.   Maybe next time we come and stay at Main Street it will be better. But until then I have to say 2 stars.

E9iC1B4yuKKbGhhxfbm9Gg.text: This was the first time I ate here and it was great !!!  I opted for the fish and chips and I was totally impressed with the fish. It was moist and flaky and the coating was not oily and dense.   It comes with the tartar sauce but I really liked it with the malt vinegar. I could taste the fish and batter much better with the vinegar.   I also had two large draft beers. I can't recall the names but I asked for the lightest-tasting ones and both were excellent !!!  I would definitely return to try something else but I wouldn't hesitate to order the fish and chips again.

IQ5zxX4OpDOZmz8KNnlBIQ.text: There were 2 bartenders there tonight and neither of them acknowledged me at the bar. Pretty bad since the restaurant isn't even busy at all and it's 8:30pm. Pretty disappointing since I was there the night before and service was way better. They both kept walking by me. WTH! You have to be kidding me! Both of them ignored me multiple times before I came out to the casino bar and a nice "little bit older" man helped me. I'm surprised I had to go out of my way to give the casino my money. Next time I'll just stay at a different casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This guy is a worthless employee. Doesn&#39;t do anything and I mean nothing.

XXfsNOgz86G2iFD_3Isi1A.text: I see how this place might have some real potential in being a good option to eat at while in the area.  However, my experience made me and my party wishing we'd skipped being here that morning.  We had started out at Market Street Cafe looking only for Oxtail Soup.  They told us that we had to trek over here for it.  So, after a good walk, we arrived and were promptly seated.  Service was okay, but everything else was not up to snuff.  The four of us all ordered the Oxtail Soup.  Yay!!  We were so ready for this moment!  The server brought out ginger & cilantro for our soups.  Sadly, when the soup arrived, it was near tepid.  It seemed as if they weren't expecting to serve any here, so they didn't even bother to keep it warm on the stove!  Such a disappointment!  I think we all powered through and ate most of the soup since we had worked so hard to chase after it!  Midway through our soup anticlimax, we heard loud noises and saw sparks near the brewing vats at the kitchen side of the restaurant.  Really??  Yes, they were behind a curtain working, but I could see the sparks and hear the loud noise.  Worst of all is the SMELL from it!  Metallic cutting or welding does not go well with trying to eat.  This should never have happened!  This restaurant does have periods of time when they are closed and those would have been the ideal time to take care of their equipment repairs!  We were not informed of this upon being seated (or ever), and even though our server did apologize and empathize with us after we brought it up, that just isn't good enough!   I will probably not ever step foot in this restaurant again and I know without a shadow of a doubt, I will never order Oxtail Soup from here in the future!!

CsNc8ka6-6AsyqLdB-V1hw.text: I expected an average hotel restaurant but was very surprised. Great service and great food.  They have sushi, burgers, steaks, pizza and many appertizers.We ordered pizza, wings, fish n chips, and super big chilli dog.  Big portions! It is located on 2nd floor between Boyds 2 casinos. Lots of tv's showing sports.  They have dessert options and teryaki bowlsand craft beers.

EXE3YST0KWIim2qDQbPVtA.text: Definitely wasn't expecting to have my oxtail soup here.   Market Cafe was only serving buffet and wasn't opening their full menu til 7am.  Well, we had an itinerary PLUS we needed sustenance before our hike.   Unfortunately,  soup didn't come out hot enough,  rice was hard, and construction in the background didn't sum up an awesome experience this time around.  Albeit, the soup came fully stocked of meaty and soft oxtail, tons of veggies,  and a generous amount of ginger and cilantro  (which I LOVE) bumped it to a 3 star for me.  Thanks Auntie for this hearty breakfast! Nap time for Chel!

bbFXqgVBNy9W95sMURDLug.text: A super cool microbrew located inside the Main Street Station Casino.  The room itself is magnificent.  High ceiling, a huge bar on both sides of the restaurant and big barrel systems where they make the beer visible to the customers.  I was only there to sample a few beers when I noticed the gentleman next to me enjoying some of the largest raw oysters I have ever seen.  Not to spoil my supper plans I opted for a half dozen.  What a wonderful treat they were.  So good I returned the following day at opening time to enjoy another order before heading to the airport.  The beers were not nothing special but they where are a nice break from the typical domestic.  Just like to give a big Thank you to Richard the bartender.  He was super helpful and fun to talk to.  I will see you next time I am in town.

VhBjk33ked9UcIF5vSP2Lw.text: This is a very convenient food and beer joint located inside the Main casino in Downtown.  The hours are great, variety of food to choose from is wide, the beer is locally brewed and of great quality, and the food varies from decent to really good.   Tonight I had the hot chicken wings and fries. Both were alright. Nothing too exciting.  The wings were a bit overcooked as the fries. The sauce was good, but they got kinda stingy with it. In the past I've tried their sushi, which was surprisingly pretty good.   The range of food options is one of the best reasons to come here. They have burgers, tacos, pizza, sandwiches, and even oysters.  You name it, they got it.   I've been coming here for quite some time and whether your food is ok or really good is a hit or miss.  You won't be disappointed in their beer, though.
