SllsljlBPOrMfVa6o9sVNQ.text: Food was ok. Our waitress sucked. Took her almost 45 minutes to take our order. Never asked if we wanted refills on our beverages. Brought my husband the wrong drink.... We had to call on another waitress to put in our order. Very disappointed.

502I4b3c95kiveOhYqva2g.text: Come for the beer and stay for the prices.   We stopped here to kill some time before our check in at another hotel. I love trying new beer, especially from microbreweries. It was only a brief stop and I can't comment on the food. First, I want to say that I was very shocked at the price of our beer. Two beers came out to the grand total of $3! Isn't that amazing. That beer was almost free. However, the beer just ok. There wasn't anything too special about it, aside from the price of course. If I remember correctly I had the Pale Ale and tried a couple of other samples. The bartender was cool and had no problem with talking to us about the beer.   As I'm reading the reviews on the side panel, I believe we caught the happy hour special. I think this is a good place off the strip to hangout in the afternoon and start some day drinking.

2HywRfvlAtyZN-hMKgkw_Q.text: We came her from one of our parties suggestions. It's in an old casino downtown which should have been my first clue that I should have nixed going here. 2 out of the 8 steaks were ok the rest of the sides were cold and the veggies definitely came out of a bag. Do not eat here!!!!!!!!!

sT0Gm3dbLmmdo6xNScC-0Q.text: This place has an amazing late night happy hour that we like to go to.  The bartenders are super nice and the food always comes out really fast. I don't drink beer but my lover likes the selection. They have sushi and lots of other menu items for whatever you are craving.

HOJ6K1t0svo92KqCVOPyEQ.text: Initially we came here because we get a comp every month and got tired of other dining places at California Hotel/Main Street. "Why not try something new?" Everything I have tried in the last 3 visits were all mediocre. I do have to say, this place claims to have award-winning microbrews and is known for their hand-crafted beer so food may not be their specialty.  SERVICE It really depends on who you get. Sometimes you get an attentive/friendly server constantly checking up on you and have conversation with you. Then there are other times you get a moody/bitchy server who seems to be having the worst day of her life.   FOOD  Philly Cheese Steak? Meh. Flavor was non-existent Chicken Breast Marsala? Chicken cooked with Marsala wine sauce. Meh. Monterey Chicken Sandwich? Chicken topped with Pepper jack cheese and avocado. Meh. Fish and Chips? Seems to be the popular item here. Tartar sauce on the side was good but fish was so dry. Meh.  I felt like leaving this place with all the disappointing food but then their old fashioned root beer float called my name.   It's a vanilla ice cream with Henry Weinhard's Old School Root Beer. Oh My God.  It's a simple, lovely delight. I've never been a fan of root beer float but wow. Where have you been all my life? It's not one of those cheapo root beer float you got at the high school festival. It's the real deal, and they make it good.   CONCLUSION Root beer float.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips. Got some root beer float on the side as well.
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious root beer float. Best in town!

AhmdGsXFGObv4t5685tHgg.text: Great service, food and atmosphere. Happy hour prices were a great deal. We were steered here by a local and it was perfect.

axcAKM-M-djAtmxTfxrzDw.text: Long overdue, but on Christmas Eve 2016, we came to have dinner here (party of 9 including me) after ziplining at the nearby Slotzilla on Fremont. My dad has trouble hearing, and since the restaurant was partially empty (Christmas Eve, duh), he politely asked the manager to turn the televisions down since they were all blasting some football game. The manager said 'sorry, that's the way it is', meaning that would be a simple 'no'. Dad was not thrilled. Our food came out super quick, like fifteen minutes after we ordered. We were all satisfied with everything, food and drinks. We will definitely be back.

dfbH0e7Fn92oTPslI8KnHQ.text: My mom stopped in to have a flight of beers which she enjoyed thoroughly. The bar has a feel about it that is nice. It's open. Has beautiful brewery of beers to look at. I had the Korean ribs and chili. The ribs were the hit of the meal. They were smoky and charred just right. I will go back just for those! The chili they say is famous but wasn't my favorite. The have a great happy hour 1/2 price.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The flight

_kAKhngf6Yoc14bKUOWpPg.text: Tried this place out and of course it was packed (the world series game was on) but we got right in an sat quickly. The food was good and the atmosphere was nice. The waitress seemed alittle distracted with her tables, took a few to get drinks refilled and when we needed something else she was not around, I guess she seemed too busy to wait on us. That is really the only complaint. The food was good and prepared well. I would go here again and try their other foods and drinks too.

spJfCuCw9zNwbPLMqMXvhA.text: Love this place for lunch! Service is incredibly fast coming out and delicious. Lots of variety and the beer is excellent!

Tu6-3R0oIRJgCNSSrJ-HLQ.text: My husband and I had a staycation at the Mainstreet Casino in which this restaurant is located inside. I am a transitioning Vegan, so finding something vegan was a task in itself ! I did finally go with the vegetable flatbread. It was a nice size. 4 slices, but it was THE most bland flatbread I've ever eaten!!! I also went with the fried mushrooms. They were very tasty! I must by the end of the night I was in the bathroom  never again

0pHsB0YV4Bzk2n9fpCNHRg.text: Located in The Main Street Station Hotel Casino in Downtown Las Vegas. Yes, they brew beer in Las Vegas. This is a great local brewer, not to mention a killer happy hour, cheep pints and cheep and abundant flights! Try one try them all! Well worth the short walk from Fremont Street. If you are Downtown be sure to stop in! Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $3 Happy Hour Quesadilla!

r25IM8sg3V2hU1jP4DvioQ.text: Came here for a quick bite to eat after flying in from Oahu. The restaurant looked busy however there was no wait, & watching it while we were eating looks like there is a quick turnover so I can't imagine a long wait.   It did take our server about 10 minutes to come take our order and she apologized. We got margaritas which I think was the best part of our meal. The food (a salad, veggies & rice, and steak and the blue burger and garlic fries) my fries were cold when I got them and the veggies were not that hot either. It seemed like it wasn't even sitting under the heater. Being a waitress and bartender myself I know the importance of people wanting their food fresh and hot. That is the reason for the lower rating. Other than that the experience was good, lots of tvs to watch games, sorta noisy, looks like a full bar, casino is right outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QlqSwDSWvOSbGWhK5wQkHw.text: Triple 7 is a great place to catch a game and have a few drinks in the Main Street Station Hotel downtown. The restaurant/bar is a pretty good size with high ceilings, multiple TV's, a good crowd and a long bar. They're usually always busy but the food doesn't very long to come out. I've only had appetizers here; the nachos were awesome but I was really disappointed in the deep fried mushrooms. They tasted like dirt so I know they weren't rinsed well.   The customer service wasn't bad and watching the Giants win the World Series made my experience at Triple 7 even sweeter. It's a good place for groups and I'd consider returning if I'm looking for a few drinks and bar food at a great price. Most appetizers were an average of $8. Hard to beat that!

-XhJiULoTgbaG1bc-WEUtA.text: We have eaten here four times in the three days we have been in Vegas. The sushi rice is surprisingly tasty, the garlic bread is filling, and the drinks are delicious! Best of all it's super reasonably priced and the portions are generous. 10/10 would recommend.

3TXS-3Yql4vcSRqcKEV-hA.text: 3.5 stars / 4 for this area! (d/t lv)...  thx to hawai'i relatives for passing along their unused meat/eggs/starch/toast/drink vouchers...this was 1 of 2 places opened 24/7 (the other being Market St Cafe @California Hotel)...this looks way nicer...  T H E  D E C O R . . . brewery, lots of tvs, & a sushi bar...couple of long sports bars ea left & right walls w/ tons of tables in behind...big resto...nice...doesn't look like it belongs in the rundown 'tellie in d/t!...  T H E  G R U B . . . weird hrs for b'fast, 2-7a only!... Ham & Eggs  |  10oz ham slice w/ 2 eggs, b'fast potatoes & toast (reg 6.25) ...big steak, but too salty...  Two Eggs any Style  |  broiled & served w/ fries  (reg 3.99) ...w/ bacon, sausage or spam (reg 4.99) ...about 6pcs of bacon...  coulda gotten Steak & Eggs  |  1/2lb NY strip w/ 2 eggs, b'fast potatoes & toast (reg 7.79) ...but jus had it a day ago @the other spot...  T H E  S E R V I C E ... our waitress was really friendly...we were the only customers in the whole place @4a initially...then another person came in...  N U T S H E L L . . . not bad...good prices...nice for the area, d/t lv... we have vouchers for prime rib too...so, may come bk b4 leaving town...

MeM7pw9XH68K-DCUzzA_fg.text: Great place to have a good time, lots of seafood and steaks, friendly atmosphere, lot of interesting home brews beers and reasonable pricing

G29MgF2vqReDQ0wclVyl5g.text: My wife and I always eat here. Big selection and the food has never been a disappointment. Our waitress today was Kristin. She is one of the prettiest and most pleasant young women ever. My wife and I agree she is probably the best server we have ever had the pleasure of ordering from.

315HgWdKG9-LaZKbUESiuQ.text: Slow and inefficient staff, food is beyond mediocre. For the price it's not worth it.

SL6m0bCFtqEWSR8odnugtQ.text: My favorite place for good beer and food!! If you have not been here u are missing out!! I need not say more this place is great every time I come here I am happy. Try to sit at the bar for the best experience you will not be disappointed!!!!

3JMROdAFBhN7jOMhSRGGgQ.text: The food here is typical bar food.... blah. The beer is just ok. Nothing write home about. But the reason for the 1 star is the service is horrible!!! I mean the worst!! Our waitress wanted me to sit at a high bar table with my 11 month old and my 3 year old...  she brings a high chair that would be about 2 feet below me and my 3 year old would have fell out the chair if I had let her sit there. And I told the waitress that I can't sit there with 2 babies and her response was... well I don't know what to tell you. Really is that how they are treating customers now?!?

Zt61US7t3prx7aczPJq-6A.text: Went here for lunch. We got seated in a few minutes. I had a hot pastrami sandwich with crinkle cut fries. I'm guilty of having a diet Pepsi to drink. Needed the caffeine. The sandwich was delicious. The bread had a perfect crunch and was filled with pastrami, lettuce, tomato, and some mayonnaise. The sandwich had lots of flavor. It also came with crinkle cut French fries. The fries were cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth with a couple of bites. So good!  I've been here before but never wrote a review about it. They also sell beer and other flavors of beer. There are plenty of big screen television screens that play sports. Music is also playing in the back ground. It's very loud in the restaurant. Service was slow because it was busy. The waitress was very  nice and made sure we were okay.  I love coming here for lunch or dinner. This place is a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami sandwich with French fries
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area

pnJFYdKP04dU5F_9m9ciMw.text: Great atmosphere, great food and beer selection. Had a really good time. Service was fast and friendly and they validate parking which made it convenient to do and see multiple things while in that area.

p4OAiUhUjwTx89QHMNHbhA.text: Triple 7 Microbrewery @ the Main Street Station has the best food and the best service downtown!  My husband & I had dinner there tonight and the food was delicious! The service was great, the beer was good and the whole place was nice and lively.  We had a really nice time.

ZpjiaLuaFS5oNMtVJCn_vQ.text: Wow! I am honestly surprised that I like this place.  I was not expecting much given that it is located downtown (sorry Mayor Goodman). The service is impeccable! Our server Florence was so knowledgeable and helpful. The wings are tasty (we prefer it dry with sauce on the side), not salty, nice and crispy just perfect with the beer. Their beers are superb quality with fair pricing...even better on Happy Hour: a pint at $2 and $3 for 23oz. Who the heck can beat that?  Great upbeat and casual atmosphere.  We will be baackkk!

yLob1yLQc8XML-6S462cLg.text: I would not even care to rate this place, wish there was a -0 star. Its def not a family friendly place, so people, make sure u plan accordingly.. All i wanted to do was order take out for my ohana. I tried calling, no answer. So i went down with my daughters to go make a take out order, i was told by the front check in, to go to the bar to make a order. I told her i have my daughter's  and if its ok, she said yes. I went to the bar and two waitress came very rudely and told me and my daughters to leave the area. I explained to her that the front lady said to come to the bar and make the order. Then very rudely again, they both say to leave.  I understand vegas is all about a certain age , duh! But all ur employees def need to get on the same page. At this time, i was not feeling good, i did not have much voice. All i wanted was to order food for my daughters... Thats it... i would never visit this place again! Thats why we only stay in the Cal. They are much friendlier and willingly to listen and help. Negative 0 stars! And i never like to rate like this unless they were absolutely rude or disrespectful and this place was both. SMH. BTW, this was back in January, and im still upset about it. Someone bought up her experiance at this place to me and she was not happy either. So here goes my review .

jm2U5xfCuSvCR2-jdFhIOA.text: Great stop for a snack during a day of gambling!  Sushi was over the top! Oyster shooters top notch! Service was slow so giving a 4 star rating!

Ny0wFbbl-jXcXQSDDAhSng.text: Maybe you shouldn't be rude when someone says you dont have the Playoff game on when waiting at the hostess station.

nyph-DHNo5OsIjoV1yQFbw.text: Best Value and I live the Huge Growler. Had to buy 1. The have tv's and good food also

FqkquYyvPKuuWhe_QBGQAQ.text: I tried out the oxtail fries, salmon nigiri and the dragon roll all which were really great these were the things that would bring me back this was for two people and it was pretty filling this portion came out to around $40 which isn't to bad  I also tried out the pasta which i deeply regret my guy thought it was okay but like me would never order it again it was around $9, the place is great and has a great atmosphere. I do hope to come back soon

pkpjvetESHzrBQAlJp7Asg.text: Good food, open late night! I ordered the chicken nachos which was huge! Unless you're a large eater, I'd recommend sharing with at least two people. The nachos are served with lots of black beans, salsa, sour cream, guacamole, and olives. Really yummy!

M3U0mj8gB_z2JmBTN7v7wg.text: We went here on our recent trip to Vegas.  The food was hearty and delicious.  The frozen margaritas were so good!   We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_Da6oUDJvGLiRLVijd094A.text: I love coming here,  especially if it's free.   My last visit,  however was not but I didn't feel bad about paying full price.    Aside from the grumpy lady who took 45 minutes to sit three parties in front of me,  I enjoyed myself.   We went on a Saturday night during a Packers vs Cardinals game and it was packed.   Nothing but good vibes here.    We ordered the prime rib meal $13.99 comes with a veggie and a carb (delicious steamed rice,  baked potato or mashed).   The quality of the beef wasn't that great but it was cheap so okay.    Tons of huge flat screens line the walls so there were no bad views of the game.   Waitress was pleasant and our food came quickly.    Aaron Rogers threw a Hail Mary to throw the game into OT and the "Packers side " of the place went crazy.    There was some poor chap in a faded Brett Favre Jersey who was crying his eyes out then started cheering.  Packers ended up losing in OT and it was back to crying again.    I enjoy coming here for good cheap food and the good vibes.   The cheesy bread appetizer is also very delicious.   I love how this place caters to local Hawaii people.   They serve steam rice and shoyu here,  and after not having any for a week,  it was heavenly.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very disappointed Packers fan after they lost the game in OT.  Poor guy was crying and his friends were trying to console him.

3ZW84g_jBbbtDHXD2N_wZA.text: Believe it or not, it's not easy to find local beers in Vegas. Most of the casinos have contracts with big distributers so they generally all carry the same beers from the biggest breweries. So if you want local, you have to seek them out.   Triple 7 is a restaurant/brewery located in the Main Street Station in downtown Vegas. They have a variety of standard bar type food (burgers, sandwiches, fried stuff) but they also have a sushi bar, which is cool.  But the best part in my opinion is that they brew their own beer. According to the menu they do a few hundred gallons at a time. When we dropped in they had 7 beers ranging from a pilsner to a stout so there's something for everyone. We did a taster and the styles were accurate and all very tasty. Great beers, all.   Lastly, this place is downtown so they aren't going to gouge you on the prices. I highly recommend this place.

FebCUEqxrl6Wb2P4BL3W7Q.text: Love this place! Everything from the food to the service and the awesome value of the dozen oysters during happy hour which are plump and delicious. You're obviously not getting a five star meal but it's great for a casino restaurant brewery. It's become a tradition before catching a show at the Smith Center and is a bit reminiscent of old Las Vegas before prices jumped. Thank you!

fb41Js9H7DuCEkQaIgQa7g.text: We came here on Thursday night (actually early Friday morning) at about 12:45AM after a late check-in at a nearby hotel.    I was expecting good pub food; however, I left completely unimpressed and really never want to go back again.    The restaurant looks great, has some good theming and looks welcoming.  In fact, the hostess that was on duty was really great as well. She was so sweet!  However, that is where it ended.  Our server had a significant attitude issue, and clearly did not want to be at work.  On the menu was a special beer, and we asked her what it was and she said "I'll have to go check with the back".  Then she stood there, wanting to take our drink order.  We asked her if she could go check, and then she left while letting out a huge sigh.  She was just really rude the whole night.  We ordered the bacon wrapped jalapenos (awesome).  We also ordered the pork chop platter and the Chicken Tender platter.  The chicken tenders were pretty good; however, the pork chops were very dry and actually really gross.  They had no flavor at all.  So, we hit about a 50/50 on the food; however, the service pushed us into the "never again" territory.

efCyVGDhbUShT-w7QnkKVw.text: Came to Triple 7 after playing some roulette at the Main Street Casino. Triple 7 is located inside of the Main Street Hotel and Casino, right next to the Garden Court Buffet. Every time that I have passed by it has always been super busy with a line of people waiting to get in. This time was no different, but our wait was only about 20 minutes.   The menu is quite large with a wide range of items ranging from fish and chips, to a wide range of sandwiches including reuben, philly cheese steaks and even pizza. I went with a reuben, well because it is my favorite sandwich in the world. It was quite a let down. The meat itself was still a little cold, and everything else was pretty dry. Nothing to rave about, but I've had worst reubens.  Others in my group had chicken tenders, pizza and fish and chips. It is pretty hard to ruin any of those dishes so everything was alright. I did not get an opportunity to try any of their micro brews, but will do if I ever find myself back at Triple 7.

3LYZxVs0kk7VTggj_K1T8Q.text: We've always liked coming here whenever we come to Vegas. They have very good beer and the food's real decent at a good price. But this time the bald bartender was a total jackwagon. He left our food up under the heat lamp at the kitchen for over 15 minutes while he b******* with another customer. Not to mention the rude temperament from the get-go. But I usually give people the benefit of the doubt initially. And hope that it will get better. Well it didn't. In fact when my burger funally got delivered to me one bite of it I told him he could keep it and I wasn't paying for it. And we  left I'll try them again next time hopefully we'll have better service. And hopefully that guy found a job that he doesn't have to deal with people.

ZqnEsMIi5PMKuiFWtpcYMA.text: Although there's lots of seating and tv's and cheap happy hour beer, the food is substandard and pricey. I ordered the San Francisco burger last night and my husband got the happy hour nachos that arrived with the top layer of chips burned and black and had an identifiable very salty, mushy meat that was most likely leftover pot roast from the buffet. My burger was supposed to be on buttered sourdough with swiss cheese, but arrived on dry,?cheap white bread with the cheese not even melted, and not even on the meat itself. The burger had no taste and was very small. $12.99! Yuck. I don't drink beer, but my husband liked the $2 & $3 beer at happy hour.

aUt9vAvOD6QgjGJ30X01dQ.text: Ended up going here about 11:30pm with my family. We were all hungry and needed some place that didn't close at midnight on a Sunday. It was surprisingly cleaner and better looking than I had expected. The menu had several options, which made it easy to find something for even the pickiest eater. I was not pleased with how hard they fried the calamari, but the sauce for it was tasty. I ordered the salmon, and it was cooked perfectly along with the mashed potatoes. The veggies were tasteless as they were extremely over cooked. The only thing they could definitely improve on was the service, as our waitress was hustling, but super slow. I could see she was trying but it took to long to get our drinks and appetizers. All in all I give this place a good overall rating. Even with the areas of needed improvement, the well cooked salmon made up for it!!

dXMzjVpiJXcU_zWk6TPRoA.text: Went here based on multiple recommendations from friends who have visited downtown over a few years and raved about it.  I stood at the host stand for several minutes while the host was looking around elsewhere.  When I finally got her attention I asked if I could sit at the bar since I was by myself.  Once at the bar, which only had about 5 customers, I waited for about 10-15 min with out even being acknowledged while they checked on the people who were already there and still had half of their drinks.  I finally just got up and left and went elsewhere.

02p0IH0HpTzAhsVH9o9w4g.text: This restaurant had a very good atmosphere. We came here to just eat and not drink. We ordered the Cuban sandwich which was very filling as well as an order of ribs. The ribs were neither here nor there. Half of the rack was very soft and juicy, the meat came right off the bone. But the other half was very chewy and difficult to eat. It wasn't too bad but it wasn't anything special that would make us come back again.

lCQm4Yw9b9bc-LxPqOtpbw.text: Wow old Fremont Street has really stepped it up! I was really excited to get to go to this little brewery! The wait was long but we kind of snuck in near bar area. They definitely needed to hire more staff. Great beer!!! we will be back!

5W4pjP8HQ7aMaWB7eLgwdg.text: Yelp failed me this time...I definitely wouldn't come back to eat here they have your average American food.  I describe the food as blah I saw the environment and the menu so I played it safe and ordered chicken and French fries...I didn't finish my meal kind of lost appetite and I came in extremely hungry wouldn't come back here in the future.

nh4ebf3Wbgg6R2jINq7dYg.text: We went to the bar at 777 Grill for their happy hour. It's a good one if you're downtown. $2.00 for their brew? Can't beat it. I wouldn't drive down here just for that but definitely a place to go if you're there between 3-6PM.   We had ordered their sweet potatoes and they were good. They serve them with ranch and a salsa ranch. The salsa ranch didn't taste like salsa but it was better then the regular ranch.   I love the "old" of many things and Main Street is one of those place you can just feel the history.

FTbWMhbjpqT68f7QQrz4FQ.text: The place you can get awesome happy hour deals at 5 am on a friday. The bartender is great he made me and my girlfriend's day! 5 stars!!

pO2ZWj2Q3ot4L19mp4tTyw.text: It's a busy place so make sure you don't come too hungry. Food is good though. The food item that really caught my attention was the "Deep fried cheesecake", it was heavenly! A must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W-1Ef9OoMEH9SCpyFkIXDg.text: I really enjoyed the food at Triple 7!  We did have to wait about 30 mins for a table, but it was a Friday night, so that can be expected. The sirloin steak I ordered was delicious and cooked perfectly. It came with very good green beans and a baked potato. It was also a good size for $15.99.   We also ordered raw oysters on the half shell that were pretty good (not as flavorful as the oysters in the South) and came with the usual horseradish, lemons, hot sauce, etc on the side. Six oysters for $9.99. =)  Our waitress didn't see us seated in her section for quite a while, which was getting frustrating, but we were seated in the corner out of view. Once she noticed us, she immediately made up for it with a very friendly personality and she made sure to get our food out to us very quickly, despite a packed restaurant. If you're in that area of Las Vegas, I highly recommend this restaurant!

XRfK0EWpJLPeiM6HK8od5A.text: At the Casino with family, they are hitting the machines pretty hard and well me, I've had enough, I'm hungry and I don't know when they gonna break for food, so I wondered into the Triple 7 for some lunch.    I wanted something light, as I figured we'd eventually end up at the buffet, so I ordered the San Fransisco Cobb salad.  It's served in a cheese tortilla bowl, with ice burg lettuce, some crumbled bacon, diced tomato and eggs and your choice of salad dressing.   I got the vinaigrette.  The salad was a decent size, however, the "cheese bowl" it was served in was a little stale, and the vinaigrette was too strong.  Service was good, I love the large glass they use for their beverages, no refill was needed it was so big.

NEBH25RGC9VWN6HOHysUhQ.text: Mmmm... Beer. Late night Vegas beer. I am a dark beer drinker, and their Black Chip porter is smooth and tasty. My father in law loves the Red and my wife gets the hoppy ale, close to an IPA. The food is pretty good, burgers, ribs and the like. Pizzas aren't anything special though. A few of the servers aren't good multitaskers, so if you are in more of a hurry ask the hostess about the server she is assigning you to. But go for a brewski! You'll be happy.

viX5D67_PYmo9a4dbnKz1w.text: My boyfriend and I decided to check this place out on Freemont. We didn't eat but the beer was pretty good! They had a nitro porter and you can order a flight. The beer prices were very affordable considering it's Vegas. It's a pretty cool hidden gem.

45poGY7nA_bPeXXzQwggtg.text: Good brewery. I tried the IPA--good quality. The food is good too. A fairly diverse menu. Hamburgers are good, nachos and wings were good too. Everyone in our group liked the trip to 777 for the beer and food. Give it a chance the next time you are in downtown Vegas. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full picture

CMFBWEvVjeKUn-XGIvT3qQ.text: This is our go-to as soon as we get Downtown after our flight in. Great appetizers, microbrews, and most importantly the prime rib will knock your socks off. Make sure to get some asparagus with that piping hot horse radish as well. Great place to watch sports and have a few beers!

2nK3kbscrS3WtuTWEW7UaA.text: It's been a long time since I've been here, so when my friends wanted to eat here before heading to First Friday (we try going to different places), I gladly accepted. There is a weekday Happy Hour, but we just missed it.  Also, don't depend on the website for prices, as they were slightly higher when I looked at the current menu.   There was quite a crowd- it's a popular spot. We went to the bar, and the hostess said she'd get us a table as they opened up, because nothing was open. So we went to the bar, which was about 75% capacity, when we arrived. And about 20 minutes later, it was full. My friend had a soda, and I had a glass of merlot (not bad)- for both drinks, it was less than $6. There was only one bartender- and he was busy. He was nice, though; he gave us the receipt so we could show it to the server, for a free refill on the soda.   So our friend got there and she got us a table (??? not sure but I think that the hostess forgot about us, because people kept coming inside, and getting tables). Our server was busy too. So we ordered 6 rolls (spicy tuna, california roll, caterpillar & philadelphia) and split them. The bill was $51- which between 3 people, plus tip, was $20 each- that wasn't bad.   I like that the restaurant space is very wide open and not dark at all- with a view of the brewery too. If you don't wanna wait, I suggest you get there early, especially on a Friday night. Lunch & Dinner menu has appetizers, salads, soups/chili, sandwiches, burgers, pizza, brewmasters favorites, dinner specials, & desserts. I don't drink beer so I can't tell you anything about it, except that the prices seem reasonable. The last time I was here (my previous relationship), I had the peel and shrimp bucket deal (it's pretty big). The casino itself is pretty smoky, FYI.

-otBdnfRDmlvg7w_zq8Nkw.text: Went here a couple of weeks ago late night with some friends. Service sucked! We had to constantly flag down our servers. I say servers because they kept taking breaks and switching out. The pizza was OK and the wings were fine.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. High Roller

RyBqAgRDOSTLUf40cw62Mw.text: Ah! This place is great! I have been meaning to come here for some time and a bunch of us decided to come after work recently. We didn't make it to the happy hour (boo) but everything was super inexpensive either way.  We tried all of the house brews; my favorite was the Red Lager. During happy hour I believe the beers cost $2.50. I think I paid about $4.00 dollars. What the heck? That is super cheap for a craft beer!   The food is good; we tried the sweet potatoes fries, garlic fries and Buffalo wings. Everything was super tasty, particularly the garlic fries and the wings. It is bar food though, so I would stick with burgers and appetizers.   I will be back real soon and will make the most of the happy hour.  On a side note, the casino is rather charming, in an old, western kind of way.

w6UaTrP-vZ5tFruUQCLx3A.text: Mediocre but certainly not bad.  Good appetizers - pot stickers and cheesy garlic bread.  3 in my party ordered burgers and all were happy.  I ordered the ribs - not great.  Beers were okay, especially the red.  The brewmaster special tasted like black coffee.  Pretty good service and very reasonable prices.

_kaXy7_3ApP_AUtgAOp0mw.text: Great place to enjoy a great steak or burger in Downtown Las Vegas!! Delicious and reasonably priced. Great for the boyfriend to catch up on all the ESPN he missed gambling.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye with Baked Potato and Rice
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib with Baked Potato and Vegetables

JGoHhKaUf664dUt3RLOerg.text: The burgers here are pretty darn good! It was a nice change from the fancy eating on the Strip. I really liked the margaritas here. Nice and frozen, just the way I like them. The wait staff was very friendly and helpful.

2g6VTq3gbvftu65_1-TuZw.text: Have lived here in Vegas for years and this is the first time I have eaten at Triple 7.  We sat at the Sushi bar and had Poke and the Sushi was delicious ( I recommend the Beach Roll).  My guy had one of their Micro brews, I am not a beer drinker, but had a sip and it was tasty.  I have had and we did have oysters on the half shelf, but this was a first for Tequila Oyster Shooters and I am definitely a fan.  Dinner was delicious and after a little walk Down Fremont Street we circled back and had dessert, highly recommend the Deep Fried Cheesecake.  Great service. Sushi chef was personable and funny.  I will be back!

a4Eqks6ui7CgZWQflKT89A.text: We originally selected this restaurant because we saw a billboard advertising sushi. When we arrived it was a straight up brewpub. They have sushi but after looking around at what the other customers were ordering I decided to go with the fish and chips. I was very happy with my choice. The fried fish was battered nicely and was flakey. The sushi at the tables around us looked clean and well presented. Triple 7 would be a good choice for a group who couldn't decide between traditional bar food or sushi. You can have both!

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool fry basket for the fish and chips.

f8hfJ0x_gnEzXBv_s---UA.text: Don't come here with a party of more than 4 especially if your planning on dining. There was a  party of 6 before us and triple 7 said they couldn't put tables together. When it was our turn, party of 7, triple 7 said the same thing. Our tables were next to each other but still didn't allow it us to put the tables together or closer to each other.  There are bar top seating also that should accommodate large groups if open.  They brew some really good beer which gives them some originality. There's also a sushi bar, weird because it gives you that typical bar feel but with sushi. Haven't tried the sushi, can't imagine it being any good but I wont know until I try them.  Food wasn't that bad but it didn't stand out as amazing. There was a chicken caesar salad which had too much cilantro. The prime rib plate came with choice of sides.  The prime rib was big but not the best cut of prime rib I've had.  There was a bunch of tough fatty pieces that was chewy. The bake potato was small and not so attractive and only came with packet sour cream and butter.  They also had a BBQ chicken breast and half rack of ribs combo.  Very delicious only suggestion is having the BBQ sauce on the side because it was spicy instead of sweet which they didn't mention.  I had their beers a long time ago. Can't judge them on it cause it was a long time ago and forget how it was. But local so that's a plus.  Large dining area, lots of seats and tv around so it doesn't fill crammed.  Good service and feels like a good place to chill and kick back a few brewskies.

3R9ztT_kTbZ1QZsTiBrCBQ.text: When you're in Vegas, sometimes you lose track of time when you're gambling.  That's exactly what happened to me a few days ago.  Next thing I know, it's past midnight and my last meal was around 3pm.  Because we were staying at California hotel & casino in downtown, we made our way to Triple 7.  We just crossed a bridge that connected to Main Street Station hotel -- very convenient because it was too hot to walk or drive outside.    This place has a bar and grill type feel to it.  In fact, you can see the microbrewery in the restaurant.  My brother claims that their beer has slightly more alcohol than regular beer.  He got their beer sampler for $5.99, which got him surprisingly buzzed, along with an order of nachos.  I ordered a teriyaki burger and the crab & artichoke dip.  My sister-in-law ordered buffalo wings and an italian sausage pizza.  My sister-in-law's cousin ordered the philly cheesesteak.    Little by little, the food came out and I was surprised at how big the portions were.  I truly didn't expect it from the prices whatsoever.  It was to the point where we contemplated on switching to a bigger table to have more space for all the plates.  The service was okay, though our server wasn't anywhere to be found when we needed her, but she was nice.    The crab & artichoke dip was great.  I didn't really taste the crab but it was super cheesy and it came with chips and garlic bread.  The buffalo wings were decent.  The italian sausage pizza was pretty decent also.  I love that they don't skimp on the cheese, whether it be on the nachos, my dip, or the pizza!  The teriyaki burger was nothing special.  I told the waitress I wanted it medium well but it seemed like I got it well done because it was dry.    Overall, this is a great place to hit up for appetizers and beer.  Cheap eats and great atmosphere.

ETx0rtdpOn_MbVD7H6jvmA.text: Second stop on our "Microbrew Mini Crawl".  This place is essentially a huge restaurant in the Main Street Casino.  Easy parking across the street & you get your 3 bucks back.  We shared a burger, it was average.  We also had a couple Irish Stouts.  The Triple 7's Irish stout was thinner and less sweet than Guinness stout.  For Las Vegas it seemed like a fairly good deal.  A 1/2 pound cheeseburger and fries and 2 draft stout beers for just under 16 bucks.

bClKGUzc1xvbzFWFJumkhQ.text: A Brewery inside a casino with an actual happy hour and good deals!! Originally if you wanted to leave a review you were lumped in to review the casino, rv park or other restaurants inside the Main Street Station. So I added a place to specifically review the brewery. The Heffy was really thick with a strong citrus taste.. Too thick in my opinion. The wheat beer had an awesome caramel taste and I loved it. We got the smothered chips which were decent, flat bread meat pizza which was good, California rolls and that was good, boneless chicken wings.. Meh they kinda sucked. I would highly recommend them coming here for a happy hour or to watch your sport on tv

tgJf7IIM2zTR-1stc7CPxQ.text: I finally got to check this place out after being invited out for a round of beer.  Mind you, the beer here is strong, but incredibly good.  I had one of their blueberry based beers, and it was like drinking a dessert.  Their microbrewery is huge, and is housed in an even larger room.  The layout is very, very classy, and best of all, no smoking, so I was able to enjoy my drinks even more.  The real winner for me was the crab and artichoke dip served with chips and garlic bread.  I'm a fan of both seafood AND dips, and this particular combination had me scraping the bowl for every last attainable morsel.   The service was also great.  The guy was on top of things, never obtrusive, but always around for a refill.  And when I looked at my final tab, the price was ridiculously cheap for what I ordered.  Quality foodstuffs for a really workable price.  Make no mistake, I was pretty comfortable by the time I strolled out of the place.  The beverages kicked in as we were leaving, and honestly, it was more the relaxed buzz variety than the staggering out, "please hold me up" type.  I attest that to the overall quality and flavor of the drinks.  I don't hear a lot of people talking about this place, and I don't know why.  It's certainly something to check out while adventuring on Fremont Street.

-fyNJe2i0AL02jdBK3lRMw.text: We were on a mission to find a delicious shrimp cocktail. Saw the reviews and made the trek off the main street into the 777.   Alas, the "cocktail" was four Jumbo Shrimp on a small plate with 2 tablespoons of cocktail sauce. And it was $11! We couldn't believe it was soo small & plain. When the menu said legendary we can say it was unforgettably sad. And so the search continues... Must say the Beer Battered Shrimp was a much better dish if you are craving shrimps. Service is good, the place is clean & modern and the selection of beers was impressive.

UNu8h5PvwJpvr1ghniL04A.text: Terrible for vegetarians. Me and hubby both hated our meals. We went there late night after work. The few items that sounded good were out of stock that night. We decided to get fries, shakes and breakfast. Both were whack..

pxzdFI3FEt6Y0yUwLSxeww.text: We had dinner at Triple 7 Brewpub on Friday 3/29/13. The environment is a wide-open lively bar atmosphere. Kind of fun! We ordered:  Korean Short Ribs ($6.99) - these was tasty ribs marinated in a soy-ginger sauce. Triple 7 Wings ($7.99) - these were yummy too Hawaii Roll ($13,99) - spicy tuna topped with ahi Spider Roll ($12.99) - softshell crab, avocado, cream cheese, cucumber.  The sushi wasn't the best sushi I've had, but it wasn't bad. For good quick food, we'll be back.

k8U8U33zkVGV4nV0UDviZQ.text: The food was good bar food we had calamari and some other stuff,  but their dark beer fell flat with me.  I was just not impressed.  It was not very flavorful and just made me sad as I had left Sin City at the Flamingo for this place and I should have stayed where I was.  But if you are in the area, based on other reviews, come on down as the food is not too expensive.    As I'm not a pale beer drinker, maybe that is better.

vjRWJhUqjBWA6A1VBUa33w.text: Arrived... Had to wait 30 min for a drink.... Then another 30 for our food ... Servers were nice enough and the food was pretty good.... Over the last 6 months that I have been going there this is the pattern..... Order then wait... Wait .... Wait

lyQxNX7vdUyjt5OJ6Uei8Q.text: Eh...  wasn't good wasn't bad. Service extremely slow. Not bet friendly. Don't think I'll come back

axBsqpm4TMufPToAkOH-IQ.text: It's a typical casino cafe with typical casino cafe food.   They do have a sushi bar, but it didn't look like something I wanted to try. I did buy a jug of beer from there and that was pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Triple 7 Restaurant & Microbrewery - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lLbChXy6INwWrgKcb6cKZQ.text: Cyndy's BOTTOM LINE:  Great micro beers and a good variety of appetizers.  We loved the battered fried green beans with wasabi sauce!  Great batter and fried golden brown.

qxPE0zK4iHxGUvT3D9I_fw.text: Great food awesome menu... Laid back and watch some march madness

KAb77iatO1YxXbwhnpFZuw.text: Was seriously underwhelmed with this place.  Based on reviews I was pumped and got a large group of guys to go down there.  The food was acceptable but where Triple 7 really let me down was the beer.  I went for the beer and tried some of their award winning microbrews and I was not impressed.

7wjSe9hOmh9JIDVBLdoXDg.text: Good beer although brewery tours are limited. Bartenders need to be more attentive and more knowledgable on local beers

TGye7YFw5kbpGIEqXu3kBw.text: Pretty good place, I prefer a quieter relaxed pub feel and this place is it. The calamari was great and so was service but I don't recommend the mushrooms appetizer because it was clearly frozen. Beer good to...

aWKY9E4ZdYulsMKL2LYPMQ.text: Really a great place.  The food is very good and amazingly inexpensive.  I had the foot long chili dog with French Fries and it was only $6.99!  Let me tell you, it was an incredible dog, the meat was so smooth and rich, like a veal sausage and the chili had big pieces of steak in it.  The beer was also top notch.  They are a microbrewery and they know their stuff.  I have been a few times and have always gotten the beer sampler flight which is a good deal for the price and the amount of beer.  The High Roller beer that I had tasted almost of butterscotch, very unique and good.  On the other had the cherry beer tasted of cough syrup which was not so good.  The only thing keeping this place from getting a 5th star is that the service is not great and the food took quite some time to get to us.  However, for the quality and the price, this place is hard to beat in downtown Las Vegas.

b49-33zwu6ptMF1i9-X3bQ.text: This was one of my favorite places to come in vegas during my college days trips to Vegas.  It has gone downhill a bit or maybe my tastes have become more sophisticated.  My rib dish was a big sloppy mess as though there was so much I thought they had given me a full rack it had too much fat and not much taste.  The beers was also not that great as though it has been around awhile it has not kept up with the better competition in the micro/craft beer space.  Plenty of tvs to watch the games on.

c-O2I74DSCQvkMEjSwaHzA.text: Best sushi ever and always fresh, service could be Alot better and the American food needs little work I hear... But the sushi is my reason I return and will keep returning.

6cgCczXwylN1ZKQuXUkFqQ.text: An observation:  casinos always serve very good food.  Triple 7 confirms that observation.  Perfect burgers, very good pizza, good chicken tenders and nachos..  Main Street Station is a friendly, comfortable casino...very good craps, best odds in LV.
